story:
Like us on Facebook www.facebook.com/hottestPixel

Welcome to the naked pixel project A collection of fine art nudes by JLP. We are currently working on a series featuring artistic nudes from 25 unique beautiful models. We are here today to try and raise money to offset the cost of our next shoot that'll take place in April. This is the fourth addition to the naked pixel series and it features a studio shoot with the beautiful Emma Anne.

We need your support to make this dream a reality so please have a look at our project here on Indiegogo. Contributions of any size are greatly appreciated and welcomed. If you can't donate but still want to help word-of-mouth is a great tool so spread the word.

The future of "the naked pixel"

Once we have finished the series our goal is to publish a coffee table style art book featuring never before seen images from the naked pixel collection. it will be produced in three formats. There'll be an enhanced e-book version, 10 x 8 and a high quality limited edition 13 x 11. The timeline for the 25 installments are lined up for 2 new projects per month between now and October or until we complete the last of the 25 additions. Each addition has its own rewards that will be completed with that specific projects timeline.

How your investment will be used.

Your investment will be used to offset the cost of studio rentals, hair and makeup, paying the model for gracing us with her nude form and of course fulfilling my obligations to you my backers. We are ready to start work on the next installment and with your continued support we will push forward with this project. Thanks for your pledges and support.

Like us on Facebook www.facebook.com/hottestPixel

Below are a few images from the shoot with Emma Anne.

below are a couple of images from the past 3 additions of the naked pixel to wet your whistle

The risk with this particular campaign is minimal to none, everything's already in place and ready to go. Experiences is King,

story:
What are the Family Jewels?

The Family Jewels is a large-scale sculptural installation inspired by 70’s-style string art that will debut at Burning Man 2015. Glowing with beacon-like brilliance against the night sky, the installation will stand in steady contrast to the piercing, pulsing Playa horizon. 

Unlike their monochromatic string-art predecessors, our plugged-in, amped-up, color-saturated gems will pack a visceral punch with glowing facets and miles of brightly colored strands. They will be a polychromatic vision during the day and emerge as glowing angles of colored, dancing light at night. 

The centerpiece is the Crown Jewel, a 12’ tall, four-sided faceted structure composed of triangular wooden “fins” resting on a geometric setting. The walls are coated with phosphorescent paint and glow brightly when exposed to UV or very bright light. UV-reactive glowing tubing wraps around and through the sculpture criss-crossing to create a radiating woven web of lacy geometric dimensional patterns. Edges are defined by LED lights that animate, illuminate, colorize and interact with visitors. Lay down face up on our specialized cart that is part Flintstones, part mechanic’s creeper for a fantastic full-color fluorescent view inside the Jewel. 

Flanking the Crown Jewel are two 15-foot tall “solitaires” — simple steel frames wrapped with over a mile of day-glow twine that creates an airy web of luminous color in the day and glows brilliantly at night. The solitaires will be lit by black light floods.

Angular shaped seating allows visitors to sit and stare or lean and gaze as they interact and enjoy the jewels.

Designs and Prototypes

The Jewels have evolved dramatically over the last eight months. Much discussion, exploration, testing of ideas, and many dead ends have brought us to the current designs. While building has begun, we will continue to test materials, and modify and adapt designs to ensure these jewels sparkle as brightly and safely as possible.


How expensive are these Jewels?

We have the motivation, the tools, and the skilled volunteers to execute our vision. Now we need to purchase the materials—the wood, steel, and LED lighting, the colorful webbing, UV reactive paint, and materials for the cart-and-track system that will whisk adventurous viewers inside the Crown Jewel.

Your generous donations will help us acquire what we need to make these gems a reality. It will also offset some of the cost of transporting and powering the installation. Every dollar that gets donated goes to add a little more sparkle to the Jewels. It’s all about the 5C’s - Color, Cut, Clarity, Carats, and CASH!

If we reach:

$7000 - we will enhance the LED lights and add more interactivity 

$8000 - will result in brighter lights, and additional smaller jewels

$9000 - we will use glow-in-the-dark laminate instead of paint for the Crown Jewel with more clarity and better color. 

Who are the Jewelers?

We have a dedicated and experienced all-volunteer team with a wide variety of skills. Among us are artists, builders, designers, dreamers, engineers, flaggers, multi-year burners, horticulturalists, techies, robot makers, and more. We are motivated and creative people who like to make beautiful things, to turn dreams into reality, and we choose to spend our weekends together creating something fantastic and unique for the world’s enjoyment. 

Todd Cooper, Lead Artist
Graphic Designer, Creative Director, Artist. Mayor’s Award, Autumn Lights Festival 2014, featured work at “Glow”at Exploratorium. 
5th yr Ranger, 2nd yr ARTery, Founding Shepherd, BAAAHS Artcar. 6th Burn.

Randy James, Construction Lead
Welding/Construction. Boy Scout Den Leader/Scout Master. 15 yr Haunted House creator. 2nd Burn.

Matt Fisher, Project Manager 
Clear Thinker. American Steel Studios Artist, curator, organizer. Project Manager. 4th yr ARTery. Founding Shepherd, BAAAHS artcar. Camp Leader. 6th Burn.

Tom Steele, Electrical/Safety Lead
PhD, Particle Physics. Works w lasers. 2 art cars. Founding Shepherd, BAAAHS Artcar. VICE Camp Co-lead. 2nd yr ARTery. 14th Burn.

James Bobowski, Technical Lead
Software engineer, Indiegogo. Jan '15: Cognitive Technology, Exploratorium. Burning Man '13: Mens Amplio. Skilled with LEDs, sensors, controllers, electronics. m0xy art incubator in Oakland. 3rd Burn.

Michele Laskowski, Volunteer Coordinator
Horticulturalist, Hobbyist, Flagging in the Park Organizer, fanner, Multi-year Burner. 

Melesio Nunez, Construction
Fabricator Extraordinaire, Builder, Photographer, Artist. Founding Shepherd, BAAAHS Artcar. Founder, Happy Shower Camp, 10-year Burner. 

Zack Shivers, Technical Advisor
Electrical engineer, avid maker, creator of robots. 3 yrs with theme camp, 4th burn.

Jay Egger, Construction Advisor/Hula Hooper
Contractor, Builder, Creative Thinker. Likes to lend a hand. Old-School Burner.

More than Bling-Bling for Burning Man

Although the Family Jewels will provide an eye-catching colorful oasis and respite at Burning Man, they will sparkle off-Playa as well. They will appear at Pink Saturday’s AfterGlow, the Autumn Lights Festival at the Botanical Gardens in Oakland, and possibly in the National AIDS Memorial Grove in Golden Gate Park later this year. We are hopeful that these Family Jewels will get around and will flash at as many people as possible, bringing joy to all.


Risks and Challenges

Gems as fine as these are formed under intense pressure, and our Jewelers are up to the challenge. While much work lies ahead, we feel we are well positioned to make this project sparkle. Since this is our first installation at Burning Man, we have kept our scope in check so that the results are fabulous. (Think dazzling solitaire versus diamond-encrusted four-finger ring.) Our group has the expertise needed, and since we are based at American Steel Studios in West Oakland, we have resources nearby should we need any outside assistance.


Ways You Can Help

Financial support is a Jeweler’s best friend, but If you can't fund this project, there are other ways to contribute:

  • Help us get the word out and support our campaign. Share this page, share the project, come see us at Pre-Compression, and like us on Facebook. Volunteer for one of the build days. They will be enjoyable. 
  • Help us out at our weekly builds. Bring your skills and your knowledge or your will to learn and we can put you to work.
  • If you are in the Bay Area, come see us on June 20 at Pre-compression in Oakland, or check our Facebook page for details about our Costume Swap Fundraiser on July 19th at Oasis. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share these Jewels. Help make something beautiful happen!

  • www.facebook.com/FamilyJewelsProject


A Note from Todd Cooper (Team Lead) aka Ranger Mucho

This will be my 6th trip to the playa. I go to Burning Man because it’s the best week I have enjoyed as an adult, and the experience has been a huge catalyst for growth and change in my life. It motivated my partner and I to leave a great life in NYC and venture to a coast where there seemed to be a wellspring of folks that were like-minded soul-searchers looking for something different, better, exciting, and something with a deeper connection and meaning. 

Time on the playa is a chance to recharge, break down perceptions, lighten a load, connect deeper, and to build dreams and share them with some amazing people.

Each trip to the Playa is an experience that affects me deeply and changes me, often a small shift, sometimes a huge change…but always in a better direction. As the mother of my burning man godmother once told me, “...for every time in life when I went out of my boundaries and beyond my abilities into the unknown, I told myself that it was forward movement and that the direction was a right one.” Three and a half years into life on the West Coast, Miss Vicki’s words still ring true.

The Family Jewels is built by an ever-growing group of remarkable and generous folks. We hope our gift will catch your attention and charm, engage, and inspire you to head in a new direction.

Thank you for supporting us and supporting our efforts...Forward movement, indeed!

I am Vermonty_Python: Moderator, creator, and Glorious Supreme Leader of /r/SandersForPresident - one of the largest online grassroots communities devoted to raising awareness and support for Independent Senator Bernie Sanders and his potential bid for Presidency in 2016.

I've created this campaign in order to raise money for purchasing advertisement-space on Reddit, in the hopes that we can generate additional traffic to the subreddit, Reddit is one of the largest social media websites in the world, and it is our goal to use it as an effective grassroots tool in the upcoming election.

Please note: This fundraiser is NOT raising money to be donated to Bernie Sanders or his campaign. Nor will the advertisement be bought on behalf of them. It is for our SUBREDDIT only.

If you haven't done so already, please visit www.reddit.com/r/SandersForPresident to learn more.

Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

I am an emerging photographic artist and educator based out of the Phoenix, Arizona area. My artistic research explores the human/nature relationship specific to ideas of mortality, human animality, and the psychological manifestation of the anima.

I was invited to the research residency to study the topic of death called Mortem at Ayatana in Canada this Fall. This residency could not be more perfect for my practice! Attending this residency will not only provide insight to my creative endeavors, but enable forward momentum in ongoing and new bodies of work.

The Mortem residency provides housing and meals in addition to daily research activities a few of which are: visiting a taxidermist studio, learning about traditional and new eco-burial processes, studying 17th century Vanitas collection at the National Gallery of Canada, and a demonstration of hypnosis and past-life regression.

The relatively fast timeline means limited opportunities to access funds for my travel,  so  this Studio Sale was designed to help me get there!

 

What We Need & What You Get 

  • The residency will cost $1400, and travel will cost at least $600
  • You can get a unique work of art from one of two bodies of work! 
  • Choose from: 

Dissimulation series of lumen bird prints - $50 - 8x10 or 11x14 signed unique silver-gelatin print

Anamorphosis series of coyote ambrotypes on mirror- $100 - miniature up to 4x5 framed or $150 - full plate up to 8x10 framed piece 

*Price includes free shipping anywhere in the U.S. and will arrive by mid December*

The Impact

As an artist who is still early on in my career, it is vital for me to continue the growth of my practice through residencies, especially cross-disciplinary programs like Art Ayatana Artist Research Program.

This experience will challenge me to push my work in new directions, while also allowing me the opportunity to share ideas with like-minded artists and specialists from around the world.

Additionally, through this residency,  my work will be exposed to a greater audience of patrons, artists, educators and gallerists.

 

Risks & Challenges

With the tight timeline, it will be a challenge  to reach this goal by the October deadline, which is in under two months. So please consider supporting me by contributing as well as sharing this campaign.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends, coworkers, family members, or anyone who has an affinity for birds and coyotes, likes supporting emerging artists and purchasing affordable original artwork. Thanks!

story:
Girl meets tumor. Tumor leaves girl. Girl decides the best revenge is to start living after 10 years of reviewing foreclosure documents & a lifetime of wanting to do something with design.

When the surgeon was trying to convey the severity and size of my brain tumor he let it be known that it was larger than a lemon. On the other side of surgery & recovery, the dots slowly started to connect themselves & I went hunting for other "lemons" in need of a transformation.

First order of business: say goodbye to a few things that didn't quite turn out as expected. Best plan of action: have some fun via a few art projects & hope doing so will help build a bridge to wherever I may be headed next.

Where you come in: By purchasing any of the perks you are helping to create a gust of wind big enough for first flight. With your help, you are gifting me the opportunity to try something new, learn from it & connect with people along the way.

Big Thanks to those who helped me get here: John & the Taft family. Pics: Daniel at Asheville Darkroom & Atomic Furnishings. Music: Nic Bommarito  & Jahzzar

((Side note: We are not on social media. Our hearts just aren't in it. This venture is relying solely on old-fashioned human connection and word of mouth. Potentially calamitous & awkward, we know - but the dice we are rolling))

(I use both "I", "we", & "our" because this project could not have made it this far without a tremendous amount of help & collaboration from John.)

 

 

 

 

 

ADDITIONAL PICTURES

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Almost all of the funding will go towards the production of the perks, shipping, & fees.
  • To get a better idea of size & scale of the items please see the video around the 2 minute mark.
  • The Little Lamp night light needs an extension cord if you plan to use it on a table. Extension cord is NOT included.
  • Costs involved: wood, stain & paint, sand paper,paint brushes, LED lights & cords, glass, fabric, lampshade backing, printing, packaging & shipping, labor.
  • In the event we somehow come out ahead, any overage will go towards things like tools, software, and materials for future projects.

Risks & Challenges

  • We are building a workshop/art studio ourselves this summer; this could speed up or slow down production.
  • The October estimated delivery date is our worst-case date. We suspect things will ship much sooner. However, we have backed a few projects and know that keeping the fulfillment deadline can be tricky . Since this our first campaign, we figured in plenty of wiggle room.
  • Unforeseen disruptions in supply of materials
  • Unsteady hands (Thankfully, John is helping me with the power tools & is a carpenter by trade)
  • It should be noted, if not obvious, that I'm not trained in any of this.
  • If you've read this far: thank you & your impressive attention span.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • As stated above, we are relying solely on old-fashioned human connection and word of mouth. If your heart feels compelled to share, in any form, please go about it :-)

Thanks again! -Mollie Brewer

Risks & Challenges

We are building a workshop/art studio ourselves this summer; this could speed up or slow down production.
The October estimated delivery date is our worst-case date. We suspect things will ship much sooner. However, we have backed a few projects and know that keeping the fulfillment deadline can be tricky . Since this our first campaign, we figured in plenty of wiggle room.
Unforeseen disruptions in supply of materials
Unsteady hands (Thankfully, John is helping me with the power tools & is a carpenter by trade)
It should be noted, if not obvious, that I'm not trained in any of this.
If you've read this far: thank you & your impressive attention span.


Other Ways You Can Help
As stated above, we are relying solely on old-fashioned human connection and word of mouth. If your heart feels compelled to share, in any form, please go about it :-)
Thanks again! -Mollie Brewer

story:
Hello!
My name is Nicole, I am a painter living and working in Baltimore. I graduated from Maryland Institute College of Art with a BFA in Drawing in 2013. Since I have dedicated my time to traveling, lifting heavy things, drinking too much coffee, and painting about it all.   

This past year I have been fortunate enough to spend 6 months as an artist and resident at The Wassaic Projects in Wassaic, NY. Beforehand, I spent a month traveling through Europe with my sketchbook - hitting up Berlin, London, Amsterdam, Venice, and Copenhagen. Embarking on this solitary journey opened my eyes to underdeveloped concepts within my work that had been struggling to burst from tiny, planted, bulbs I had only begun to water. I used the time and space provided by the Wassaic Project to explore, experiment, and unearth these ideas...

And I want to do it again! 

Starting in August I will be at Vermont Studio Center (VT), Lighthouse Works (NY), and Glogauair (Berlin!). Through this journey I will continue exploring ideas of intimacy & isolation (or the opposite); material and mark-making; indulgence and restriction, as well as learn from new surroundings and the people I will meet. I will make lots of drawings! I will make lots of paintings! I will explore the world! 

It'll be great, basically. 

But I need your help! 

My paintings reflect a desire to be alive. They are a visual recording of the primal, sensual, and sometimes violent need to be with others. Through this campaign I will continue the critical journey my previous travels have only begun to pathe. I will afford the costs of continuing to push, prod, and respond to the tensions I have recently uncovered within my work. Ultimately, I will gain valuable experience in education, experimentation, and the opportunity to challenge themes of self, community, and sociability within my work. 

You can find out more about me and my art here: http://nicoledyerart.com or https://www.instagram.com/steakbagel/ here! 

And more on my residencies here: 
Vermont: https://vermontstudiocenter.org
Lighthouse Works: https://www.thelighthouseworks.com/apply/
Glogauair: https://glogauair.net/residency/


Heres what I need: 

If this project reaches its goals at minimum it will fund my residency fee for Glogauair in Berlin. I am fortunate enough to be able to attend Vermont Studio Center and Lighthouse fully funded, but Glogauair does not offer scholarship. I feel that the opportunity to live abroad is worth the money and so I want to make it possible. The residency fee for Glogauair is 900E a month. The residency provides housing, studio, monthly critique, an open studios event for the public, and additional programming is possible. The euro is currently worth $1.12 so my monthly cost would be approximately $1007.41 per month. To cover the cost of the residency I would need to raise $3021. 

IF all of you amazing people were able to help me raise ABOVE my asking funds they would cover my travel costs via Uhauls (~$400), car rentals (~$250), flight tickets (~600), SUPPLIES (tooo much $$), a few snacks along the way (FEED ME), my stupid loan bill ($340), shipping work back from EU (who knows!?!), and any additional traveling open to me (Paris!).


But m not gonna expect y'all to throw your hard earned $$ at me for nothing...

Im excited to be offering several PERKS for the funds! Ranging from a lovely doodled postcard, to a commissioned painting. Theres something for you all! Check it out over there >>>>

With your generous support I'll be able to live my BEST LIFE  (without starving) and gain the opportunity to unfold, experience, and grow - and you'll receive something nice to look at - lovingly created by me! COOL
 

Cant Donate? that's cool! Heres how you can help -   
Please share with your friends, art loving grandparents, cool aunt, anyone!! I really appreciate it!

story:
THIS IS A CROWD-SOURCE’D OPEN CONTRIBUTION PROJECT X PROJECT


Lineup(times subject to shuffling until May):

CLOSE TO CONSIDERATION

ENDLESS TAILE

EARTH//BOUND

THE OK OKs

HAD MATTER [Dropping their new EP]!

CHET DABROWSKI IV

WEATHERHEAD

THE LAST PARIAHS

FUNKBOT

301 HIPHOP COLLECTIVE

SON OF NUN

We're putting together a Bernie PARTY during the DNC Democratic National Convention! FDR Skatepark is booked and we're ready to kick it!

Shout out to Black Lives Matter and all the work they've done in the past few years!


We know this is the dividing day if Bernie or Hillary get the Democratic Party Nomination and my my my what a crazzzy race it has been so far! We wanna make sure we're as loud as we can be when Bernie wins! THIS IS THE BERN BASH!

Recruiting all hands and bands! Vendors! Promoters! Lemme know if you wanna get involved! We’re socialists and we wanna share this everywhere.

Price is FREE! We wanna make admission open access and free to the general public, but to do this we need to raise some serious fundage!!! Help the community out, help the world out--more concrete for the hardworking Do-It-Yourself crew that's been doing .~'amazing~. work throughout the years and tying into their wishlist of building a new concrete bowl in the marvelous skatetopia.


Do yourself a favor and take a few days off for the party. This is a historic moment and you don't wanna miss out! TELL ALL YOUR FRIENDS!


#TheBernBash#500000inphilly

What We Need & What You Get

  • The large majority of all funding will be going to the FDR crew to build a new concrete bowl. Super dope cause am I right? If you don't skate, FDR is the Do-It-Yourself DREAMWORLD of East Coast skateboarding and it's constantly expanding with little donations of concrete and talent, and we wanna make sure that The Bern B(A)SH leaves mad respect for the homies that do the good work and were so kind to let us use their hometurf.


  • We need to raise $4,000 in order to book an amazing Amatuer Pro-Wrestling show, ring and everything. $3,000 to make sure we have an amazing Sound Stage. This people’s party is going to be INSANE.

  • All funds that are remaining will be distributed among bands and performers for their time, travel, and talent and.. if -god forbid- anybody gets arrested at this thing.

╗The Impact

This campaign is about throwing the craziest, biggest party imaginable for Bernie taking the nomination of the Democratic National Convention. We want to be in Philadelphia when it happens, and to be able to link up and network with people from everywhere ushering in an entirely different kind of America. This is about linking struggles of so many different people together and a chance for us to build on what brings us together, and we’re going to have MADDDD fun doing it.

Frontline MCs are former Occupiers and continual activists Chris Siennick (Harrisburg PA represent!) and Max Neely (Unrelenting Frederick MD!)

Risks & Challenges


  • I feel like the obstacles that we’re going to face is that there are so many fans of Bernie that don’t know where to plug-in to campaigns that directly confront and act on issues that they are struggling with. We want to make sure that everybody has an opportunity to share and feel safe when they step up.

  • We want to start opening the playing field to more people, we want to tap into as many talents as possible, what we’re doing with this moment in time is creating the most entertaining mash-up as a carnival of amazing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Make sure to share this around to all your Bernie friends and anyone you know who says they’re a socialist, anarchist, or activist! We’re making this as inclusive as possible and we want to include YOU. Get out there in Philly and kick off the REVOLUTION with a bang!

story:
Draka needs help Relocating to her new HOME

Some of you may remember Draka the Dragon from her early days at Burning Man, others may know her from the infamous Art Car Parade in Houston. Many love her and wish to see her doing all that she does so well AGAIN ~ It’s been fifteen years since Draka cruised the Black Rock Desert at Burning Man for her very first time. It was the year of the Chinese Metal Dragon, the theme of the event was the Body. She was Spirit for that Body. Since then, Draka has made many appearances in the Houston Art Car Parade; participated in Burning Flipside as well as at FanFest of Austin in 2012; and most recently whowed the masses at Austin Mini-Maker Faire last May.

OUR GOAL is to  address Draka's mechanical issues and transport her to a new home. We've had a great response and several offers for dragon residence possibilities -  the Woodzie Festival in New Braufels, private landowners in Dripping Springs, Thigh High Gardens in San Marcos amongst others are being considered. But our final destination is yet to be determined...

What We Need

Refurbishing has begun, and this time Draka has only been sitting idle since May - So not so much is needed. Our primary goal is to raise enough funds to pay for our TRANSPORTATION EXPENSES from Austin to ? ~ And because her transmission is in rough shape, and we only have a minimal amount of time, we will have to hire a trucking company to tow her.

Here is a list of other things the dragon still needs, and your donations will help us fund: Transmission, brakes, exhaust leak, and cracked windshield repairs, as well as replacement of battery, shocks, fluids, fuel neck hose, and several tires.

IF we raise funds above & beyond our goal of $2500 we would see to it that ~
Draka blows FIRE again! with new propane hoses, a pancake air compressor, and full propane tanks! In addition, we would purchase the following: New Light fixtures & electrical - inside & out, floor coverings, paint, and 10-kw generator.

If you would like to donate any of the above items directly to the project please email us for our ship to or drop off addresses in Austin and San Antonio - thanks!

What You Get

Draka patches and stickers for a donation of $25-50.
Draka T-Shirts! Finally available with a donation of $100 or more...
[see photos in the Gallery]

The Impact

Your donations will contribute to keeping this incredible art car legend Alive! So the masses can continue to enjoy Draka in all her moods and hues...

Our Challenge...

For years our challenge has been in locating a permanent home for Draka. A place where she can be cared for and sheltered and not pushed from location to location like a lost cat or orphaned child. If you know anyone who can help in the continual care-taking and maintenance of this lovely beast please contact us immediately.

Other Ways You Can Help

Volunteer to assist with the move! If you're a mechanic interested in dragon taming you are certainly needed! Contact us, the dragon needs your lovin!

story:
(The above campaign video focuses on where the money will be spent as we thought it important that you know where your money is going. It explains how the money will be used over the next 18 - 24 months. The written story and the links below focus more on why we are passionate about our mission.)

We’re raising money to turn our current Loafi.com website, over the next 18 - 24 months, into an interactive, user-friendly, online marketplace like none other selling visual art.  The website will be coupled with a matching mobile app for purchasing agility.  We want to connect people who like freshly made art with the visual artist in an environment that will help the people who like art choose and purchase what they like confidently and efficiently.  We will take the online art shop one step further than just introducing artwork and genres.  We will help the buyer get to know the artists; develop and track their own personal art preferences; and help introduce them to new artists and genres through analytics. We find our artists through a grassroots effort, most of whom have no internet presence at all, and support them to share their work safely and profitably without a business degree or web management skills.  We sign people up who like art, regular people, who want to own or give something other than commercially generated art.  We have taken our site as far as we can. We require a bit of professional development and design help. We need a push to get to the next level for the artist and those who like art.  We need a cash infusion into our current efforts to get freshly made original visual art back into the “arts and sciences” for everyday people.

Our mission: Loafi.com is dedicated to providing a community where people who like art can purchase unique, original art to own and give, and where artists can get help one-on-one to develop their talent into an economically viable business. Artists create, others appreciate; we nurture this connection and help with most everything else.

So here is the bottom line and the long story.  We know you are busy, so feel free to read one or both.  We have put in a lot of years and hard work into what we are doing and will take it to the next level – with your help over the next 18 - 24 months.

Bottom line - our goals include:

·  Support visual artists to make a living utilizing their talent, starting with, but not limited to “undiscovered” artists, especially women artists

·  Help more people enjoy the societal, emotional and intellectual benefits of original art by making freshly made original visual art readily available and affordable via user-friendly methods

·  Employ people, over time, who need flexible work schedules, flexible work environments, supportive team environments and/or need to build work history while life is happening, i.e. artists, vets, caregivers, stay-at-home parents, retirees, students

We have our 5-year, big picture, business plan and our day-to-day, operational action plans prepared, and started, with methods, processes and techniques in place to support our team, the loafsters, in the field. We are on our way, but we need a financial boost to finish and maintain the interactive, user-friendly, marketplace website and mobile app. We want to be THE online mart for unique, original art. And, we want to get going before a money-laden person and/or organization steals our idea purely for profit … we know, it’s a slightly paranoid statement, but the art world has a lot of money surrounding it and we want to control the win for the artists, the loafsters and everyday people who like art. We’re in it for the long haul, but we really need a boost right now. Any amount will help.


Long Serious Story

The Long Serious Story starts with Mama Loaf. Mama Loaf graduated from high school in 1950 starting an art degree at the University of Minnesota. After repeated pestering from others in her life (a common occurrence for women at that time in history), she switched to a nursing degree and became a Registered Nurse. Educated women were expected to become a teacher, nurse or other “temporary” position until they were married, then stay at home with the children and take care of her husband and the household. Even then, the perspective was "what respectable person in our society became an artist?" Certainly, there was no money to be made in such a career that doesn’t really “do” anything.  A “starving artist” was generally the expected outcome. Well, Mama Loaf, as a nurse, ended up raising two children alone following a divorce. After 40 years, she picked up the charcoal again. Few of her early charcoal drawings exist, because of multiple moves and a shortage of space on the moving trucks. At one point, her family’s books were more important than her drawings.  Mama Loaf is our inspiration and the reason for our resolve. After speaking with hundreds of artists over the past 14 years and researching art’s impact on our world, we decided there must be a way to make our idea of a win-win-win work. We are doing just that. But, we need your help to keep on keeping on.

While the well-researched reasons that underlie this mission started with Mama Loaf, the larger picture reasons presented themselves pretty quickly.  Original visual art, itself, is an important aspect of our culture, our heritage, and our history.  The artists, or those who create, are a critical part of our collective past, present and future. Visual artists create art that defines our current state of affairs. No matter who you are, what you do, or where you live, artists are one of us. Owning and giving original art in efforts to support these artists who define us needs (yes, needs) to become an everyday occurrence. Artists supply a product in original art that is a crucial part of our society and deserve to be paid accordingly through the sales of their original art. Women artists especially need a helping hand. In 2012, of the top 500 artists sold by value, 19 were women. That’s 3.8%. In 2012, none of the 100 highest grossing art auction sales included a female artist. In 2012, of the top 86 most highly visited solo art exhibitions in the U.S, 26% were shows by women artists. Program enrollment for a Master of Fine Arts is typically 65 %-75% female, yet 70% of gallery space belongs to art by men. We are here to help women where we can. We are here to help all artists regardless of their training in art. Where are all the women artists, regardless of training? … Women, more times than not, are responsible for child-rearing, elderly parent care and other care-giving roles which remove or delay them from money-making opportunities.  Oftentimes, when the time to move into an increased money-making situation occurs, the timing in life demands that women drop out of their art careers to care-give and/or to get a “steady” job that pays the ever present bills that are often associated with care-giving. Family comes first. We are here to make a difference for these women. While half of our mission is to individually assist all artists in developing their talent into an economically viable business, the other half of our mission is to enhance everyone’s life through original art. Original art is as individually important to owners as it is societally significant. Children and adults of all ages benefit psychologically and intellectually from viewing and experiencing original art.  Our culture, our brain function and our economy are all enhanced when we own original art. We believe an interactive, user-friendly, online marketplace is an important part of supporting our goals.

Our mission, our legacy … your legacy … should you choose to help us, to join us, is dedicated to providing people with unique, original art to own, give and pass down to our next generations while assisting visual artists in developing their talents into an on-going economically viable business.

Artists create … others own and give … artists gain ... we all gain.

We at Loafi.com have developed the necessary methods, processes and techniques to successfully accomplish our goals. We have put them in play, but need a boost for the next steps. We are financially committed, but need additional funding to finish, first and foremost, our interactive, user-friendly website, and matching mobile app. Any amount will help us accomplish this over the next 18 - 24 months.

Bottom line - our goals include:·  Support visual artists to make a living utilizing their talent, starting with, but not limited to “undiscovered” artists, especially women artists·  Help more people enjoy the societal, emotional and intellectual benefits of original art by making freshly made original visual art readily available and affordable via user-friendly methods·  Employ people, over time, who need flexible work schedules, flexible work environments, supportive team environments and/or need to build work history while life is happening, i.e. artists, vets, caregivers, stay-at-home parents, retirees, studentsWe have our 5-year, big picture, business plan and our day-to-day, operational action plans prepared, and started, with methods, processes and techniques in place to support our team, the loafsters, in the field. We are on our way, but we need a financial boost to finish and maintain the interactive, user-friendly, marketplace website and mobile app. We want to be THE online mart for unique, original art. And, we want to get going before a money-laden person and/or organization steals our idea purely for profit … we know, it’s a slightly paranoid statement, but the art world has a lot of money surrounding it and we want to control the win for the artists, the loafsters and everyday people who like art. We’re in it for the long haul, but we really need a boost right now. Any amount will help.Long Serious StoryThe Long Serious Story starts with Mama Loaf. Mama Loaf graduated from high school in 1950 starting an art degree at the University of Minnesota. After repeated pestering from others in her life (a common occurrence for women at that time in history), she switched to a nursing degree and became a Registered Nurse. Educated women were expected to become a teacher, nurse or other “temporary” position until they were married, then stay at home with the children and take care of her husband and the household. Even then, the perspective was "what respectable person in our society became an artist?" Certainly, there was no money to be made in such a career that doesn’t really “do” anything.  A “starving artist” was generally the expected outcome. Well, Mama Loaf, as a nurse, ended up raising two children alone following a divorce. After 40 years, she picked up the charcoal again. Few of her early charcoal drawings exist, because of multiple moves and a shortage of space on the moving trucks. At one point, her family’s books were more important than her drawings.  Mama Loaf is our inspiration and the reason for our resolve. After speaking with hundreds of artists over the past 14 years and researching art’s impact on our world, we decided there must be a way to make our idea of a win-win-win work. We are doing just that. But, we need your help to keep on keeping on.While the well-researched reasons that underlie this mission started with Mama Loaf, the larger picture reasons presented themselves pretty quickly.  Original visual art, itself, is an important aspect of our culture, our heritage, and our history.  The artists, or those who create, are a critical part of our collective past, present and future. Visual artists create art that defines our current state of affairs. No matter who you are, what you do, or where you live, artists are one of us. Owning and giving original art in efforts to support these artists who define us needs (yes, needs) to become an everyday occurrence. Artists supply a product in original art that is a crucial part of our society and deserve to be paid accordingly through the sales of their original art. Women artists especially need a helping hand. In 2012, of the top 500 artists sold by value, 19 were women. That’s 3.8%. In 2012, none of the 100 highest grossing art auction sales included a female artist. In 2012, of the top 86 most highly visited solo art exhibitions in the U.S, 26% were shows by women artists. Program enrollment for a Master of Fine Arts is typically 65 %-75% female, yet 70% of gallery space belongs to art by men. We are here to help women where we can. We are here to help all artists regardless of their training in art. Where are all the women artists, regardless of training? … Women, more times than not, are responsible for child-rearing, elderly parent care and other care-giving roles which remove or delay them from money-making opportunities.  Oftentimes, when the time to move into an increased money-making situation occurs, the timing in life demands that women drop out of their art careers to care-give and/or to get a “steady” job that pays the ever present bills that are often associated with care-giving. Family comes first. We are here to make a difference for these women. While half of our mission is to individually assist all artists in developing their talent into an economically viable business, the other half of our mission is to enhance everyone’s life through original art. Original art is as individually important to owners as it is societally significant. Children and adults of all ages benefit psychologically and intellectually from viewing and experiencing original art.  Our culture, our brain function and our economy are all enhanced when we own original art. We believe an interactive, user-friendly, online marketplace is an important part of supporting our goals.Our mission, our legacy … your legacy … should you choose to help us, to join us, is dedicated to providing people with unique, original art to own, give and pass down to our next generations while assisting visual artists in developing their talents into an on-going economically viable business.Artists create … others own and give … artists gain ... we all gain.We at Loafi.com have developed the necessary methods, processes and techniques to successfully accomplish our goals. We have put them in play, but need a boost for the next steps. We are financially committed, but need additional funding to finish, first and foremost, our interactive, user-friendly website, and matching mobile app. Any amount will help us accomplish this over the next 18 - 24 months.

story:
SUMMARY
Hi I’m Patrick Fisher and I’m the creator of Gamut.  Gamut is about healthy lifestyles and creativity, staying active and fit in a variety of ways, and surrounding yourself with others who do the same.  In college, I studied business/economics and philosophy, and found a passion for personal training, music, and art. This mix led to the creation of Gamut and now my new goal of opening The Gamut Compound. We call it The Compound for short.

That's where Barrett Colvin comes in.  We met at a local screen printing warehouse and realized we share a passion for art, fitness, good vibes, and super cheesy old hardcore metal! He has been an in-house designer at Neff Headwear since 2011 and he is a freelance designer for many more big hitters including Beloved, Epitaph, and Into The AM.  He also has his own clothing line called The Feed. Barrett wanted more than the typical office work grind and we both have wanted our own spot for a while now.  We talked about collaborating and recently decided to pull the trigger. 

OUR MISSION

This campaign is about establishing an environment to create art, hang out, and connect with others, but we need your help to make this dream a reality. The Compound will be a fun workspace to chill, meet people, have art shows, gatherings, movie nights, you name it. The Compound is a place to unlock our unlimited creative potential.

Your contributions will mean so much to us. As some of you may know already, I decided a few years back that I would create my own way independent of the status quo. It has given me a huge sense of freedom and confidence. It has been my dream for years to have a place where people can go and feel that way too. The Compound is that place. We can create the best art, talk with each other, bring back that human element and connection here, with no judgment. The Compound is for people who want to learn from one another; for freethinkers and artists at heart. Please consider contributing to this movement and watch it snowball.  We need your help!

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

We have a bunch of renovations to do to make the compound look legit! We need
funds for couches, projectors, art supplies, electrical work, etc. Anything helps. And straight up, we are giving out amazing gifts of art, apparel, and headwear in exchange for your donations! Go check out the perks!


We have a fundraising goal of $10,000 which sounds like a lot but in any construction project or renovation these funds go quickly. An example of one thing we are doing is building a wall and railing to ensure that the mezzanine is complete and safe. "The mezzy" is a great place to work, relax, read a good book or create art and music.


THE IMPACT
We want you to be a part of this amazing place. With your donations, you are supporting our dream of cultivating and reviving art and a sense of community. We are moving forward no matter what, but with your help we can make The Compound the best place in town, and of course you’ll get some really cool stuff for your contributions! 

Getting The Compound started is a risk that is greatly outweighed by the feeling of fulfillment and support from those of you encouraging us to pursue this common goal. 

We will give back when this initial project is done. At The Compound we plan to host charity events and fundraisers to help with various causes, revive the art scene, and hopefully to inspire each other to be more positive and gain perspective.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
We need couches, art supplies, furniture, workers to help with repairs and painting, 
a fridge, drafting tables, PB and J sandwiches for energy and so much more!
Anything you can help out with even if you can’t contribute financially would be greatly appreciated! Thank you so much for all of the support over the last few years, and for helping make The Compound a reality.

story:
Thanks to the generous support of our contributors so far…….

*******************We've reached our goal!**********************

***************Let's raise the goal to $2,200!******************

Now that all building, installation and costume costs are covered it's time to consider the less glamorous aspects of the performance such as event insurance ($400!), event permits, and fundraising fees (4-7%). Equally as important, however, is the ability to offer a small token of appreciation to all the artists and performers involved. It's not much ($100 each), but there is an incredible cast of artists already donating serious hours to make this project happen and they deserve to be valued for their work and experience. 

And THANK YOU!


* * *

Dank is a public performance that conflates game show style competition, hyper self-awareness, societal ambivalence and body augmentation through the controlled chaos of Big Brother politics.

* * *

ONE: Inside, the Believers are waiting for your attention. The pools with shiny, colorful surfaces sit untouched.

TWO: Guided by mounting self-consciousness and a competitive vigor they (maybe you, too) scratch, pull and scrape for the ambiguously necessary things. It all persists in a soggy neutral.

THREE: By the end of it all, the Believers know more and you know less; but, Dank has a secondary story altogether. You happen to be a part of it.

Through this exploration in performance and documentary style story-telling, believable experiences are not always the authentic or material ones.

* * *

If at all possible this event should be FREE to the public so that passerby can spontaneously stop in to witness the performance! Your support would, in part, offset the cost to the audience. That means all building materials, rentals (generator, sound equipment, etc) and costume costs need covered. If you believe Baltimore is better because of all the amazing, unexpected and outrageous things happening around town, support this project! Better yet, donate AND come see the show!

Better yet, donate AND come see the show!

story:
Summary

Morgan Freeman is great. Healthy eating and community gardens are great. Let's bring those two great things together. 

In short, I want to record Morgan Freeman reading a ridiculous very short story (excerpt below), which I will release as a free download. In return for lending his perfect voice, I will donate the money raised in Mr. Freeman's name to Harlem Grown, a 501 (c) 3 nonprofit focused on changing eating habits and food sourcing in Harlem, New York. I know the wonderful man who runs it, Tony, and have been searching for a way to help Harlem Grown out  in a substantial way for a while now. I believe this absolutely unrelated and completely inane stunt could be it. Tony is a passionate mad genius gardener and entrepreneur who is helping to change food culture for a lot of kids who never suspected there were other, healthier choices for their meals. Having myself grown up eating donuts, cheese-heavy omelettes and chocolate milk in the back room of my family's diner outside of Boston, I understand all too well how your early eating habits affect you later in life.

Just to be 100% clear, Mr. Freeman doesn't know anything about this — YET — so I have no guarantee he'll do it. But I think it's a good cause and hope he does to. If not, well, maybe Benedict Cumberbatch or another deep-voiced screen star is available. Worst case scenario, I donate the money to Harlem Grown in all of our names. That's what's great about this campaign. No matter what happens, Harlem Grown wins. (As long as you donate, duh.) 

FREE EXCERPT

(Please remember to hear Morgan Freeman's voice in your head while reading.)

THE MUSICAL CHAIR
It has been nearly 20 years, but I am still haunted by a tiny little fart I let out in my Advanced Social Studies class in 11th grade. It was such a tiny sound but sitting as in the quiet of the classroom during an on-going essay test, the barest of toots…toot toot… leaked from my lower body. I couldn't hold it back, struggle though I did for over 20 minutes. And when it did come out, we all knew who had done it. Oh yes, we all knew...

END OF EXCERPT

Here are few additional things Indiegogo suggested I tell you:

Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve: 
This is about getting Morgan Freeman to read a very short story about a fart. How's that for magnitude?

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal:
DON'T TELL ME WHAT TO DO, INDIEGOGO! But if you want concise but personal, how about this: I'm 5'10'' and sad most of the time. This project getting funded would make me less sad and 5'11''.

Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?
If they're not monsters, yes, they would be ready. They'd have their paypal checkbook in their digital hands so they could write me an internet check and then say, "Take THAT to the bank and smoke it!" And I would take that to the bank. I would. But I wouldn't smoke it because that's bad.

Perks

There will be no perks. We're all adults here. Life isn't about "perks." It's about giving a good cause a decent amount of money. But you will get a digital copy of the audio at least one week before it's released so you can share it with your friends and your friends will all be like, "Oh my god, Carly, you're so cool! How'd you get Morgan Freeman to read that?" And you (I'm assuming you're all named Carly) will be like, "Oh no biggie, I just made some calls and asked him to read a story I wrote about when I had a toot in one of my advanced study classes which were only for really smart people which is why I was in it." And then you'll get so many handshakes and brohugs for sharing this voice-over story. 

Risks & Challenges

Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles:
I'm a go getter with a no nonsense attitude. But I'm also a team player with an attention to detil. I know DOS++ and have 3 years of cross-agency successperience. I am burning with experiments and have a knack for volume. Come sail away with me!

Describe your plan for solving these challenges: Knives.

Other Ways You Can Help

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign:      
Do this.

Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!:     
Please also do this.

And that's all there is to it. 

Great. Donate money so I can get Morgan Freeman to read my story and we can all help out an amazing organization dedicated to helping the kids who need it most!

story:
To coincide with Being the River, Repeating the Forest  a major exhibition of the work of the Italian artist, Giuseppe Penone, which opens September 19, 2015 and runs through January 10, 2016 at the Nasher Sculpture Center.

Lapthisophon’s project will act in conversation with the exhibition paying tribute to Penone and examining the central ideas of the artist’s work­time, body, nature duration and the importance of place. Toccare (Non) Toccare will include sculpture, found objects, drawing, text, poems, sound, photography and video.  The various elements will interweave in actions/events/installations extending the ideas of Penone’s work and showing its influence. The project will take place in and around the Nasher Sculpture Center in four installments­ October through January. 

All of the actions will be documented and shared via web and collected in a small book at the end of the project. Toccare (Non) Toccare will examine the influence of Penone and Arte Povera but also the idea of influence itself addressing ideas of impression, touch, the ephemeral and legacy.

The accompanying book will be titled Notebook 1967-68  taken from Robert Lowell’s collection of poems of the same name.  1967 marks the year of many of the first Arte Povera exhibitions. Lowell’s book chronicles his life that year and interweaves the personal, the public with attention to history and literary and cultural figures. It serves as an “influence” but also a model for the mixing of personal, historic, public and private. The book will document the events taking place  during the project but also branch out and  speak to subjects such as a European- American cultures and the artwork as archive. The book will mix photography, poetry , essays and diary to mark the boundary between art and its trace.

Funds from the campaign will be used to design, print and distribute the book which accompanies this project.

story:
Pass The M.I.C. Is:

A student-run organization at the University of Michigan dedicated to using the Five Pillars of Hip Hop as a means to engage students in elements of language arts and creative expression. Pass The M.I.C.'s mission is to transform public high schools into showcases of student art and personal identity. We are currently partnered with a public school in Detroit, Michigan.

The Pass The M.I.C. Crew studies, practices and believes in the power of Hip Hop. Once a week, Pass The M.I.C. holds workshops that offer instruction in and a space to learn about the 5 Pillars: MC’ing, DJ’ing, B-Boying (break dancing), Graffiti and Knowledge. We believe that this art form has a lot to teach us, and connects to other areas of language arts. At Pass The M.I.C. workshops, students will discover which pillars they are interested in pursuing, create their own artwork with the help of UofM student-artists and study the culture and history of Hip Hop. The year culminates in a school wide performance, displaying all of the work created during the school year.

Workshops Consist Of:

A complete blend of academic study, individual artistic work and practice in performance arts. In any given workshop, students may be analyzing rap lyrics for various literary devices; writing their own poetry or raps based on prevalent themes in their lives or in Hip Hop culture; researching the history of Hip Hop, especially in Detroit; learning different techniques about the process of writing, drawing, rapping or dancing; and providing critiques and feedback to their peers regarding performance skills. 

Outside of Workshops:

Pass The M.I.C. offers monthly Open M.I.C. sessions for the entire school, where students practice performing and recording their artwork; field trips to nearby graffiti exhibitions; the production of the school's first cohesive Mixtape; and personalized instruction, feedback and mentoring from UofM student artists. 

Your money is going to:

Supplies for artwork, including poster paper, markers, erasers, journals, and spray paint. We also are looking to supply the students with PTM buttons, wristbands and other swag to promote Pass The M.I.C.'s mission of creating a constant presence of student artwork in the school. Finally, your contribution would help us to rent and transport equipment for recording and presenting live music, poetry and dance.

If you are unable to contribute, but you are still interested in getting involved, email passthemic@umich.edu

Workshops Consist Of:
A complete blend of academic study, individual artistic work and practice in performance arts. In any given workshop, students may be analyzing rap lyrics for various literary devices; writing their own poetry or raps based on prevalent themes in their lives or in Hip Hop culture; researching the history of Hip Hop, especially in Detroit; learning different techniques about the process of writing, drawing, rapping or dancing; and providing critiques and feedback to their peers regarding performance skills. 


Outside of Workshops:
Pass The M.I.C. offers monthly Open M.I.C. sessions for the entire school, where students practice performing and recording their artwork; field trips to nearby graffiti exhibitions; the production of the school's first cohesive Mixtape; and personalized instruction, feedback and mentoring from UofM student artists. 


Your money is going to:
Supplies for artwork, including poster paper, markers, erasers, journals, and spray paint. We also are looking to supply the students with PTM buttons, wristbands and other swag to promote Pass The M.I.C.'s mission of creating a constant presence of student artwork in the school. Finally, your contribution would help us to rent and transport equipment for recording and presenting live music, poetry and dance.
If you are unable to contribute, but you are still interested in getting involved, email passthemic@umich.edu

story:
(tip: you don't need a Paypal account to Contribute - you can simply enter your cc info without logging in and Paypal processes it)

You can still purchase art and book Perks here: Any amount over my original goal will help me go to book signing events on other islands in Hawaii...


Supporting local art & agriculture

I've been a professional artist since graduating 15 years ago with a degree in Studio Art. I am also the founder & producer of the Kauai Art Tour ~ Artists Open Studios event. Recently I was invited to be a part of a beautiful book featuring 50 artists from Hawaii entitled "Aloha Expressionism." 

An exhibition for all of the artists in the book will be mounted at the Hawaii Food & Wine Festival's "Corks and Forks" event on Oahu in September with a silent auction benefiting culinary & agricultural charitable organizations in Hawaii. It's the first time art will be featured along with the food & wine at this world renowned festival.

I need to send my art to the exhibit, and since it's framed with expensive museum glass, the safest way to do this would be to take it with me on a plane. In addition to the safety of the art, my being at the event personally will greatly enhance the chances of someone purchasing my work (people love meeting the artist & talking story about the art) either at the event or in the future.

But the travel expenses and the ticket to gain entry to the event are costly
(no price breaks are given to the participating artists or non-drinkers). 

Impact

Reaching this Indiegogo goal will not only help my career as an artist, but also help agricultural non-profits in Hawaii. How?

  • Art auction proceeds and ALL of the proceeds from the Hawaii Food & Wine Festival events go toward agricultural non-profits in Hawaii.
  • Since I am a vegetarian & teetotaler (I've never had any alcohol), almost the entire cost of the expensive ticket for the Corks & Forks event will go to these non-profits, rather than covering the cost of expensive wines & meats! :-)

Where will the funds be used?

  • The largest portion of the funds will be used for Perks Fulfillment.
  • The second largest amount will be used to purchase the expensive Corks & Forks event ticket which is required for entrance to see the Art Exhibit and Silent Auction (proceeds go to Hawaii agricultural & culinary non-profits)
  • The next largest amount of funding will be allocated toward the Transportation of both the art and the artist to Oahu for the event and Exhibition
  • The remainder of the funds are for paying the various funding and credit card fees charged by Indiegogo and Paypal for this campaign.
  • Any extra funds raised beyond the initial goal will be utilized to attend official Book Signing Events for the artists on the Big Island and Maui!


Art Perks for Contributors

$15 - Handwritten Postcard from Kauai - Exclusive to Indiegogo backers 

(These are exclusive to Indiegogo and aren't sold elsewhere)




$38 - Special Edition Art Notecards - set of 3 cards with envelopes

Featuring three of my Evocations paintings published in Aloha Expressionism



$65 - Special Edition 4"x6" Metal Print, signed  
Evocations award-winning painting: Blue Violet Bliss

(These are exclusive to Indiegogo and aren't sold elsewhere)



Aloha Expressionism Coffee Table Book - signed by Donia

My Evocations series & story will be featured on 4 pages of this limited edition
9" x 12" full color, hardcover 224 page book along with 49 other artists in Hawaii. 
(will be released September 2015 - only 3000 will be printed)

$85 - special Kama'aina Book rate and no extra shipping
(pickup, for Kauai residents only)

$95 - Book only

$125 - Book+ Perk also comes with set of 3 Special Edition Notecards

$180 - TWO copies of Book only, saves on domestic shipping as they will ship in the same priority box.

$230 - TWO Books+ Perk also comes with two sets of 3 Special Edition Notecards, and saves on domestic shipping as they will ship in the same priority box.

Please be sure to indicate with your contribution if you would like a special dedication (or 2 different ones if you get the TWO copies perk) included with my signature.


All Original Painting Perks include a copy of the Book

$450 - Original Mixed Media Painting: Mirage

This is an unframed original mixed media painting from my Evocations series. The size is 3.625" x 8.25" (The original is much brighter - oranges and yellows, I've just had a hard time getting a good photo of these colors!)



$550 - Original Pastel Painting: Afternoon

This is a framed original pastel from my Evocations series. The art size is 2.5" x 3.5" and the handcrafted Italian molding (gold leaf on sides and multiple layers of hand-created patina on the face to create a beautifully nuanced frame) and matting makes the overall painting size 9.5" x 11.5"



$900 - Original Pastel Painting: Pele Smolders

This is a framed original pastel from my Evocations series. The art size is 4.75" x 7.75" and the handcrafted Italian molding (gold leaf on sides and multiple layers of hand-created patina on the face to create a beautifully nuanced frame) and matting makes the overall painting size 13" x 14.75"



$825 - Original Pastel Painting: Immersion

This is a framed original from my Evocations series. The art size is 9.25" x 6" and the black lacquer frame and matting makes the overall painting size 16" x 12.75"



$1350 - Original Pastel Painting: Golden Barrel

This is a framed original pastel from my Evocations series. The art size is 10.25" x 12.75" and the hand-patina metal  frame makes the overall painting size 10.75" x 13.25"


Risks & Challenges

If I don't reach my goal, I can still get my art to the Auction, I just won't be able to be there myself. The remainder will be used for the creation of new art & for marketing purposes. There aren't really any other risks other than, say, bad weather preventing me from flying to a neighbor island, which would be a *really* rare instance in Hawaii.

Other Ways You Can Help!

I really do understand if you can't contribute, but you can still help: 

(If you *did* contribute & can also do any of the following I will be extra grateful and help reach the Stretch Goals for extra goodies! :-)

  • Help me get the word out via email, Twitter, Pinterest, Facebook, snail mail, etc to your arts-loving friends & acquaintances about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help make my campaign more visible on their site as well... the more popular it is, the more people will see it.

Mahalo nui and please feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

story:
There is magic in transition...


My name is Wendy Vastine. I am a voice teacher, community organizer, performing artist, and creator of the Psychopomp* Project. In a surprise twist of the fates, I find myself heading back to graduate school for Speech-Language Pathology at George Washington University, where I will deepen my work with the voice and gender, as well as the healing potential of working with the whole voice.**


I always thought I would be doing a crowd-sourcing campaign for a full-length run of the Psychopomp Project: my interactive performance project about transition, change, and the fear of death.  Since the Psychopomp is a traveller, and I am now in my own major transition, I am turning my move from Austin, TX to Washington DC into a manifestation of the art project.  In doing so, I hope to offset some of the expenses of moving, and going back to school, as well as share some of the Psychopomp magic with you.


With your support: I will be able to pay for the moving truck, and gas money for the move from Austin, TX to Washington DC.  If I somehow miraculously raise more than my stated goal, that money will go towards books and other materials for school.  That stuff is expensive!


What you will get:  a message, a story, a song, or maybe even a direct interaction from the Psychopomp.  Though the message or interaction can take on many forms, you can see any of these possibilities as a form of divination. You may even be able to ask a question and get some sort of answer. It may be funny, absurd, magical, and/or eerily relevant.  


Of course, remember that this particular psychopomp shifts between 5 main aspects:  a crone, a child, a trickster, an escort, and the aurora borealis.  So you never know who you are going to get, or what kind of message/answer will present itself.  


So roll the trickster's magical dice, and partake in the magical potential of this particular transition.   


And even if you can't support financially, there are other ways.  Please share this campaign with others who might enjoy interacting with the Psychopomp.  OR: maybe  you have an extra backback, or laptop in excellent condition.  Things like this would also help offset my expenses.


Thank you!


* A Psychopomp is a shapeshifting traveller who moves in between the worlds, escorting souls in transition from one world to another.


** As you may or may not know, I work primarily with the transgender and gender variant community, a community of which I am part.  I believe that the voice that is resonant with your identity is already there - it just needs to be found and liberated. I have been doing this work for years, and have worked to make it accessible (espsecially in a financial way) to this community.  Being transgender or gender variant comes with great cost, and for many, voice work is a necessity.  Of course, this means that I don't make a lot of money, which is why your support is so greatly appreciated.
Also, I have found that working in the voice is extremely healing, at a very deep level.  I see the voice as a manifestation of the soul, and have found this work to be a beautiful and necessary part of my own healing,  I have had the honor of witnessing some deep healing of those with whom I work, as they discovered, liberated, and made peace with different parts of their voice.  I believe this voice work to be a powerful tool of healing, which is vital if there is going to be systemic and collective change and liberation.
My Psychopomp project is, in part, an articulation of my philosophy of the voice, as well as my personal relationship with gender.  Ultimately the Psychopomp and the voice work embraces transformative potential of facing our deepest fears, and finding joy, magic and beauty along the way.
I am returning to graduate school in Speech Language Pathology in order to articulate, develop and deepen this work.  In terms of voice and gender, my aim is to continue to put the tools of working with the voice back into the community, where it belongs.  And in terms of healing, it is my wish to share this healing work so many more can benefit.

story:
If you are reading this, it's likely we know one another. On the off-chance that we don't, my name is Casandra Johns and I am a new mama and book artist in the Salem/Portland area. Just about two years ago I decided that I wanted to learn to independently produce small-scale publications on subjects that I find interesting and inspiring, from esoteric studies to art and herbalism. About a year ago, I applied to OCAC, th Oregon College of Art and Craft, and was accepted with a generous scholarship into their Book Arts program. I anticipated starting school in the fall of 2014. The spring prior to my first semester though, I realized I was pregnant with the wonderful, beautiful, charming Madrona! School was put on hold. It was well worth it, and if everything goes as planned I will begin school this coming fall. However, I am itching to begin making books!

I have so many projects floating around in my crazy brain just waiting for the perfect ingredients and materials to be in the right place at the right time so that they can come into existence. Sometimes it gets overwhelming, feeling so inspired but often lacking a sufficient outlet. I print cards and bind blank books and that's fun, but I want to be doing so much more. So, while sitting in my little home with Madrona and staring at all of my binding supplies the other day, I realized I was incredibly anxious. Why was I anxious? I couldn't shake it. I realized that it was because I just need to begin. I just need to go for it! I need to pick the project that is the most accessible and take the step to BEGIN once and for all. I priced my supplies and drew a mock-up and started to get really excited when I remembered the obnoxious fact that, in order to do anything more than dream and plan, I would need some money...


Asking for money is so difficult!


It's true. I feel like I'm terrible at it and get so worked up and feel so guilty and struggle with my sense of worth, my sense of confidence in my project, but I just have to do it. A friend lent me the excellent book The Art of Asking by Amanda Palmer, which has been really helpful and inspiring in gaining the courage to do this.

So here I am asking for your money. But what for? How much do I need? How will I use it? In order to embark on the journey toward my grand dreams of independent publishing and high-quality bookbinding, I will begin with one project, something small and accessible. The idea is that, once it is underway, the resources it brings in can go toward funding another slightly more ambitious project, then another slightly more ambitious, etc.


Here are the details...


Any money you donate will go directly into supplies for printing a small children's book which is something I am very enthusiastic about as a new mama, artist, and herbalist. It will be a short book all about gardening and growing seeds. However, it won't just be about gardening, it will be a DIY kit for the whole family to garden together! It will include original block-printed images of seven easy-to-grow herbs coinciding with each color in the rainbow, as well as seed packets of each plant. Families will be able to start the seeds together and watch them grow! And once the flowers bloom, the block-printed images are perfect as a template so that kids can color in the flowers they have been tending. The book will also include fun project ideas and information about each plant. An example:

“Calendula is a sunny, sticky flower that blooms yellow and orange. The flower petals are tasty in salad and can be used as medicine! If you get a scrape or bug bite, try mashing up calendula and applying it gently to your skin. It will help you feel better and make everything heal faster. If you are getting a cold, try making a tea from the beautiful flowers. It will help with swollen, sore throats and stuffy noses. PROJECT IDEA: When a bunch of your calendula flowers have bloomed, pluck them off the stocks and set them out on a cookie sheet to wilt for a day or two. Then, put all the flowers in a canning jar and cover them with oil. Make sure you shake it around to get out the air bubbles! Leave your jar in a warm, dry place for two weeks and shake it every few days. After you've waited, strain out the oil. Make sure to squish the flowers through something like cheesecloth to get all the medicine out. Label your jar, and presto! You've made your very own healing oil! It is good for cuts, scrapes, burns, dry skin, bug bites, rashes, and so much more!”

Not only will this book be fun and interactive, but it will be beautiful! The flower images will be block prints and the book hand-bound and hardback. The spine will be exposed, which means that when you open the book, it's flexible spine allows it to lay flat to make reading and coloring easier. Seed packets and instructions will accompany each plant picture in a fun and handy pocket page. In it's entirety, I envision creating a lovely, functional piece of art that is accessible and enjoyable for kids as well as parents.


Now you know what I'm doing, but how will I use your dollars? I will put them entirely toward supplies! I sat down and priced out everything I need to print this book in a run of 35 copies and it will be between $250 and $300, not including shipping. This includes everything like glue, paper, bookboard for the covers, waxed linen for binding, ink, blocks to carve the images on, seed packets, etc. Now, Indigogo allows a minimum goal of $500 for their campaigns, so any money I receive past my personal $300 goal will either be used to print a second run of this exact book if there is demand for it, or go directly into the other publications projects I will be putting the profits from this book toward. It's important to me that you understand that this book and any money you may donate is not just a one-time deal for me. It's like a seed! It is the beginning of something much bigger that I have been dreaming up for the last two years, something I am about to invest three years of my life going to school to study. It is how I eventually would like to support myself, my daughter, and indirectly, my community.


Will you help me plant the seeds and watch them grow?


What can you expect when you donate? First of all, you can expect to hear that I have printed and bound a book by (ideally) July 1st. Second, if you make a donation using one of Indigogo's “Perks” options, I am using this as a venue to pre-order books and prints. For a $20 donation, I will send you an original block print of one of the images from the book. For a $35 donation, you have pre-ordered a book and you will be the first to receive it once they are completed. For a $50 donation, it's the book and a print for you. If you would like to donate more and want a book and/or print, I am happy to set them aside for you. If you would like to donate less, that's great too. Perhaps you will want to purchase a book once they are completed, or perhaps you are just happy to help. No matter which way you go, I'm so grateful!

Can't donate? I totally get it! If you don't have the dollars but are interested and want to help, you can do that by sharing this campaign with folks and check out my Etsy and Facebook pages!


I'm so excited!
