story:
Hi there my name is Casey and I'm a young digital artist trying to raise funds so I can afford a laptop. My current desktop which I depend on is failing me. As a matter of fact my PC crashed five times during the making of this indiegogo campaign! My current set up is very frustrating and low functioning I desperately need a new computer.

As I said I'm a digital artist, I'm mostly involved in Photoshop and illustrator though I have plans to attend school for 3-D modeling and industrial design. I'm going to be attending this fall, woohoo! Digital art is my passion and my future. If you help raise the money to get this laptop you'll be helping a talented young artist along his way to a professional artistic career.

Thank you so much for your time and I do hope you donate. I have a Paypal account  attached! Thank you!

story:
• Hello, I'm Shannon. I am a visual artist, my current preferred media is oil painting. I have a MFA from The School of the Art Institute of Chicago and a BFA from the University of Texas at Austin. As an artist I have maintained a studio practice since graduate school while supporting myself by teaching. Alrighty, enough about me, let's talk about Spain. I have been invited to attend a summer residency program just outside of Barcelona, Spain. This residency will give me the opportunity to make work in a dedicated environment, while meeting and interacting with other artists from around the world. It really is a once in a lifetime opportunity. When applying for this residency I was hoping to receive the "one" full fellowship offered, however that was not meant to be. I am grateful to have been invited to attend and I have been offered a partial fellowship (out of hundreds of applicants). Yippie! Go me!! I just need a little help. It really is hard for me to imagine the impact on my work attending this residency will have, I have not had the opportunity to focus singularly on my studio practice since graduate school. I can imagine amazing things happening.
  • I need to raise $1700 (current exchange rate) to cover the residency fees, travel and shipping costs and artist's materials. The residency fees include room, board (food) and studio space as well as curatorial visits and group critiques. The remainder of the funds will go to travel, travel related costs and artist's materials, which will be purchased in Spain. I have also estimated shipping costs associated with the return of my artwork. 
  • In exchange for your support you will receive my eternal gratitude, and an original work of art! You will receive your perk by the end of the year, but you have my thanks right now!

The Impact

Without your support, I could not accept this invitation. It is as simple as that. I have taken a long, hard look at my goals this past year and have chosen to prioritize my studio practice. Applying to and attending residencies is a huge step towards this goal. 

Risks & Challenges

I will face many challenges on this adventure, some of which I am aware of and others will spring up along the way. One thing I am currently obsessing about is traveling alone in a foreign country where I don't speak the language. How will I get over this challenge? I will plan every step, I will learn the language and I will proceed with confidence! 
In the back of my head there are a few more little Risks/Challenges: What if I don't raise enough money? I will find a way to make it work with what I raise, I am grateful for any and all support!
What if I get to Spain and I am stuck/blocked on what to make? I remind myself, sometimes it is not as much about the actual production of work and more about the experience and environment.  It is about being present. The work will come.
So that is my campaign, thank you for reading and thank you for your consideration. Feel free to pass my campaign along if you know anyone who would like to support an artist on her journey to Spain!

story:
PETT Plant is a true work of art not only inspired by nature, but created directly from the natural world! There are no computers, 3D printers or anything digital involved in the rendering of the flowers. The Plants come directly from nature, to art studio to you via our own proprietary Direct-Life-Molding process. Early PETT Plant supporters will be able to choose from one of four variations of different species for their PETT and receive a free lifecast succulent ring as well. (We will contact you by email to determine which species and which ring you prefer after you make your contribution.)

PETT Plant is not a product from a factory, it is a hand made and produced sculpture that fuses art, science and technology to create a truly interactive experience that is as beautiful as it is mesmerizing!

PETT Plant comes with a custom designed Android app and several pre-programmed light animations you can choose from with your smart phone. In addition, you can adjust the speed at which any animation plays, or simply press the hold button to freeze the sculpture wherever you want.

PETT Plant's illuminated interactive stems are movable and will stay in whatever position you pose them in. It will fit most anywhere, anyhow and with anything and loves the company of living plants. And with the addition of our custom magnetic mounting bracket, it can hang from the ceiling as a chandelier as well.

PETT Plant has a sound responsive mode where the color of each stem modulates like a rainbow graphic equalizer!

PETT Plant also comes pre-programmed with several brainwave entrainment sequences you can use together with any of the light animations. (Brainwave entrainment is the phenomena by which brainwaves synchronize with light and sound waves under the right conditions. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brainwave_entrainment) In entrainment mode, PETT Plant will pulsate at specific frequencies to help move you into brainwave states conducive to inducing sleep, meditation or increasing alertness. And unlike with entrainment goggles, PETT Plant will allow two or even a whole group of people to synchronize their brain waves together in tandem! WARNING: If you are epileptic or in any other way prone to seizures, entrainment is not for you, as it has been shown that blinking lights can induce seizures in those that are predisposed to having them.

PETT Plant is USB powered. Plug it into any phone charger, your computer, a portable power bank or one of our Powerslugs if you would like to take it somewhere out into the world where the electrons are beyond your control.

PETT Plant's brain is the Teensy 3.1, an ARM-based, Arduino-compatible microcontroller module. It is programmable with the open source Arduino IDE. Brainwave entrainment not your thing? Reprogram it to do whatever you want!


ABOUT BIOTRONESIS
BioTronEsis is a collective of hyper creative, tech smart artists and programmers collaborating to create uniquely transformative art experiences that fuse nature, art, science and technology. Our namesake, the 2014 Burning Man piece BioTronEsis, is a giant electroluminescent biopod we created that employs brain wave entrainment and binaural beats to help induce group trance experiences. It was from the overwhelming response, appreciation and love we received with our Biotron in the desert last year, that we now feel obliged to share this with the world at large! The PETT Plant is the culmination of a 6 month effort to do just that!

This campaign will help us to fund that process the rest of the way by providing us with the necessary capitol to design and make custom printed circuit boards, finish and test the app, as well as supply all the materials and other electronics to make our first limited edition production run in time for the holiday season.

For your pledge of support, we promise you all the fun, beauty, entertainment and trance that we have looking at and experiencing our own creations. And we guarantee that your one of a kind uniquely original plants and slugs will be engaging you and your friends and family for many years to come.

It is our hope that by running a successful campaign, the PETT Plant will end up being the first in a long series of PETT creatures, PETT Aliens, PETT brains, PETT.......................

and that world domination will soon be in sight!


Other Ways You Can Help........

........If growing an illumintated bioelectric garden is prohibited in your town or area and you just can 't risk the fine, please spread the word about our art with your friends and family in person and on social media (using the Indiegogo share tools).  Please  convey to them personally just how you think they might benefit from the transcendental effects of a PETT Plant in their home or office!


PETT OPTIONS:

PETT Plant comes with multiple options for the plant species that adorn the end of each stem. (The standard version PETT Plant comes with 6 long repositionable stems and 6 short non repositionable stems.) Since these are limited edition sculptures, not more than 25 will ever be made of any one particular species. As of the time of this launch, available choices are:


PETT Plant comes with two different options for the base pod. PETT plant is also available as a Delux version.


All PETT Plants come with a 110V wall socket adapter for those times when you don't have a computer, phonecharger or Powerslug to plug into. As well, each PETT Plant shipped will include 1 free lifecast succulent ring of your choice from the options below.

PETT ACCESSORIES:


OUR PROCESS


SUPER PERKS



OUR TEAM


Erick Dunn - Light and Sound Sculptor

As an artist, I have been molding and casting living things and incorporating them into sculpture for the last 20 years. Now immersed in the transformative art movement, I have been creating light and sound art that incorporates brain wave entrainment, biofeedback and and various other transformative technologies to listen to and translate biometric data generated by humans into light animations and soundscapes.


John Van Strien - Conjurer of the Inconceivable

John has been exploring and creating most of his life, and loves to express his creativity in many ways. Whether it's writing elegant software to create mesmerizing color patterns, banging on hot steel, melting glass in a kiln, or free form dancing. With a background in electronics and software development, he enjoys blending the realms of art and technology, mixing simple low tech materials with the latest in high tech wizardry, to create interactive and immersive experiences for people that push the boundaries of the conceivable.

Claudia Meglin - Creativity Harvester

Claudia is a filmmaker, artist, creative leader and innovator. Her calling in life is to aid transformative ideas and generative entrepreneurship world wide by helping people to acquire the creative skills necessary to bring together art, technology and business to consciously design a sustainable and happy future for our world. In the last two decades she has guided film productions and software companies through the digital revolution by instituting cutting edge technologies alongside her principals of compassion for creating happy and productive teams.

Howard Tsu - Pattern maker

I am a metaphorical bridge between production and design, software and hardware, as well as a future architect. My passion has been toward the actualization of nuanced realities, with the PETT being another form in which the flora can take form. I aim to be a part of the creation of a future where the ebb and flow of form, energy, and creativity can take place with minimal resistance and maximum support.


Dan Freeman - Neuro Nerdo

Dan likes brains almost as much as zombies, but his preference is to study them as opposed to eating them. He only comes out at night.

SPECIAL THANKS


Mitch Altman- Co-founder of Noisebridge hacker space

Mitch is a life long meditater and entrainment guru as well as the inventor of the TV B-Gone and maker of the brain machine entrainment goggles. Mitch travels the world gifting his genius to fellow hackers/makers and his entrainment code is the source for our meditation sequence and the inspiration for the BioTron.


Natasha Juliana  - owner and founder workpetaluma


RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

As of the beginning of this campaign, our working prototype and the initial molds for getting the production line going are complete and ready to go! We manufacture the parts ourselves and source most of the materials and electronics in the US, so many of the risks normally associated with overseas factories and sourcing materials abroad are not so much of a concern for our campaign. As well, the Android version of our APP is most of the way there. Challenges are concerned with the lack of an iOS version in this first production run. It will be our first priority to address this concern with an iOS development benchmark goal if there is sufficient demand from people. We are counting on support from the Indiegogo community to let us know.

story:
We are a young team from Samobor, a city near the capital of Croatia – Zagreb. Organizing events such as this is our passion since 5 years ago. That's when we first organized the "Defying Gravity" festival. Author of the festival Josip Lisec made the bike ramp from scratch in his garage with a budget of 25€and  help of a local biker. That is how defying of gravity begun. The festival first started from the desire to make a change and the idea to promote and bring extreme sports and cycling, as well as urban culture, to our local community and broader.


We have a vision to unite as much activities that 'defy gravity' and as much urban culture in order to make an unique festival for everyone with goal to create tradition for generations to come.


Last years we had a variety of activities such as: MTB and BMX ramp, parkour and breakdance performance, flatland BMX performance (modern dance while riding the bmx bicycle), a polygon for trial bicycles, bunny hop contest, rock climbing, children bicycle polygon, motor stunt show, a slackline and street  performers.

This year we want to make it bigger and better.

For us this international festival is important because in our region there is a lot of young people who would want to be a part of similar activities but there is simply almost no events or places to see those activities or participate in them. We created this campaign because we need Your help. To us it's important that you hear our call, because support we got for now only covers 1/7 of our expenses,which leaves us with very little space to make a progress that we want.

The festival will take place on 11th june in Samobor, Croatia.


We are setting the goal at 3500$. That is the minimum we need to bring all the new content to the festival. All of the fundings are going straight to our piggy bank and are meant  for – graffiti walls and paint, street art gallery, improvement of the polygons, making a 15 min. documentary movie about the Defying Gravity, it's story and rides and bringing dance groups and riders to the festival. 

By supporting this campaign, you are also helping us start our clothing brand and give us a boost in organizing winter editions of the festival and more events such as jams, contests, parties and performances.


With Your help we will be able to:

  • Improve our polygons, building and renting better jump boxes and ramps for bikers, rollers, skateboarders & brakedancers (1300$)

  • Expand our program by bringing street artists to paint and draw graffiti in front of the audience and build painting walls for them (450$)

  • Create a professional documentary movie and photo album of Defying Gravity Festival and improve our visibility (700$)

  •  Get materials to build dance floor for break dancers (150$ )

  •  Organize more outdoor activities and hobbies for visitors like frisbee and badminton court (100$)

  • Improve the design of our clothing and visual design of festival (400$)

  • Photo and street art gallery materials (100$)

  • Better sound system for our Dj’s and audience (300$)


Platform fees - 350$
Perk fulfillment - 1500$

Total cost : 5350$

We are determinate to reach our goal. If we cross it, we already have some new ideas like (Defying Gravity winter edition) that we can implement in the festival which will be published if campaign gets close to our goal.  Also there is numerous other expenses we have while organizing this event like prize pools, transportation and building of different 4 polygons,  security, medic, performers, Dj’s, artificial rocks etc.


Here is what you get for supporting our story:



This project will help young people to see and participate in activities they wouldn't usually have a chance to be a part of. Its value in our local and international society is huge, while it is one of the few events promoting extreme sports and urban culture in our region. We are connecting people from that scene and developing a community and network of people who are interested in extreme sports and urban culture, as well as promoting those activities to a larger audience.


We also like to include locals - children and local people gave us a great positive feedback through last four festivals. They say, and we also think, that a group of young motivated people organizing such an interesting event is great for the visibility of our local community and for young people to be involved into sports and culture that is going to be a big part of our future.


Urban culture is becoming a big part of young people's everyday life – music, art, dance, clothing and other interests have a big influence on their mindset and development. We want to open people's mind, and through the event let them see that it is all about sharing the love and passion and accepting every unique person no matter what they do or look like. Also we want them to see that hard work pays off, especially when you do something you love.




There will always be risk and obstacles doing those events. Organizing takes a lot of time and energy, as well as being able to make an event with that amount of visibility that people come from other countries just to be a part of it. The biggest obstacle is of course the money, but we are very positive thinking and put our hopes and dreams into Your hands.


From our experience with organizing the "Defying Gravity" festival throughout the years we are sure that if there will be obstacles considering placement of the festival (troubles with staff or contestants, bike and skate ramps and elements, weather conditions), we will deal with it greatly even if we have to adjust the course of the activities.


Because of our young but very experienced team, we are sure that this festival will take place no matter what. With Your help we can overcome every challenge and nothing can stop us from making the festival take place once again and make a big impact on the society we live in. 


We want to continue with the festival, making it an annual tradition in Samobor.


Even if you can't financially contribute to the project you can always help with spreading the word, we will be very pleased if our festival gets some street credit :). So if you like it - tell your friends, share on facebook, twitter and such, use share tools, call your grandma to tell her friends, go to the street corner with a banner and invite people, film a video landing a 720°-tuck no hands to superman yelling "Defying Gravity", make a graffiti. We take and appreciate any form of help we can get.


And last (but not least), come to the festival, support us and meet cool people.

We are setting the goal at 3500$. That is the minimum we need to bring all the new content to the festival. All of the fundings are going straight to our piggy bank and are meant  for – graffiti walls and paint, street art gallery, improvement of the polygons, making a 15 min. documentary movie about the Defying Gravity, it's story and rides and bringing dance groups and riders to the festival. 
By supporting this campaign, you are also helping us start our clothing brand and give us a boost in organizing winter editions of the festival and more events such as jams, contests, parties and performances.

With Your help we will be able to:
Improve our polygons, building and renting better jump boxes and ramps for bikers, rollers, skateboarders & brakedancers (1300$)
Expand our program by bringing street artists to paint and draw graffiti in front of the audience and build painting walls for them (450$)

Create a professional documentary movie and photo album of Defying Gravity Festival and improve our visibility (700$)
 Get materials to build dance floor for break dancers (150$ )

 Organize more outdoor activities and hobbies for visitors like frisbee and badminton court (100$)
Improve the design of our clothing and visual design of festival (400$)
Photo and street art gallery materials (100$)
Better sound system for our Dj’s and audience (300$)
Platform fees - 350$ Perk fulfillment - 1500$Total cost : 5350$We are determinate to reach our goal. If we cross it, we already have some new ideas like (Defying Gravity winter edition) that we can implement in the festival which will be published if campaign gets close to our goal.  Also there is numerous other expenses we have while organizing this event like prize pools, transportation and building of different 4 polygons,  security, medic, performers, Dj’s, artificial rocks etc.


Here is what you get for supporting our story:

This project will help young people to see and participate in activities they wouldn't usually have a chance to be a part of. Its value in our local and international society is huge, while it is one of the few events promoting extreme sports and urban culture in our region. We are connecting people from that scene and developing a community and network of people who are interested in extreme sports and urban culture, as well as promoting those activities to a larger audience.

We also like to include locals - children and local people gave us a great positive feedback through last four festivals. They say, and we also think, that a group of young motivated people organizing such an interesting event is great for the visibility of our local community and for young people to be involved into sports and culture that is going to be a big part of our future.
Urban culture is becoming a big part of young people's everyday life – music, art, dance, clothing and other interests have a big influence on their mindset and development. We want to open people's mind, and through the event let them see that it is all about sharing the love and passion and accepting every unique person no matter what they do or look like. Also we want them to see that hard work pays off, especially when you do something you love.
There will always be risk and obstacles doing those events. Organizing takes a lot of time and energy, as well as being able to make an event with that amount of visibility that people come from other countries just to be a part of it. The biggest obstacle is of course the money, but we are very positive thinking and put our hopes and dreams into Your hands.
From our experience with organizing the "Defying Gravity" festival throughout the years we are sure that if there will be obstacles considering placement of the festival (troubles with staff or contestants, bike and skate ramps and elements, weather conditions), we will deal with it greatly even if we have to adjust the course of the activities.
Because of our young but very experienced team, we are sure that this festival will take place no matter what. With Your help we can overcome every challenge and nothing can stop us from making the festival take place once again and make a big impact on the society we live in. 
We want to continue with the festival, making it an annual tradition in Samobor.

Even if you can't financially contribute to the project you can always help with spreading the word, we will be very pleased if our festival gets some street credit :). So if you like it - tell your friends, share on facebook, twitter and such, use share tools, call your grandma to tell her friends, go to the street corner with a banner and invite people, film a video landing a 720°-tuck no hands to superman yelling "Defying Gravity", make a graffiti. We take and appreciate any form of help we can get.
And last (but not least), come to the festival, support us and meet cool people.

story:
You also can read about this campaign in English (in italics)

¡Hola! / Hi!

Mi nombre es Oscar Iborra. Vivo en Granada (España). Soy psicólogo, trabajo con grupos y a nivel individual promoviendo el crecimiento personal y colectivo. También realizo investigación en la Universidad de Granada en áreas como consciencia, embodiment, sinestesia e ideaestesia y parapsicología.

He transitado varias vías, prácticas y técnicas – con mayor o menor profundidad: meditación, PNL, trabajo corporal, transpersonal… Pero para mí, ninguna lo cubría todo. Conocí los 5 Ritmos en 2009, y me sentí “de vuelta en casa”. Por fin algo que lo ponía todo en movimiento, a la vez, y encima mediante la danza libre. ¡Esto era!

Llevo 7 años trabajando y profundizando en esta práctica. Desde el primer momento tuve claro que quería ser profesor en 5 Ritmos, y ahora tengo la oportunidad de dar un primer paso más profundo en esta dirección: realizar una formación llamada "5Rhythms Sweat SpaceHolder" que me permitirá ofrecer esta práctica en mi comunidad, como paso previo a convertirme en profesor certificado y llevarlo a todo el mundo.

Puedes conocer más sobre los 5 Ritmos y su creadora, Gabrielle Roth, en su web oficial.

¿Y ahora? Ahora necesito tu ayuda para que me ayudes a cubrir parte de los gastos de todo esto. Llegar a ser profesor de 5 Ritmos es un viaje largo... y no sólo en kilómetros!

Mi name is Oscar Iborra. I live in Granada (Spain) I'm psychologist, working on personal growth with individuals and groups. I'm also a researcher at Granada University; my fields are consciousness, embodiment, synesthesia and parapsychology. I’ve walked by several paths, practices and techniques, greater or lesser depth, as meditation, NLP, body work, transpersonal psychology… I meet 5Rhythms in 2009, and I just find myself “at home”. 5Rhythms is a dynamic movement practice developed by Gabrielle Roth. I have been actively dancing 5Rhythms for the last 7 years and am taking it to the next level by joining the 5Rhythms Sweat SpaceHolder Program, which is the first step towards becoming a certified teacher. 

And now I need YOU to help me cover part of the expenses for this goal within the next month!


Qué necesito y qué puedo ofrecerte / What I need and what I can give you

Estos son los gastos que tengo que afrontar. La formación tendrá lugar en Utah (EEUU) del 29 de febrero al 4 de marzo de 2016:

  • Precio de la formación como SpaceHolder: 1400€
  • Viaje: 1000€
  • Alojamiento y gastos relacionados: 400 € 
  • Equipo técnico (programa DJ para ordenador y tarjeta de sonido): 200€
  • más un 5% de lo conseguido para los gastos de esta campaña.
¡Toda donación es bienvenida! No importa la cantidad.
Si quieres ayudarme con financiación económica, hazlo de este modo:
1. Selecciona la cantidad que desees donar y escríbela en la casilla junto al video, arriba a la derecha: "Tu contribución".
2. Selecciona, si quieres, alguna de las recompensas que ofrezco, en función de la cantidad.
3. Pincha en "CONTRIBUIR AHORA" y podrás terminar la contribución mediante tu cuenta de PayPal o con tarjeta. Si no quieres/no puedes donar mediante PayPal, por favor, escríbeme y buscamos otro modo: oscariborra@gmail.com.
¿Qué puedo ofrecerte yo a cambio? Esta misma práctica. Los 5 Ritmos. Al principio aquí en Granada, pero recuerda que es un primer paso para poder llevarla después a cualquier lugar. 

To provide you with more information, these are my expenses:

- SpaceHolder Training: 1400€ Euro

- Technical equipment:   200 € Euro

- Travel expenses: 1000 € Euro                           

- Accommodation and related: 400 € (aprox)

- Fees for fundraising: (~5% of the amount raised)

All donations are welcome! No matter how much it is.

What I can give you in return is this practice itself. The 5 Rhythms. First here in my community (Granada) and then, over the world, as certified teacher in the future. But this is the first step!

(ATTENTION: If you don't want/can't donate using PayPal, please email me: oscariborra@gmail.com. We can find another way)


Impacto / Impact

El viaje para ser profesor en 5 Ritmos es largo. Implica atender talleres por todo el mundo. No es algo que consigas en un año, o dos.  Yo llevo siete años bailando. Pero no es sólo el tiempo y la inversión económica. Este camino es un camino de transformación personal, y el trabajo no está sólo en los talleres, sino en tu día a día, que es donde esta práctica muestra todo su poder transformativo y su inspiración creativa.

Los 5 Ritmos son una práctica para cualquiera que quiera iniciar su viaje personal. Están conectados con lo más auténtico de cada persona y buscan una y otra vez sacar eso fuera y expresarlo, vivirlo. Te conectan con la vida, con los demás y contigo mismo. Todo eso a través de la danza y el movimiento... pero mucho más allá. Mi compromiso con esta práctica es llevarla a tantas personas como sea posible.

To be a certified 5 Rhyhtms teacher is a long way. It is not something you get in one or two years. Attending workshops for over the world. It’s not only time and money inversion; this is a journey of personal transformation, and the work is not only at workshops. It’s in daily life where this practice shows all its transformative power and creative inspiration.

5 Rhythms are a practice for personal growing journey. They are connected with the more authentic in every person and they express it in the world. They connect you with life, others and yourself, trough dance and movement. My commitment with this practice is bring it to as much people as possible.


Mis mentoras como SpaceHolder / My mentors as SpaceHolder

Como SpaceHolder contaré con dos tutoras que me ayudarán. Dos profesoras certificadas de 5 Ritmos: Helena Barquilla (España) y Neda Nenadic (UK). Son increíbles y es una suerte tenerlas como tutoras y amigas. Han escrito algo para apoyarme en esta campaña. Estas son las palabras de Helena:

"Óscar es alguien que de manera natural irradia calidez, transparencia e integridad, y cuánto más le conoces, ¡más le quieres! Su amor y pasión por los 5Ritmos siempre me ha conmovido e inspirado. Lleva años profundizando en el estudio de la práctica y anhelando de corazón ser facilitador de la misma. El programa SpaceHolder es para él un paso decisivo en la materialización de ese sueño y que lo lleve a cabo será una bendición para todos aquellos que tengan la suerte de bailar con él." (Helena Barquilla)

As SpaceHolder I’ll have two amazing mentors, two certified 5 Rhythms teachers: Helena Barquilla (Spain) and Neda Nenadic (UK). They give me support for this campaign with their words. These are Neda Nenadic's words: 

"Oscar is one of those people that with his presence he lightens up the space! What I so admire and find inspiring about him is his open heart and his incredible fluidity of movement! Watching him dance inspires me over and over again! I’m truly proud to be Oscar’s mentor and see him becoming truly inspiring 5Rhythms teacher! Please support him on this part of the journey… He’s one amazing human being and great friend!" (Neda Nenadic)  


Riesgos y desafíos / Risks and challenges

¿Hay mayor riesgo o desafío que la transformación personal? 

En mi caso, un gran riesgo es el económico. Tengo dos hijos. Este proyecto, al igual que los siete años que llevo en esto, suponen un desequilibrio económico y familiar. Por suerte tengo el apoyo de mi familia. Suena bien la idea de viajar a Sausalito, Londres, Berlín, Barcelona, Madrid... sitios a los que he ido siguiendo los 5 Ritmos. Pero también es difícil hacerlo con dos hijos en casa y pensando en si no te habrás pasado con los gastos.

Esta formación me permitirá además, mediante las sesiones que facilite, conseguir un apoyo económico que utilizaré a su vez para continuar en el viaje para ser profesor de 5 Ritmos.

Is there any greater risk or challenge than personal transformation?

For me, a great risk is economic. I have two sons. 5 Rhythms and the longing for become a teacher, represent an economic and family imbalance. Luckily I have the support of my family. It sounds good idea to travel to Sausalito, London, Berlin, Barcelona, Madrid ... places that I have visited following 5 Rhythms. But it is also difficult with two children at home and thinking about if you've passed the bill.

This training will also allow me, by facilitating Sweats, getting financial support that I will use in turn to continue on the journey to become a 5 Rhythms teacher.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si no puedes contribuir a esta campaña, siempre puedes colaborar dándola a conocer a otras personas que puedan estar interesadas. Puedes compartirla desde aquí o a través del medio que prefieras. Puedes escribirme para darme consejos o ideas, si quieres. Serán bienvenidos.

¡Permanece atento a las novedades! ¡Muchas gracias!

Óscar.

If you can not contribute to this campaign, you can always work making it known to others who may be interested. You can share it here or through the medium of your choice. You can write me to give me advice or ideas, if you want. You'll be welcome.

Stay tunned for updates! Thank you so much!

Oscar.

story:
For the past 3 months, co-editor Elena Rose and I have been working on Queer & Trans Artists of Color, Volume Two, featuring:

  • Mimi Thi Nguyen
  • Lexi Adsit
  • Vivek Shraya
  • Indira Allegra
  • Tina Takemoto
  • Mattie Brice
  • Amir Rabiyah
  • and 9 other brilliant queer and trans POC artists!

The last fundraiser only raised half of what I was trying to raise, so I am trying to raise the rest now (enough now to pay each of the artists $100 for contributing their time and wisdom to being in this book). Please support queer and trans artists of color by supporting this project!

Anyone who donates $50 or more will have their name on the acknowledgements page of the book. Any money raised above the goal will be put towards having a launch party for the book in Oakland in a wheelchair-accessible location.

The book should be finished by fall of 2016. Follow me on Twitter for updates!

story:
The Streisand Project

It was the summer of 1976 and I found myself working under the baton of conductor/arranger, Peter Matz -- Emmy, Grammy award-winning Hollywood icon as part of The Carol Burnett Show in Las Vegas, then Lake Tahoe. As music director for the Pointer Sisters, the four women had a twenty-minute feature half-way through Burnett and company's live show. Matz contributed a medley of Ellington tunes strung together with marvelous harmonic transitions and slight time changes for sisters. Afternoons, Matz and I would congregate around the outdoor swimming pool of the MGM Grand and talk music. It was then I realized this was the same Peter Matz I'd spent hours absorbing his arrangements for Barbra Streisand's Third Album. I could hear the string section on "Bewitched, Bothered and Bewildered -- It Had To Be You" and "I had Myself A True Love," as if the great outdoors was an amphitheatre for the mind. 

Years later, I would interview Matz and wife Marilyn Lovell Matz in Toronto. Both had become activists in the fight against AIDS. People, certain occasions, and chance encounters endure a life-time. 

I met Cornelia Luna when she was 20 and worked with her on her one woman show which sold-out 1,200 seats at the Winter Garden Theatre in Toronto. From the downbeat, I knew there was something special about her composure and self-assuredness on stage. Then came the voice. Pure and clear tones, soaring notes, and excellent vocal control.  I thought, what if we could work together beyond one brilliant evening. That didn't happen because the world and fate had other plans for her. Off Cornelia goes to Broadway and a twenty-year career performing in top venues and shows befitting a talent of this magnitude.

Recently, Cornelia and I reconnected and began thinking of working together; a project we could collaborate on and the first to come to mind was the early music of Barbra Streisand. The music that captured our attention and spectacular vocalizing of Ms. Streisand. Cornelia and I began researching the early years -- the first recording, the specials -- My Name Is Barbra, Funny Lady, even the Third Album; songs that have gone unanswered through the years beyond Streisand's initial encounters and composed a list of songs, not a tribute album, but a fresh take on the songs that have such great emotional range, lyrics with a story, melodies that surge and harmonies that are flexible for a piano based jazz trio -- piano, bass and drums; we could bring to life again.

Luna and trio played the Jazz Bistro in Toronto recently and explored twenty selections from Streisand's catalog and the music began to take shape. The past was now the present. With Order Of Canada recipient, bassist Dave Young. the brilliant musicianship of drummer Mark Kelso, and pianist Bill King, the trio instantly orchestrated as the songs underwent improvisational shifts and blending of rhythms and colors in support of vocalist, Luna. Transformation was swift and re-birth inevitable. It was at that moment Luna and I decided the right players were in place and the music would get a true makeover worthy of the recording studio and being titled The Streisand Project.

                                                                                                                                                      -- Bill King

I could hear the string section on "Bewitched, Bothered and Bewildered -- It Had To Be You" and "I had Myself A True Love," as if the great outdoors was an amphitheatre for the mind. Years later, I would interview Matz and wife Marilyn Lovell Matz in Toronto. Both had become activists in the fight against AIDS. People, certain occasions, and chance encounters endure a life-time. I met Cornelia Luna when she was 20 and worked with her on her one woman show which sold-out 1,200 seats at the Winter Garden Theatre in Toronto. From the downbeat, I knew there was something special about her composure and self-assuredness on stage. Then came the voice. Pure and clear tones, soaring notes, and excellent vocal control.  I thought, what if we could work together beyond one brilliant evening. That didn't happen because the world and fate had other plans for her. Off Cornelia goes to Broadway and a twenty-year career performing in top venues and shows befitting a talent of this magnitude.Recently, Cornelia and I reconnected and began thinking of working together; a project we could collaborate on and the first to come to mind was the early music of Barbra Streisand. The music that captured our attention and spectacular vocalizing of Ms. Streisand. Cornelia and I began researching the early years -- the first recording, the specials -- My Name Is Barbra, Funny Lady, even the Third Album; songs that have gone unanswered through the years beyond Streisand's initial encounters and composed a list of songs, not a tribute album, but a fresh take on the songs that have such great emotional range, lyrics with a story, melodies that surge and harmonies that are flexible for a piano based jazz trio -- piano, bass and drums; we could bring to life again.Luna and trio played the Jazz Bistro in Toronto recently and explored twenty selections from Streisand's catalog and the music began to take shape. The past was now the present. With Order Of Canada recipient, bassist Dave Young. the brilliant musicianship of drummer Mark Kelso, and pianist Bill King, the trio instantly orchestrated as the songs underwent improvisational shifts and blending of rhythms and colors in support of vocalist, Luna. Transformation was swift and re-birth inevitable. It was at that moment Luna and I decided the right players were in place and the music would get a true makeover worthy of the recording studio and being titled The Streisand Project.                                                                                                                                                      -- Bill King

story:
This fundraiser is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of our second season must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

Why Help Us?

We see many different theater companies, or dance companies, or performance art companies in this city, but never have we seen one that encompasses all of them. This company is composed of branches: a theater branch, a dance branch, a new works branch, a musical theater branch, a children's theater branch, and a multimedia branch. When you audition for this company and are invited in, you are a member of all branches. You may do a dance show one year, but then have the opportunity to be a part of a play the next.

    We’ve created a strictly non-union company where all artists come together. A company where a singer, an actor, a designer, a director, and a painter, could work together on a dance piece. By creating a structure where a company has many branches, it allows artists to either expand and grow on what they already love in a safe and nurturing environment OR try something new! Whether it be on your own, or with a mentor in another branch.

It is so important that we support the future of our industry, and that's exactly what this company is geared towards. 

The work we are doing is important. It's necessary. It's coming from the voices of tomorrow. The artists of tomorrow. The leaders of tomorrow. The work is honest, it's passionate, it's innovative. We strive to create work that leaves people thinking--work that causes people to reflect on the state of our country and our world.

 

Where Will This Money Go?

If we reach our goal of $35,000, we will be able to:

- Put up 4 full Productions: a musical, a play, a dance show, and an original work

- Create a year of Children's Theatre in which we will go into schools throughout New York, performing different works by Aesop and educating children aged 9-11 in the concept of literary devices.

- film our first web series! An original 30 minute per episode, 10 episode season!

- pay our actors, directors, and designers for all productions

- pay our film crew for what is sure to be A LOT of time and energy

- afford decent spaces, get the proper insurance, pay for rights and licensing for all productions,

- create capital for future seasons!

If we aren't able to reach our goal, the money raised will go towards the first shows in our season, and we will have to look at other methods of fundraising to cover the shortfall. We need to be able to offer these artists all the support and tools that they deserve!

In our first season of 3 shows we were able to establish an average of over 100 patrons a production with over $1600 in ticket revenue a production. With more work consistently being made and the community growing, we are confident that these numbers will continue to grow.

 

We Won't Give Up!

Last year, we weren't able to raise the necessary funds and it definitely created many obstacles. Our Producing Artistic Director, Alex Nicholson, definitely had moments where he felt discouraged, where he questioned why he started this, where he considered giving up. But when he looked at all the artists that were counting on him, they were inspired by the work that was being put up. They were excited to be a part of a community that helped them grow instead of knocking them down. It became apparent how necessary it was to keep the work alive, so he worked extra shifts and searched high and low for every penny he could find, and he made it happen. Its one of the great qualities of this company: our members take the work seriously. The work is important and necessary.

If you aren't able to contribute, we understand. But you can definitely still share and spread the word! If we can find 3500 people who can give us 10 dollars, we will reach our goal. 3500 may seem like a lot of people, but it all comes down to how well we can get this word out there! Help us reach this goal in whatever way you can, and we promise you will see the result of your fiscal or social contribution!

story:
English readers, please scroll down.

La campagne est à présent terminée ! 

Pour en savoir plus : rendez-vous sur designerbox.com !

 

Loin d'un design standardisé et jetable et de la haute création réservée aux élites, Iconic Product Collection (IPC), maison d’édition optimiste, ouvre une troisième voie innovante et réjouissante !

Avec sa collection d’objets singuliers et accessibles, IPC permet à tous de sortir des sentiers battus du « déjà vu » et du « commercial ». Depuis 3 ans, nous bousculons les codes de la décoration en proposant des objets à histoire pour faire vivre vos intérieurs de manière durable ! Aidez nous à faire de ce projet une réalité ! 

 

En pré-commandant en avant-première votre Duralex et en nous aidant à atteindre notre objectif de campagne vous recevrez - le presse-agrumes Monsieur C ou le duo de gobelet Picardie - à un prix privilégié. 

Et recevez ces produits - dans un joli packaging, prêt à offrir ou à s'offrir - chez vous au mois de Février pour commencer l’année du bon pied !

Vous pourrez également - le temps de la campagne - profitez de notre première collection à prix réduit !

Le pack Noël vous sera envoyé dès la fin de la campagne ! Vous pourrez choisir au choix deux produits parmi la première collection : une lampe, le duo de coquetiers, une salière poivrière et un ramequin et les glisser au pied du sapin :)

Pour la sélection des couleurs, ne vous inquiétez pas, nous vous contacterons dès la fin de la campagne pour connaître votre choix !

Vous rencontrez des difficultés pour valider votre panier ? On vous guide pas à pas, juste là !

 

Pour célébrer le 70ème anniversaire de Duralex, les talentueux designers du 5.5 designstudio ont dessiné une série d’accessoires (ré) créatifs et utiles pour habiller le fameux verre Picardie, ex-star des cantines scolaires !

Notre première collection de Duralex (composée de 4 produits) a vu le jour sur le salon Maison & Objet en Septembre 2016. L'incroyable accueil que vous lui avez réservé nous a donné des ailes !

Vous avez eu envie de voir plus d'objets dans cette collection, nous vous avons écouté et souhaitons aujourd'hui produire deux nouveaux objets que vous avez choisis (Vous avez voté en masse sur tous les réseaux !) :

Un presse-agrumes pour faire le plein de vitamines !

Un gobelet à emporter pour s'hydrater tout au long de la journée.

 

 

Acheter un produit IPC, c'est se faire plaisir mais c'est aussi faire les choses bien !

Au sein de notre équipe jeune et motivée de supermen & women, nous donnons chaque jour le meilleur de nous-même pour vous proposer des produits en accord avec nos valeurs : 

Une vraie proposition design ! Pour faire un pied de nez aux objets de consommation de masse, trop souvent vus et revus. 

    Un savoir-faire fort, technologique et artisanal, pour assurer la qualité du produit. 

       Des matériaux nobles et recyclables pour une consommation plus responsable. 

     Des usines partenaires européennes et à taille humaine !

 

Le 5.5 designstudio, déjà multi récompensé, manie l’art du second degré avec générosité.Auteur d’un design accessible, le studio se plait à dérider des pièces de luxe comme des objets de consommation courante pour redessiner un quotidien joyeux, pratique où ses (ré)inventions percutantes s’inscrivent comme des évidences.

Objet culte et générationnel, le Picardie de Duralex était un terrain d’expérimentations idéal pour les jeunes trentenaires du studio.

 

Prédicateur d’âges improbables et distributeur de gages à la cantine, le petit numéro sous le verre a fait coulé beaucoup d’encre. Numéro de série ? Simplement là pour faire parler petits et grands ? L’origine des « âges » dissimulés sous le verre reste un mystère.

Une chose est certaine, sa recette de fabrication lui confère une résistance sans pareille, qui lui vaut désormais une (très) solide réputation dans le monde entier. La preuve en est que le verre a quasiment l’âge de son « créateur » qui a fêté l’an dernier ses 70 printemps et est toujours fabriqué dans son usine d’origine près d’Orléans. 

S'offrir un Duralex c'est s'offrir un objet ludique, esthétique et utile. C'est s'entourer d'objets uniques racontant une histoire !

 

Pour rendre le design accessible, nous devons co-financer les moules nécessaires à la production des accessoires Duralex sans que cela se répercute sur le prix final des produits. 

Ces moules à injection en métal représentent un investissement initial très important.

Le crowdfunding s’est donc imposé à nous comme une évidence car il permet d'absorber une partie de cet investissement et de maintenir ainsi accessible le prix final des produits.

Pendant toute la campagne, pré-commandez vos Duralex préférés à des prix encore plus exclusifs. Alors, n'attendez plus ! Retombez en enfance avec ces objets décalés et offrez-vous un objet de créateur pour pimenter votre quotidien !

Le montant nécessaire au co-financement des moules est de 8000 euros.

Si nous dépassons cet objectif et atteignons 15 000 euros, cela nous permettra de financer 1000 exemplaires supplémentaires à destination des boutiques. Pour vous remercier de votre soutien, nous offrirons à tous les paniers supérieurs à 40 euros 6 verres Duralex 9cl. 

Si nous atteignons 20 000 euros, cela nous permettra de lancer dans un second temps, un troisième accessoires Duralex. Nous offrirons alors à tous les paniers supérieurs à 70 euros le livre Repas de Famille, aux éditions Phaidon.

Pour prendre part à ce projet, pré-commandez dès maintenant vos Duralex préférés. 

Mais soutenir ce projet c'est aussi en parler autour de vous, le partager sur vos réseaux sociaux... Bref faire du bruit car n'oubliez pas, notre réussite dépend de vous :)

Partagez nous sur Facebook depuis la page de campagne et recevez une petite surprise à télécharger ! (A 500 partages)

 

 

Half-way between a mass produced, standardised and throwaway design and the high quality creativity reserved for the privileged few, Iconic Product Collection (IPC), an optimistic publishing house, is introducing an innovative and welcome third way!

With its collection of unusual and affordable objects, IPC allows everyone to move away from the well-trodden paths of “seen it before” and the “commercial”. For the last 3 years we have been pushing the boundaries of decorative norms by offering historic objects to bring your interiors to life!

In celebration of the 70th anniversary of Duralex, the talented designers of the 5.5 designstudio have designed a series of creative, fun and useful accessories to go with the famous Picardie glass, the former star of school canteens!

Our first Duralex collection (consisting of 4 products) was first seen at the Maison & Objet’s September show. The incredible welcome that you gave it, gave us wings!

You wanted to see more objects in this collection; we listened to you and would now like to produce two new objects that you have chosen (chosen by vote):

A lemon press to keep you topped up with vitamins!

A portable cup to keep you hydrated all day long.

Pre-order your preview Duralex at a privileged price. 

And receive these products – in attractive packaging suitable for a gift or to treat yourself – at home in February to start the year on the right foot!

You can also – during the campaign – enjoy our first collection at a discount price!

The Christmas pack will be sent to you immediately after the end of the campaign!

 

 

 

The 5.5 designstudio, already a winner of many awards, has a good-natured way of handling irony and humour. Producing affordable design, the studio delights in adding a lighter touch to luxury items as well as everyday consumer goods in order to redesign a cheerful, practical daily life in which its punchy (re)inventions self-evidently belong.

A cult and generational object, the Duralex Picardie was an ideal area of experiment for the studio’s young thirty-somethings.

 

A declaimer of improbable ages and canteen token dispenser, a great deal of ink has flowed because of the small number under the glass. A serial number? There simply to get young and old talking? The origin of the “ages” hidden under the glass remains a mystery.

One thing is certain - its manufacturing formula gives it unparalleled strength, which has now earned it a (very) solid reputation throughout the world. The proof is that the glass is almost the same age as its “creator” which celebrated its 70th birthday last year and is still made at its original factory near Orléans. 

Treating yourself to a Duralex is to give yourself something that is fun, attractive and useful. It is to surround yourself with unique objects that tell a story!

 

Purchasing an IPC product is not just giving yourself pleasure but doing things well too!

As members of our young and highly motivated team of supermen & women we give of our best every day in order to offer you products in line with our values: 

A genuine design proposal ! In order to cock a snook at mass produced goods, too often seen again and again. 

  Strong technical and craft knowledge and expertise to ensure a quality product. 

     High quality natural and recyclable materials for more responsible consumption. 

   European partner factories and on a human scale!

 

To make the design affordable, we have to finance the moulds needed for the production of Duralex accessories without impacting on the final price of the products. 

These metal injection moulds entail a very considerable initial investment.

So crowdfunding seemed obvious to us because it makes it possible to absorb part of this investment and thus maintain the final price of the products.

Throughout the campaign, pre-order your favourite Duralex products at even more exclusive prices. So don’t wait any longer! Relive your childhood with these offbeat objects and give yourself a designer object to spice up your life!

 

To participate in this project, pre-order your favourite Duralex any time from now on. 

But supporting this project also means spreading the word, sharing it on social networks... In short, getting people interested, because don’t forget, our success depends on you :)

if we reach more than 500 Shares for the campaign on Facebook, we will send all participants a small surprise to download!

 

                           

 

Pour réaliser cet objectif, nous avons minutieusement planifié le calendrier de production et de livraison avec nos fournisseurs et partenaires.

Nous avons maintenant trois ans d'expérience (!) en conception et fabrication de produits de design contemporain. Nous savons appréhender les risques qui peuvent survenir à tout moment dans un processus de production. Mais comme pour tout développement de produit et même en cas de tests rigoureux, des défauts de conception peuvent apparaitre et entraîner un retard de livraison.

Il sera par ailleurs probablement nécessaire d’effectuer quelques ajustements mineurs au produit final. Les prototypes de pré-production sont là pour tester et s’assurer de notre capacité à tenir notre promesse en terme de qualité et de nous permettre d'intégrer nos ajustements ainsi que ceux suggérés par nos partenaires de fabrication. Tous les ajustements seront décidés dans votre intérêt, celui du consommateur. Nous vous informerons précisément de l’évolution des produits et des raisons des ajustements effectués.

En ce qui concerne les livraisons, l'équipe Designerbox-IPC épaulée de son « efficace » partenaire logistique justifient d’une grande expérience dans la préparation et l'exécution de commandes dans le monde entier, ceci pour permettre de vous envoyer vos contributions dans les temps :)

Malgré une planification minutieuse, un accident en fabrication ou lors de l’expédition peut bien sûr toujours survenir. Ce que nous pouvons vous promettre à 100% est de vous tenir au courant à chaque étape du processus de production en étant totalement transparents sur son avancement !

Merci encore pour votre aide !

 

In order to achieve this objective, we have meticulously planned the production and delivery schedule with our suppliers and partners.

We now have three years experience (!) in the creation and manufacture of contemporary design products. We know how to assess the risks that may arise at any moment in a production process. But as for any product development and even with the most rigorous testing, design faults can appear and lead to a delivery delay.

In addition to which it will probably be necessary to make some minor adjustments to the final product. Pre-production prototypes are there for testing and making sure we are able to keep our promise in terms of quality and enable us to incorporate our own adjustments as well as those suggested by our manufacturing partners. All adjustments will be decided upon in your interest, and that of the consumer. We will inform you precisely what changes have been made to products and the reason for the adjustments made.

With regard to delivery, the Designerbox-IPC team, supported by its “effective” logistics partner, with proven extensive experience in the processing and fulfilment of orders worldwide, to allow you to send your contributions in time :)

Despite meticulous planning, of course incidents during manufacture or dispatch may still occur. What we can promise is to keep you fully informed at each stage of the production process by being completely transparent about its progress!

Thank you again for your help!

Mais soutenir ce projet c'est aussi en parler autour de vous, le partager sur vos réseaux sociaux... Bref faire du bruit car n'oubliez pas, notre réussite dépend de vous :)

Partagez nous sur Facebook depuis la page de campagne et recevez une petite surprise à télécharger ! (A 500 partages) 


 

Half-way between a mass produced, standardised and throwaway design and the high quality creativity reserved for the privileged few, Iconic Product Collection (IPC), an optimistic publishing house, is introducing an innovative and welcome third way!


With its collection of unusual and affordable objects, IPC allows everyone to move away from the well-trodden paths of “seen it before” and the “commercial”. For the last 3 years we have been pushing the boundaries of decorative norms by offering historic objects to bring your interiors to life!

In celebration of the 70th anniversary of Duralex, the talented designers of the 5.5 designstudio have designed a series of creative, fun and useful accessories to go with the famous Picardie glass, the former star of school canteens!
Our first Duralex collection (consisting of 4 products) was first seen at the Maison & Objet’s September show. The incredible welcome that you gave it, gave us wings!
You wanted to see more objects in this collection; we listened to you and would now like to produce two new objects that you have chosen (chosen by vote):
A lemon press to keep you topped up with vitamins!

A portable cup to keep you hydrated all day long.


Pre-order your preview Duralex at a privileged price. 
And receive these products – in attractive packaging suitable for a gift or to treat yourself – at home in February to start the year on the right foot!

You can also – during the campaign – enjoy our first collection at a discount price!


The Christmas pack will be sent to you immediately after the end of the campaign! 

  

The 5.5 designstudio, already a winner of many awards, has a good-natured way of handling irony and humour. Producing affordable design, the studio delights in adding a lighter touch to luxury items as well as everyday consumer goods in order to redesign a cheerful, practical daily life in which its punchy (re)inventions self-evidently belong.

A cult and generational object, the Duralex Picardie was an ideal area of experiment for the studio’s young thirty-somethings.
 

A declaimer of improbable ages and canteen token dispenser, a great deal of ink has flowed because of the small number under the glass. A serial number? There simply to get young and old talking? The origin of the “ages” hidden under the glass remains a mystery.

One thing is certain - its manufacturing formula gives it unparalleled strength, which has now earned it a (very) solid reputation throughout the world. The proof is that the glass is almost the same age as its “creator” which celebrated its 70th birthday last year and is still made at its original factory near Orléans. 
Treating yourself to a Duralex is to give yourself something that is fun, attractive and useful. It is to surround yourself with unique objects that tell a story!
 

Purchasing an IPC product is not just giving yourself pleasure but doing things well too!
As members of our young and highly motivated team of supermen & women we give of our best every day in order to offer you products in line with our values: 
A genuine design proposal ! In order to cock a snook at mass produced goods, too often seen again and again. 
  Strong technical and craft knowledge and expertise to ensure a quality product. 
     High quality natural and recyclable materials for more responsible consumption. 
   European partner factories and on a human scale!
 

To make the design affordable, we have to finance the moulds needed for the production of Duralex accessories without impacting on the final price of the products. 
These metal injection moulds entail a very considerable initial investment.
So crowdfunding seemed obvious to us because it makes it possible to absorb part of this investment and thus maintain the final price of the products.


Throughout the campaign, pre-order your favourite Duralex products at even more exclusive prices. So don’t wait any longer! Relive your childhood with these offbeat objects and give yourself a designer object to spice up your life!
 

To participate in this project, pre-order your favourite Duralex any time from now on. 
But supporting this project also means spreading the word, sharing it on social networks... In short, getting people interested, because don’t forget, our success depends on you :)

if we reach more than 500 Shares for the campaign on Facebook, we will send all participants a small surprise to download! 
                            

 

Pour réaliser cet objectif, nous avons minutieusement planifié le calendrier de production et de livraison avec nos fournisseurs et partenaires.

Nous avons maintenant trois ans d'expérience (!) en conception et fabrication de produits de design contemporain. Nous savons appréhender les risques qui peuvent survenir à tout moment dans un processus de production. Mais comme pour tout développement de produit et même en cas de tests rigoureux, des défauts de conception peuvent apparaitre et entraîner un retard de livraison.
Il sera par ailleurs probablement nécessaire d’effectuer quelques ajustements mineurs au produit final. Les prototypes de pré-production sont là pour tester et s’assurer de notre capacité à tenir notre promesse en terme de qualité et de nous permettre d'intégrer nos ajustements ainsi que ceux suggérés par nos partenaires de fabrication. Tous les ajustements seront décidés dans votre intérêt, celui du consommateur. Nous vous informerons précisément de l’évolution des produits et des raisons des ajustements effectués.
En ce qui concerne les livraisons, l'équipe Designerbox-IPC épaulée de son « efficace » partenaire logistique justifient d’une grande expérience dans la préparation et l'exécution de commandes dans le monde entier, ceci pour permettre de vous envoyer vos contributions dans les temps :)
Malgré une planification minutieuse, un accident en fabrication ou lors de l’expédition peut bien sûr toujours survenir. Ce que nous pouvons vous promettre à 100% est de vous tenir au courant à chaque étape du processus de production en étant totalement transparents sur son avancement !
Merci encore pour votre aide !
 

In order to achieve this objective, we have meticulously planned the production and delivery schedule with our suppliers and partners.
We now have three years experience (!) in the creation and manufacture of contemporary design products. We know how to assess the risks that may arise at any moment in a production process. But as for any product development and even with the most rigorous testing, design faults can appear and lead to a delivery delay.
In addition to which it will probably be necessary to make some minor adjustments to the final product. Pre-production prototypes are there for testing and making sure we are able to keep our promise in terms of quality and enable us to incorporate our own adjustments as well as those suggested by our manufacturing partners. All adjustments will be decided upon in your interest, and that of the consumer. We will inform you precisely what changes have been made to products and the reason for the adjustments made.
With regard to delivery, the Designerbox-IPC team, supported by its “effective” logistics partner, with proven extensive experience in the processing and fulfilment of orders worldwide, to allow you to send your contributions in time :)
Despite meticulous planning, of course incidents during manufacture or dispatch may still occur. What we can promise is to keep you fully informed at each stage of the production process by being completely transparent about its progress!
Thank you again for your help!

story:
The Aim

The Aim is to showcase all my current portrait art on Caitriona in one book. It's important to me to show this wonderful subject to the fans as a physical item.

 

The Plan

The plan is to attract at least 40 orders for the book. Printing can be costly and the printer needs a minimum of 40 copies for the book to go to print. Hopefully it can be achieved through the presence of social media and the wonderful fan base.

 

The Book

My admiration of the subject is total respect and amazement. My goal is to give each fan a fulfilling experience when turning the pages of the book.

Specifics

The book will be perfect bound and size will be 8 inches by 11.2 inches.  The page count is 92, color and black and white. 

All books will be signed and numbered.

 

The Bonus Items

One free print will come with the book once we reach 40 orders. Signed and numbered.

Two free prints will come with the book once we reach 60 orders plus a Caitriona book mark.

Three free prints will come with the book once we reach 80 orders along with the book mark and plus a greeting card.

 

 

The Sketch

Here is an example of the custom sketch for the third perk. Which will be digitally delivered.

Print One

Print Two

Print Three

story:
Moskowitz Gallery

Visit us at moskowitzgallery.com

Located in the burgeoning gallery community of Hollywood, Moskowitz Gallery provides a powerful outlet for contemporary art.


Moskowitz Gallery represents beginning to mid-career artists. This community is defined by a shared dedication to long-term practice and a cohesive aesthetic. The gallery is committed to engaging and inspiring the public through intimate art experiences. Focusing on artwork of the highest quality and integrity, Moskowitz Gallery introduces passionate rising artists to the West Coast.


  •  Brooke Gerson (Director)  and Adam Moskowitz (Curator) have accomplished backgrounds in the arts and are excited to create a space and develop programming that will enrich the Los Angeles art scene.
  • For the benefit of society and to help us better understand the direction in which contemporary art is traveling, it is of utmost importance that this work be experienced in the international art hub of Los Angeles.
  • Your contributions will help us fully realize our Inaugural Exhibition and enable us to sustain the valuable programing of music concerts, lectures, artist talks, and dance performances for public benefit. 


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $15,000

Your contributions will cover:

  •  Framing for the Inaugural Exhibition
  •  construction: lighting, creating walls, finishing floors, painting, installing exhibitions the space is 3,000 square feet but is in need of a lot of work to bring it to art gallery standards
  • design costs: branding, signage, web design, and architectural renderings.

PERKS! 

One of the most exciting parts of this campaign are the rewards YOU receive for your gracious contributions.  

There is everything from invites to the VIP opening to a catered dinner with the artists and curator.

This Indiegogo campaign is the only place you will be able to acquire ORIGINAL WORKs OF ART at these low price points.

See the rest of the rewards on the right. ---------------------->

ANYTHING HELPS

If you can not contribute monetarily, we understand!

Share this page through Email, on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr...Any place you can think of that access more people who could help. 

SPREADING THE WORD IS JUST AS IMPORTANT TO THE SUCCESS OF THIS CAMPAIGN. 


Most Importantly, 

THANK YOU!

story:
Pecan Street Festival

Greetings! My name is Monica Rodriguez. I am a freelance artist and avid smoothie drinker. I have been drawing since I was a wee thing and have also been painting for a substantial part of my life. Recently, I've dabbled in handmade jewelry and crafting accessories... all of which I'd love to display and sell to the public.

This campaign is here to raise money to purchase a booth for the Pecan Street Festival in Austin, TX. This large event is held along ATX's famous 6th Street, which is an important art and music hub.

  • It is the 2nd largest festival overall in Central Texas with an estimated attendance of over 200,000 attendees per show. Features include over 250 vendors, 5 stages, large sponsor displays, children's art workshops, a carnival, interactive sections, a petting zoo, and much more.


Getting this money will provide me the greatest opportunity to promote my art!

What I Need

The price for the smallest booth (10ft x 11ft): $490

The remainder of the asking amount will go toward a folding table, chairs, water and snacks (as I have to provide all of this). I might have a friend or two being forced to-- I mean, helping me with this stuff.

If my entire goal isn't reached by the deadline, it will be saved for the next opportune major art festival.

What's In It For You?

Every person who contributes at least $10 will receive an original sketch by me! (You know, so when I'm rich and famous, you can sell it on Ebay.)


Pecan Street Festival will be my first event showing off my art that I've ever been a part of. I'm really excited and I know I won't disappoint.

Even If You Can't Donate...

Please, be sure to share this fundraiser with your human companions! Ask them nicely to visit this campaign.

When they do, give them a hug for me... Then, smack them on the butt and tell them they're beautiful.

story:
Short Summary

It's the artist-at-large Membership Drive!

artist-at-large is a tumbling social networking community, an arts and cultural travel magazine as well as a creative community for artists, writers, creatives, photographers, gallerists, museum nerds, and cultural travelers. Good for the artist and collector, trip researcher and armchair traveler, you will find a blend of community, conversation, creative portfolios and blogs, travel tales and information, photos of the day, and listings for exhibitions, open studios, workshops, and cultural events from around the world. The stories and information presented on the site are written in a way that are meant to be valuable over a long period of time, like an art or travel magazine that you keep by your desk and flip through when you need information, or just want to daydream, while the community is meant to engage and inspire.

artist-at-large is supported by its community members!

Right now this fundraising campaign will finance the current site upgrade with a membership drive. The upgrade will make it easier to access the site and participate via mobile devices as well.

Your contribution of any size and participation in artist-at-large will keep it online and guide it into the future!

What We Need & What You Get

The $5000 raised will be going towards site upkeep and administration, web hosting fees, and day to day operations.

Donating at the $25 level will get you a lot of good karma and a three-month membership - with an option at the end of that period to sign up with an ongoing subscription should you want to.

Donating at the $50 level will get you one year of membership in the artist-at-large community which includes access to "The Stream" and online groups, and your very own presence on the site via a blog, where you can post your work, write about your days in the studio, or your travels as a cultural jetsetter! At the end of the year, you'll have the option to subscribe at either our monthly or annual membership levels.

Donating at the $600 level will make you an Angel! Support us in this big way and you'll be a lifetime community member of artist-at-large! You can participate as much or as liitle as you wish.

Every donation towards the goal will still help should we not reach our final numers! The priorities of the fundraising goal are: web-hosting fees, site administration, and day-to-day operations.

The Impact

Will artist-at-large change the world?

Probably not, unless you can see the value of an online social network that respects artists' copyrights, is almost completely advertising free, is focused on the subjects you hold dear to your heart, creates community and is supported by the community it serves.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

Please  get the word out and make some noise about the artist-at-large campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools and also retweet and share status updates on other social networks!
