story:
"The Healing Body Heals the Soul"

I’m J Michael Walker, a Los Angeles-based visual artist, photographer and author. For over thirty years I’ve crafted images honoring marginalized people and women, particularly women of color, in works that come from my life experiences and friendships, and speak to the core of my being as a person and artist.

My life and art have led me to create, from the mountains of rural northern Mexico and the Tarahumara Indians, to homeless women and mothers at a Los Angeles transitional residence; and from an island in Bahia, Brazil, that is the center of the African Diaspora for South America, to the first HIV-AIDS clinic in Los Angeles County for Spanish-speaking immigrants.

In all of my work I use portraiture to illuminate the spiritual essence of whomever I draw, paint, or photograph; to truly view the eyes as windows into the soul. Time and again I've been blessed to see how the process affects those being portrayed. This holds most true, perhaps, with my Bodies Mapping Time project of nude photographic portraits of women, whose theme is "A woman's body is a map of her life's journey." I work collaboratively with each woman in finding the poses and, perhaps more importantly, in selecting the final images which will represent her. Consistently, women who participate find the process self-empowering, and even transformative in how it affects their self-image and confidence.

And now South Africa calls: The small non-profit ArtAIDSArt organization has invited me to come work with and portray the women it serves at their community center near Cape Town, South Africa – Women impacted by poverty and patriarchy, racism and sexism, and the threats of gender-based violence and HIV-AIDS.

The statistics are extraordinary: South Africa has one of the world’s highest incidents of HIV-AIDS infection – perhaps 18% of the adult population – and possibly the highest rate of gender-based violence (45% of women in the Western Cape). Both of these burdens fall overwhelmingly on the backs of black women and mothers residing in the nation's townships.

I'm  reaching out in hopes you'll support this project of art, exchange, and change. My first week in South Africa, I will spend time at the eKhaya eKasi community center that ArtAIDSArt operates near Cape Town - to break bread and sit with the women, to listen, to learn, and build trust.
Over the next three weeks, I'll work individually with each woman, in the studio that ArtAIDSArt provides me, on the west side of Cape Town. I'll prepare some tea for us to share over conversation, then we'll work collaboratively, artist and model, in a protected environment, to capture the spiritual essence residing in each of these resilient women. Equally important, each woman will have a voice in selecting the images that best represent her.

I hope to learn the stories and create meaningful portraits of the women of the township, and find inspiration for future paintings and drawings; also I'm committed to pay each woman a living wage for the time she works with me, plus a percentage of any future sales of her image in my art. 

ArtAIDSArt hopes to see healing, self-awareness, and self-confidence flourish among the women who participate, and to draw attention to the important work they undertake in Khayelitsha township, 
But, in this society where women’s power is unacknowledged and their bodies are devalued; where women bear most of the burden and all of the blame and shame for HIV-AIDS - even though it is overwhelmingly passed onto them from male partners/attackers - our deepest goal is that the brave process of posing for portraits that honor women, in a supportive atmosphere, and of truly BEING SEEN, will further along each woman’s healing, self-empowerment and self-knowledge, permitting them, in Yoliswa’s poignant words, “to see our bodies, to know our bodies, to respect our bodies.”

Thank you for your support!  Ubuntu.

What I Need for this Project & What You'll Get:

My goal is to raise $3000 for this project.

While ArtAIDSArt, on their shoestring budget, is providing me a studio and place to stay for the 4 weeks I’ll be in Cape Town (Estimated value $2500+), I’m responsible for all other costs, including:

Roundtrip airfare between Los Angeles and Cape Town; all my meals for four weeks (August 7 – September 4); local travel and transportation inside South Africa; my art materials, photographic supplies, etc.; and daily incidentals (local SIM card, etc).

Additionally, and importantly, I will be paying each of the women for their time, their taxi fares to and from my studio, and providing them a meal on the days we work together.

How You Can Help, and Ways I’ll Say “Thanks”

$5 - Thank You for your Vote of Support! Let me sign you up to receive my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project.

$10 – Thank You! Let me send you an email of gratitude AND sign you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project.

$25 –This is an important level of support, representing a fair day’s wage for the women in the township, which I intend to compensate each woman for the time she takes off from other responsibilities to work with me. If you can help out at this level, I will send you a personal thank you on a notecard featuring one of my photographs; AND sign you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project; AND give you a SHOUT-OUT in an issue of my newsletter!

$35 – Great! When I send you a personal thank you on a notecard featuring my artwork, I will ALSO send you a selection of EIGHT notecards of my artworks you can use; AND I'll sign you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project; AND I will give you a SHOUT-OUT in an upcoming issue of the newsletter!

$50 – Wonderful! I will send you a signed, archival-quality full-color 5x7-inch print on fine watercolor paper of one of these portraits as a Thank You gift. There are two versions available – one dressed in blue, and one in red. You may have either one – Just note it in the Perks column. PLUS, I will sign you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project; AND I will give you a SHOUT-OUT in an upcoming issue of the newsletter! 

$75 – For this special price you can take BOTH of these portraits, the blue and the red. Yes, you will get TWO signed, archival-quality full-color 5x7-inch prints on fine watercolor paper; ALONG WITH a personal thank you on a notecard featuring one of my photographs; PLUS, I will sign you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project; AND I will give you a SHOUT-OUT in an upcoming issue of the newsletter! Thanks very much!

$100 – Nice! Let me send you a signed, archival-quality full-color 8 x 10 inch print on fine watercolor paper of my portrait as a limited-edition Thank You gift. There are two versions available – one dressed in blue, and one in red. You may have either one – Just note it in the Perks column. AND I will send you a personal thank you via snail mail, on a notecard featuring one of my photographs; PLUS, I will sign you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project; AND I will give you a SHOUT-OUT in an upcoming issue of the newsletter!

$125 – This is equal to a week’s living wages for the township women! If you can support my project at this level, I will send you BOTH portraits – the blue and the red: TWO signed, archival-quality full-color 8 x 10 inch prints on fine watercolor paper; AND I will send you a personal thank you on a notecard featuring one of my photographs; PLUS, I will sign you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project; AND I will give you a SHOUT-OUT in an upcoming issue of the newsletter! Thanks very much!

$175 – Thank you so much! Select one of the portraits, the red or the blue, and I will send it to you as a signed, archival-quality full-color 11 x 14 inch print on fine watercolor paper, in an edition limited to the number ordered during this 21-day campaign. PLUS, I’ll send you a personal thank you on a notecard featuring one of my photographs; AND sign you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project; AND give you a SHOUT-OUT in an upcoming issue of the newsletter!

$300 – Wonderful! Let me sign for you one of my portraits, either the red or the blue, your choice, as a limited-edition and numbered, archival-quality full-color 22 x 30 inch print on fine watercolor paper; ACCOMPANIED BY my personal thank you on one of my notecards; AND I’ll also sign you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project; AND give you a SHOUT-OUT in an upcoming issue of the newsletter!

$500 – This is equal to one woman’s living wages for a month in the township! If you can support my project at this level, I will send you BOTH of my portraits – the blue one and the red one: that is, TWO signed, archival-quality full-color 22 x 30 inch prints on fine watercolor paper; AND I’ll send you a personal thank you on a notecard featuring one of my photographs; PLUS, sign you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project; AND give you a significant SHOUT-OUT in newsletter! Thank you SO very much!

$1500 – This amount, representing half of my funding goal, will cover my airfare to and from Cape Town! For this extraordinary level of support, I will create for you a UNIQUE PORTFOLIO of FIFTEEN PORTRAITS of the women I meet and work with in South Africa. All 15 portraits will be printed as archival-quality full-color 8 x 10 inch prints on fine watercolor paper, signed as unique prints, and sent to you in a fine presentation folio. Of course, this portfolio comes accompanied by my personal thank you on one of my notecards; AND I’ll sign you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project; AND give you a major SHOUT-OUT in the newsletter! Thank you SO very much!

$3000 – At this level a generous donor-supporter can consider herself or himself to be THE underwriter of this entire project (Or of Phase II of the project, since we hope I can return to Cape Town in early 2017 to mount a showing of all the women’s portraits in a Cape Town art gallery – something that ArtAIDSArt feels will have a profound effect on the women). If you are able to do this, I have two possible perks in mind for you; either –

a.  I will create for you a UNIQUE PORTFOLIO of FIVE PORTRAITS of the women I meet and work with, printed as archival-quality full-color 22x30 inch prints on fine watercolor paper, signed as unique prints, and sent to you in a fine presentation folio; or –

b.  I will give you a drawn or painted portrait of one of the women, rendered approximately 24 x 36 inches, an absolute original, unique work of art.

In either case, the portfolio or original painting or drawing will come accompanied by my personal thank you on one of my notecards; AND I’ll sign you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project; AND give you a major SHOUT-OUT in the newsletter; AND have your name appear on every newsletter I send out, denoting you as the major funder for this project! Thank you SO very, very much!

The Impact We Can Make with This Project:

As my friend who works with my sponsoring ArtAIDSArt organization told me, “A black woman in South Africa is not taught to see our bodies, to know our bodies, to respect our bodies.” This deficit of vision, knowledge, and empowerment is part of the trauma sustained through centuries of colonialism, apartheid, and patriarchal inequality, and the related ongoing challenges of gender-based violence and HIV-AIDS.

This is what ArtAIDSArt addresses in its community work with the women of Khayelitsha township; and it is the core reason why ArtAIDSArt has invited me to come spend a month among its women, to get to know them, to work with them, and to create loving, powerful portraits of them, so that they may see themselves afresh – radiant in their power, strength, and beauty – as they continue to grow and heal, past these traumas and challenges, into self-empowered and self-confident leaders of their community.

I have exhibited widely, with over 100 group exhibitions in galleries and museums in the United States and South Korea; and over a dozen solo shows in galleries and museums in Mexico and the United States. I have fulfilled more than a dozen public art commissions, grants, fellowships, and artist residencies in the United States and Brazil. And my work can be found in a number of public institutions in the United States, Mexico, and Senegal. I am the published author-illustrator of All the Saints of the City of the Angels: Seeking the Soul of LA on Its Streets (Heyday 2008), which won awards for art book of the year and best non-fiction on the Pacific West. You can view my work at www.jmichaelwalker.com

Risks & Challenges

Of course Cape Town and its township will be very different from LA, but I've profited before and been nourished by spending extended periods of time in unfamiliar surroundings.

Decades ago, I was invited to visit the small village of Sisoguichi, in the mountains of the Copper Canyon, in northern Mexico, to illustrate the first textbook in the native Tarahumara dialect. I was smitten by the landscape, the languages, the cultures, the people (and a certain lovely young lady there), and was culturally and spiritually transformed by the experience (My two-week visit became, essentially, a three-year stay).

More recently, in 2011 I was awarded a Sacatar Fellowship, to spend two months on the island of Itaparica, in the bay that gives Bahia, Brazil its name. This is the center for the African Diaspora of South America, and I was profoundly moved, and inspired, by the Yoruba culture so prevalent there and by the warmth and grace of its peoples. I painted a mural for the community and began a series of drawings and paintings of the Afro-Brazilian women I befriended – a series still growing today.

As an artist, I love challenges and the inspiration born of new surroundings. I look very much forward to the opportunities for growth and understanding that my time in South Africa will afford.

How You Can Help in Other Ways:  

At whatever level you support my project – and even if you do, or can, not contribute monetarily – May I ask you to please spread the word about this campaign and its goals and the value it promises to add to the experiences of the women at the eKhaya eKasi center. Remember, not only are we hoping that participation will aid in the women's progress from trauma, but I am also compensating these women for their time, and promising to give them a share in the proceeds from the eventual sale of their portraits. 

Indiegogo makes it quite easy to share the link and story. I invite you to please partner with me in getting the word out through social media and in conversations with your friends. Thank you so much for your help and support! 

Sincerely, 

Ubuntu, jmichael

for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa and my “Healing the Body

newsletter!
$500 – This is equal to
one woman’s living wages for a month in the township! If you can support my
project at this level, I will send you BOTH of my portraits – the blue
one and the red one: that is, TWO signed, archival-quality full-color 22 x 30 inch
prints on fine watercolor paper; AND I’ll send you a personal thank you on a notecard featuring one of my
photographs; PLUS, sign
you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to
South Africa and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project; AND give you a significant
SHOUT-OUT in newsletter! Thank you SO very much!
$1500 – This amount,
representing half of my funding goal, will cover my airfare to and from Cape
Town! For this extraordinary level of support, I will create for you a UNIQUE
PORTFOLIO of FIFTEEN PORTRAITS of the women I meet and work with in South Africa.
All 15 portraits will be printed as archival-quality full-color 8 x 10 inch prints
on fine watercolor paper, signed as unique prints, and sent to you in a fine
presentation folio. Of course, this portfolio comes accompanied by my personal thank you on one of my notecards; AND I’ll sign you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa
and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project; AND give you a major SHOUT-OUT
in the newsletter! Thank you SO very much!

$3000 – At this level a
generous donor-supporter can consider herself or himself to be THE underwriter
of this entire project (Or of Phase II of the project, since we hope I can
return to Cape Town in early 2017 to mount a showing of all the women’s
portraits in a Cape Town art gallery – something that ArtAIDSArt feels will
have a profound effect on the women). If you are able to do this, I have two
possible perks in mind for you; either – 

a.  I will create for you a UNIQUE PORTFOLIO of FIVE PORTRAITS
of the women I meet and work with, printed as archival-quality full-color
22x30 inch prints on fine watercolor paper, signed as unique prints, and sent
to you in a fine presentation folio; or – 
b.  I will give you a drawn or painted portrait of one of the
women, rendered approximately 24 x 36 inches, an absolute original,
unique work of art.
In either case, the
portfolio or original painting or drawing will come accompanied by my personal thank you on one of my notecards; AND I’ll sign you up for my weekly newsletter about my trip to South Africa
and my “Healing the Body Heals the Soul” project; AND give you a major SHOUT-OUT
in the newsletter; AND have your name appear on every newsletter I send out,
denoting you as the major funder for this project! Thank you SO very, very
much!   

The Impact We Can Make with This Project:


As my friend who works with my sponsoring ArtAIDSArt organization told me, “A
black woman in South Africa is not taught to see our bodies, to know our
bodies, to respect our bodies.” This deficit of vision, knowledge, and
empowerment is part of the trauma sustained through centuries of colonialism,
apartheid, and patriarchal inequality, and the related ongoing challenges of
gender-based violence and HIV-AIDS. 
This is what
ArtAIDSArt addresses in its community work with the women of Khayelitsha
township; and it is the core reason why ArtAIDSArt has invited me to come spend
a month among its women, to get to know them, to work with them, and to create
loving, powerful portraits of them, so that they may see themselves afresh –
radiant in their power, strength, and beauty – as they continue to grow and
heal, past these traumas and challenges, into self-empowered and self-confident
leaders of their community. 
I have
exhibited widely, with over 100 group exhibitions in galleries and museums in
the United States and South Korea; and over a dozen solo shows in galleries and
museums in Mexico and the United States. I have fulfilled more than a dozen
public art commissions, grants, fellowships, and artist residencies in the
United States and Brazil. And my work can be found in a number of public
institutions in the United States, Mexico, and Senegal. I am the published
author-illustrator of All the Saints of the City of the Angels: Seeking the Soul of LA on Its Streets (Heyday 2008), which won awards for art book of the
year and best non-fiction on the Pacific West. You can view my work at www.jmichaelwalker.com


    Risks & Challenges 
Of course
Cape Town and its township will be very different from LA, but I've profited before
and been nourished by spending extended periods of time in unfamiliar
surroundings. 
Decades ago,
I was invited to visit the small village of Sisoguichi, in the mountains of the
Copper Canyon, in northern Mexico, to illustrate the first textbook in the
native Tarahumara dialect. I was smitten by the landscape, the languages, the
cultures, the people (and a certain lovely young lady there), and was
culturally and spiritually transformed by the experience (My two-week visit
became, essentially, a three-year stay). 
More
recently, in 2011 I was awarded a Sacatar Fellowship, to spend two months on
the island of Itaparica, in the bay that gives Bahia, Brazil its name. This is
the center for the African Diaspora of South America, and I was profoundly
moved, and inspired, by the Yoruba culture so prevalent there and by the warmth
and grace of its peoples. I painted a mural for the community and began a
series of drawings and paintings of the Afro-Brazilian women I befriended – a series
still growing today.
As an artist, I love challenges and the inspiration born of new surroundings. I look
very much forward to the opportunities for growth and understanding that my time in South Africa will afford.
    

How You Can Help in Other Ways:  
At whatever level you support my project – and even if you do, or can, not contribute
monetarily – May I ask you to please spread the word about this campaign and its
goals and the value it promises to add to the experiences of the women at the eKhaya eKasi center. Remember, not only are we hoping that participation will aid in the women's progress from trauma, but I am also compensating these women for their time, and promising to give them a share in the proceeds from the eventual sale of their portraits. 
Indiegogo makes it quite easy to share the link and story. I invite
you to please partner with me in getting the word out through social media and in
conversations with your friends. Thank you so much for your help and support! 
Sincerely, 
Ubuntu,
jmichael

story:
An 18 year Burner, Patrick Shearn, and the Poetic Kinetics team have brought many amazing art pieces to the playa.  From the Hope Flower & Venus Flytrap to Holding Flame and Fire in Balance from 2014, we are excited for opportunity to bring this new version of Fire in Balance to the Playa this year.

       


      A Little About Fire in Balance IN THE ROUND  

Fire in Balance IN THE ROUND is an art installation with an inverted fire box suspended in a pagoda-like steel structure, surrounded by a halo of fire dishes. More than 45’ across and 18’ high, the entire piece will create the most mysterious cuddle puddle on the Playa!  Comfortably holding 50 of your fellow Burners, this is a space for people to gather and participate with the extraordinary beauty of inverted fire.  

It takes the scientific principle of inverted fire, where you are capturing fire that wants to rise.  The fire cannot rise so it must reach, deep down, for its fuel.  It has to go down and get oxygen and as soon as it does, it heats up again and rises.  In doing so, it creates this mesmerizing, caramel, silk sheathed, aurora borealis experience that just is extraordinary.

Something of this size is not created by one person and requires the continued encouragement and support from the larger community. Fortunately our local community has provided an immensely diverse network of people with a wide array of helpful skills, from metal fabricators and architects, to digital experts and a handful of awesome people just excited to get to their hands dirty and help however they can.  We’ve been fortunate to find this great group of people who take joy from contributing to bring this gift to the playa.  

This year we're revamping Fire in Balance with a new, circular fire ceiling and deck.  This new design will allow for even more fire.  Although we will be repurposing the fins and fire dishes from the original version of Fire in Balance, everything else on this piece will be new.  

Our construction materials are well north of $15,000. The steel is our largest expense.  Coming in at a distant second is the fire! To keep Fire in Balance burning every night throughout the burn will require over 2600 lbs of propane. Then, there is all of that other stuff, such as trucking to get it out to the playa, gas, hosing, valves, etc. 

Needless to say, there is a lot to build and a lot that needs to be purchased! 


No good deed is left unrewarded, and we have some awesome gifts for you.  In return for helping us bring Fire in Balance to the playa  :)

Every dollar that you donate helps make this project a reality! We need at least $25,000 to bring Fire in Balance IN THE ROUND to the playa.   

Raising this money is one of the first steps that needs to be completed so that our team can focus on the remaining challenges this project presents. Your Fire in Balance team of over 30 artists, engineers, designers, volunteers and dreamers are all committed and eager to put in the work to bring this piece to life but we need YOUR help first and foremost. Please join us in bringing Fire in Balance IN THE ROUND to Burning Man 2016!

*Note: If we do not meet our goal we will bring one of our other Fire Pagodas to the Burn this year instead of Fire in Balance IN THE ROUND.

story:
POPCAP

POPCAP is the international prize for contemporary African photography that is awarded annually to photographers whose work is either created on the African continent or deals with a diaspora of an African country.

RECAP POPCAP - The Anniversary Book

To celebrate POPCAP’s fifth anniversary we will be collating the 25 winning photographic series of the last five years in the book RECAP POPCAP, and personalities from the African photography scene will discuss the present situation in their field. The content of the book will be translated into five languages.

Each copy of RECAP POPCAP will be handcrafted, the exhibition banners of years past incorporated into the covers of the books. This way each book will become a unique specimen that will carry with it the soul of the images and exhibition sites of the past five years.

YOUR SUPPORT

We need your help now in order to be able to complete these unique, hand-bound pieces! Our crowdfunding campaign will go until 31st May. With your help we can reach this goal. We require not just your financial support, but also your engagement as an ambassador for RECAP POPCAP.

Let’s work together to promote a contemporary image of Africa.

TOWARD A MORE CONTEMPORARY VIEW OF AFRICA!

--------------------------------------------

Would you like to know more?

What we do

In 2012 Benjamin Füglister brought the POPCAP prize to life in order to offer a platform for contemporary African photography. Since then POPCAP winners have been selected annually by an international panel of judges. What began with 160 submissions has grown in a mere five years into a project with 900 applications from 94 different countries and around ten exhibitions annually.

Every year the POPCAP team organises a series of exhibitions that take place in public spaces all over the world. This means that the presented photographs and stories reach a lot more people, and visitors are able to build their own image of the many and varied faces of Africa.

Further information about POPCAP can be found on our website www.popcap.cc.

Why another book?

For POPCAP’s fifth anniversary we will be publishing a book that shows a cross-section of the most recent developments in the pulsing, international world of African photography. Together with you we wish to recap the events of the last five years and make them available to future generations. The book will be translated into five languages (English, French, Portuguese, Arabic and German) and will contain works from the following artists:

Julia Runge, Nicolas Henry, Jason Larkin, Sabelo Mlangeni, Thom Pierce, Filipe Branquinho, Zed Nelson, Tahir Carl Karmali, Zied Ben Romdhane, Romaric Tisserand, Joana Choumali, Anoek Steketee, Eefje Blankevoort, Patrick Willocq, Léonard Pongo, Ilan Godfrey, Graeme Williams, Cristina de Middel, Alexia Webster, David Rengel, Álvaro Laiz, Dillon Marsh, Namsa Leuba, Adolphus Opara, Guillaume Bonn, Nabil Boutros, Paolo Patrizi

How much do we need and what will we use it for?

In order to publish the book as planned we require a total of $46,000. We will use this money to cover the following costs:

--------------------------------------------

What you will receive as thanks for your support

We have thought up some unique and lasting perks to say thank you for your support:

\\\\\ As a RECAP POPCAP supporter donating $9 you will receive a digital duck face of a POPCAP artist. We were able to acquire some of the award-winning POPCAP photographers in order to create a duck face series which we are only on offer during this crowdfunding campaign.

\\\\\ As thanks for a donation over $70 you will receive an original signed duckface polaroid from one of the award-winning artists.

\\\\\ You also have the opportunity the get a bag or deckchair produced using original POPCAP exhibition banners.

The winning works of the POPCAP competition are exhibited every year on large-format banners in public spaces in places such as Nigeria, Cape Verde Islands, and Switzerland. After their round-the-world trip these banners are then processed into bags and deckchairs.



\\\\\ We are maintaining the principle of down-cycling for the RECAP POPCAP book. Every copy of the book will be hand-bound and will incorporate the works of the last five years into the cover. Immerse yourself in the recent happenings within the world of contemporary African photography. We want to review the works of the last few years and complement these works with texts from notable authors. In this way we will recap and acknowledge the recent artistic achievements that have occurred on and with the African continent.


Whether you walk through the world with one of our bags or prefer to relax on one of our comfortable deckchairs - perhaps while reading the RECAP POPCAP book - every piece is chic, useful, durable and above all unique!

Each of these perks is a unique item and carries with it the soul of exhibitions past. By purchasing one of these unique items you will become a part of our project and help to make RECAP POPCAP a reality!

\\\\\ There is an exhibition catalogue for every year of POPCAP that presents the winning works of that year and introduces the artists. For $48 you will receive the exhibition catalogues from the years 2013 to 2016.



\\\\\ POPCAP '16 prize winner Julia Runge offers 3 copies of her photobook "Basterland" about the Baster people in Namibia. Get your own special copy signed by the artist with a personal dedication. More information about Julia's work www.juliarunge.com.


\\\\\ Every year a series of limited-edition, signed prints are compiled from the POPCAP winning works for EDITION POPCAP. For $490 we will send you the signed print of your choice.  

You can choose your print from our selection here.



\\\\\ Would you like to meet one of the POPCAP winners in person and get in front of their camera? Here you have the chance to partake in an exclusive photoshoot and have your portrait taken by an outstanding photographer. Treat yourself to this unforgettable experience and gift yourself or someone close to you a special picture of you.

Portrait shoots are possible in the following cities: Cape Town, Brussels, Abidjan, Maputo, Johannesburg and Lagos.



\\\\\ During a three-day stay in Basel you can take a look behind the scenes of POPCAP and the Image Afrique exhibition. We would love to have you there with us at the release of RECAP POPCAP and to be able to give you the opportunity to meet the outstanding photographers in person. You would be living centrally located so that you would be within walking distance of all of the sights, museums, exciting bars and restaurants, as well as shopping districts and of course the beautiful banks of the Rhine river.


\\\\\ If you are feeling particularly curious, then perhaps a one-week trip to the LagosPhoto Festival in Nigeria is for you. During one week you will have the opportunity to discover young artists, new photography and the city of Lagos. This prize includes seven nights in a double bedroom in a luxury hotel in Lagos. What a unique experience to attend one of the most important photographic festivals on the African continent!



\\\\\ For $9.000 you will become an exclusive RECAP POPCAP PATRON! The first page of the book will be dedicated to you and you will also receive a signed copy of RECAP POPCAP as well as a signed POPCAP EDITION print. You will also receive an invitation to the book preview in Basel where you will have the opportunity to meet this year’s POPCAP winners.


--------------------------------------------

Your support arrives

In autumn 2016 we will introduce RECAP POPCAP to the public. In order to commence production of the book, we need your involvement now. Our crowdfunding campaign goes until 31st May!

In this way we can...

  • begin production of RECAP POPCAP just before the crowdfunding campaign ends.
  • develop the book more extensively and exclusively depending on the support we receive.
  • gradually pay the wages of all those involved in the project (tailors, bookbinders, designers etc). All those involved are passionate about their work and their involvement should be acknowledged accordingly.
  • Should we exceed our target amount, the surplus funds will be put back into POPCAP to go toward the promotion of African photography.

--------------------------------------------

Share your enthusiasm

On the one hand we require financial support, but beyond that we wish to network the photographers and ourselves with as many interesting people as possible, so that we can further pursue longterm goals. It’s important that contemporary African photography receives the attention it deserves and that we can offer the artists and their artwork a long-lasting platform.

So please like, share and link our appeal. Talk to your coworkers, parents, grandparents, cousins, siblings, aunties and uncles about supporting this unique and beautiful book. RECAP POPCAP is unique international! 

Follow us and support us on:Facebook ,Twitter ,Instagram ,Pinterest ,Youtube and Vimeo !

--------------------------------------------

Good reasons to get involved

Get involved! Help us make the RECAP POPCAP a reality and attract more attention to contemporary African photography!

  • Because photography is a means of expression that is understood worldwide
  • Because we need to challenge the stereotypical image of Africa
  • Because photography is the ideal medium for building bridges

POPCAP became the recognised photographic prize it is today through personal involvement. It is this lifeblood and this conviction that makes the realisation of RECAP POPCAP possible.

We hope we can inspire you to get involved.

Thank you so much for your involvement!!

With warmest greetings,
Livia, Ben, Angela & Paul



POPCAP

POPCAP ist der internationale Preis für zeitgenössische afrikanische Fotografie und wird jährlich an Fotografinnen und Fotografen verliehen, deren Arbeit auf dem afrikanischen Kontinent entstand oder sich mit der Diaspora Afrikas beschäftigt.

RECAP POPCAP - Das Buch zum Jubiläum

Zum fünfjährigen Jubiläum werden wir im Buch RECAP POPCAP die 25 seit 2012 ausgezeichneten Fotostrecken publizieren und so das vielfältige Schaffen nicht nur für die Künstler und uns, sondern auch für euch und die Nachwelt zugänglich machen. Außerdem werden Persönlichkeiten der afrikanischen Fotografie zur aktuellen Situation in ihrem Umfeld berichten. Der gesamte Inhalt wird in fünf Sprachen übersetzt.

Das Buch RECAP POPCAP wird einzeln handgebunden und mit Ausstellungsbannern der vergangenen Jahre eingefasst. Jedes Buch wird so zum Unikat und trägt die Seele der Bilder und der Ausstellungsorte in sich.

DEINE UNTERSTÜTZUNG

Um diese handgebundenen Einzelstücke zu fertigen, benötigen wir jetzt Dein Engagement! Unsere Crowdfunding-Kampagne läuft bis zum 31. Mai. Mit Deiner Unterstützung werden wir dieses Ziel zu erreichen. Wir brauchen dafür finanzielle Hilfe, aber auch Dein Engagement als Botschafter für RECAP POPCAP.

Lass uns gemeinsam daran arbeiten, ein zeitgemäßeres Bild Afrikas zu vermitteln. 

TOWARD A MORE CONTEMPORARY VIEW OF AFRICA!
----------------------------------------------------

Willst Du mehr wissen?

Was wir machen

2012 hat Benjamin Füglister den POPCAP-Preis ins Leben gerufen, um zeitgenössischer afrikanischer Fotografie eine Plattform zu bieten. Seitdem kürt jährlich eine internationale Jury fünf Gewinnerinnen und Gewinner mit dem POPCAP-Preis. Was mit 160 Einsendungen begann, ist in nur fünf Jahren zu einem Projekt mit 900 Bewerbungen aus 94 Ländern und mit rund zehn Ausstellungen weltweit herangewachsen.

Jedes Jahr wird von einem kleinen Team eine Reihe von Ausstellungen rund um den Globus organisiert, die im öffentlichen Raum stattfinden. So kommt eine möglichst große Öffentlichkeit mit den prämierten Fotografien und den Geschichten in Berührung und jede und jeder kann sich sein eigenes Bild über die vielseitigen Gesichter Afrikas machen.

Weitere Informationen zu POPCAP findest du auf unserer Webseite www.popcap.cc.

Warum ein Buch

Zum fünfjährigen Jubiläum werden wir mit RECAP POPCAP ein Buch veröffentlichen, das einen Querschnitt durch die jüngsten Entwicklungen des pulsierenden internationalen Schaffens in der afrikanischen Fotografie zeigt. Zusammen mit Dir werden wir im Buch das Geschehen seit 2012 rekapitulieren und für die Nachwelt zugänglich machen. Das Buch wird fünfsprachig (Englisch, Französisch, Portugiesisch, Arabisch und Deutsch) verfasst und beinhaltet Arbeiten folgender Künstlerinnen und Künstler:

Julia Runge, Nicolas Henry, Jason Larkin, Sabelo Mlangeni, Thom Pierce, Filipe Branquinho, Zed Nelson, Tahir Carl Karmali, Zied Ben Romdhane, Romaric Tisserand, Joana Choumali, Anoek Steketee, Eefje Blankevoort, Patrick Willocq, Léonard Pongo, Ilan Godfrey, Graeme Williams, Cristina de Middel, Alexia Webster, David Rengel, Álvaro Laiz, Dillon Marsh, Namsa Leuba, Adolphus Opara, Guillaume Bonn, Nabil Boutros, Paolo Patrizi

Wieviel wir brauchen und wozu

Um das Buch im geplanten Umfang zu veröffentlichen, benötigen wir 46'000 Dollar. Mit dieser Summe werden folgende Kosten gedeckt:

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Was Du als Dankeschön für Deine Unterstützung bekommst

Wir haben uns einzigartige und nachhaltige Perks als Dankeschön für Deine Unterstützung ausgedacht:

\\\\\ Als Unterstützer von RECAP POPCAP bekommst Du für 9 Dollar ein digitales Duckface eines POPCAP Künstlers zugesandt. Wir konnten einige der prämierten POPCAP-Fotografinnen und Fotografen dafür gewinnen, eine Reihe Duckfaces von sich zu produzieren, die wir euch speziell und nur während dieser Crowdfunding-Aktion anbieten dürfen. 

\\\\\  Ein original signiertes Duckface-Polaroid erhältst Du von einem der prämierten Fotografinnen und Fotografen als individuelles Dankeschön für Deine Unterstützung über 70 Dollar.

\\\\\  Du hast die Möglichkeit eine Tasche oder einen Liegestuhl, die aus original POPCAP-Ausstellungsbannern fabriziert werden, zu bekommen.

Die Gewinnerarbeiten des POPCAP-Wettbewerbs werden jedes Jahr auf großformatigen Bannern und im öffentlichen Raum einem breiten Publikum beispielsweise in Nigeria, auf den Kapverden oder in der Schweiz gezeigt. Diese Banner werden nach ihrer Weltreise zu Taschen und Liegestühlen verarbeitet. 



\\\\\ Das Prinzip des Down-Cycling behalten wir auch für das RECAP POPCAP-Buch bei. Jedes Buch wird handgebunden und mit Ausstellungsbannern der letzten fünf Jahre eingefasst. Tauche ein in das Geschehen der jüngsten zeitgenössischen afrikanischen Fotografieszene. Das Buch rekapituliert die Arbeit der letzten fünf Jahre und beinhaltet Texte namhafter Autoren. Auf diesem Weg wird das künstlerische Schaffen auf und mit dem afrikanischen Kontinent gewürdigt.

Ob Du mit einer unserer Taschen durch die Welt spazierst oder lieber im bequemen Liegestuhl entspannst und dabei vielleicht im RECAP POPCAP-Buch liest – jedes Teil ist schick, nützlich, robust und vor allem: ein Unikat! 

Jeder Perk ist ein Einzelstück und trägt die Seele der Ausstellungen mit sich. Mit dem Erwerb eines solchen Unikats wirst Du Teil unseres Projekts und hilfst dabei RECAP POPCAP zu verwirklichen! 

\\\\\ Für jedes Jahr POPCAP gibt es einen Ausstellungskatalog, der die Gewinnerarbeiten aus dem jeweiligen Jahr präsentiert und die Künstler vorstellt. Für 48 Dollar bekommst Du die Ausstellungskataloge aus den Jahren 2013 – 2016.


\\\\\ POPCAP '16 Preis-Gewinnerin Julia Runge offeriert drei Exemplare ihres Fotobuchs "Basterland" über das Baster-Volk in Namibia. Für 49 Dollar erhältst Du Deine eigene Ausgabe mit persönlicher Widmung der Künstlerin. Mehr Informationen zu Julias Arbeit unter  www.juliarunge.com.


\\\\\ Aus den POPCAP-Gewinnerarbeiten wird jedes Jahr eine Reihe limitierter und signierter Prints für die EDITION POPCAP zusammengestellt. Für 490 Dollar senden wir Dir den gewünschten und signierten Editionsprint und wünschen Dir viel Freude damit.
Nachdem Deine Spende eingegangen ist, kannst Du Dir unter diesem Link einen Editionsprint aussuchen. 


\\\\\ Möchtest Du einen der prämierten POPCAP-Gewinner persönlich treffen und vor seiner Kamera stehen? Hier hast Du die Chance in einem exklusiven Fotoshoot ein Porträt von Dir von einem international ausgezeichneten Fotografen anfertigen zu lassen. Gönne Dir dieses unvergessliche Erlebnis und schenke Dir oder einem Menschen, der Dir nahe steht, ein besonderes Bild von Dir.  

Porträtshootings sind zur Zeit in folgenden Städten möglich: Kapstadt, Brüssel, Abidjan, Maputo, Johannesburg und Lagos 


\\\\\ Bei einem dreitägigen Aufenthalt in Basel kannst Du einen Blick hinter die Kulissen von  POPCAP und der Ausstellung Image Afrique werfen. Wir freuen uns außerdem, Dich bei der Veröffentlichung von RECAP POPCAP dabei zu haben und Dir die Möglichkeit zu bieten die ausgezeichneten Fotografinnen und Fotografen persönlich kennenzulernen. Du wohnst zentral in der Innenstadt, sodass alle Sehenswürdigkeiten, Museen, spannenden Bars und Restaurants sowie Einkaufmöglichkeiten und natürlich das wunderschöne Rheinufer fußläufig erreichbar sind.


\\\\\ Wenn Du besonders neugierig bist, winkt Dir eine einwöchige Reise ans LagosPhoto Festival in Nigeria. Während einer Woche hast Du die Möglichkeit junge Künstler, neue Fotografie und die Stadt Lagos zu entdecken. Im Preis enthalten sind sieben Nächte im Doppelzimmer in einem Luxushotel in Lagos. Das Abenteuer bei einem der wichtigsten Fotofestivals auf dem afrikanischen Kontinent dabei zu sein, ist ganz klar ein einmaliges Erlebnis!


\\\\\ Für 9'000 Dollar bist Du exklusiver RECAP POPCAP PATRON! Die erste Seite im Buch wird Dir gewidmet und Du bekommst selbstverständlich ein signiertes RECAP POPCAP-Exemplar sowie einen Editionsprint. Dazu gehört auch eine Einladung zur Buch-Vernissage in Basel ein, wo Du die Möglichkeit haben wirst, die diesjährigen POPCAP-Gewinner zu treffen. 

----------------------------------------------------

Deine Unterstützung kommt an  

Im Herbst 2016 werden wir RECAP POPCAP der Öffentlichkeit vorstellen. Um die Produktion in Auftrag geben zu können, benötigen wir jetzt Dein Engagement. Unsere Crowdfunding-Kampagne läuft bis zum 31. Mai! 

Auf diesem Weg können wir...

  • die Produktion von RECAP POPCAP bereits vor Abschluss der Crowdfunding-Aktion beginnen.
  • je nach Unterstützung, das Buch umfangreicher und exklusiver ausgestalten.
  • die Löhne der am Projekt Beteiligten (Schneiderin, Buchbinder, Designer, etc.) sukzessive ausbezahlen. Alle sind hier mit Herzblut bei der Sache und das Engagement soll auch entsprechend honoriert werden.
  • Bei mehr als 100 % Finanzierung werden die überschüssigen Mittel im Rahmen von POPCAP zur Förderung afrikanischer Fotografie eingesetzt.

----------------------------------------------------

Teile Deine Begeisterung

Zum einen benötigen wir finanzielle Unterstützung und zum anderen wollen wir die Fotografinnen und Fotografen mit möglichst vielen interessierten Menschen vernetzen. So können wir gemeinsam weiter langfristige Ziele verfolgen. Es geht darum, dass zeitgenössische afrikanische Fotografie die Aufmerksamkeit erfährt, die sie verdient und wir weiterhin den Künstlerinnen und Künstlern eine nachhaltige Plattform bieten können. 
Wir bitten Dich also: Gib uns Dein Like, teile und verlinke unseren Aufruf in Deinem Freundeskreis. Sprich mit Deinen Arbeitskolleginnen und -kollegen, mit Deinen Eltern, Großeltern, Cousins, Geschwistern, Tanten und Onkeln aus Nah und Fern über RECAP POPCAP. RECAP POPCAP ist einzigartig und international!
Folge und unterstütze uns auf: 
Facebook , Twitter , Instagram , Pinterest , Youtube und Vimeo!

----------------------------------------------------

Gute Gründe zum Mitmachen

Sei dabei, das Buch RECAP POPCAP Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen und so zeitgenössischer afrikanischer Fotografie zu mehr Aufmerksamkeit zu verhelfen!

  • Weil Fotografie als Ausdrucksmittel international verstanden wird
  • Weil das stereotype Bild Afrikas aufgebrochen werden muss
  • Weil Fotografie das ideale Medium ist, um Brücken zu bauen 

POPCAP ist durch persönliches Engagement zum international anerkannten Preis geworden, der er heute ist. Es sind das Herzblut und diese Überzeugung, die auch die Verwirklichung von RECAP POPCAP vorantreiben.

Wir hoffen, dass wir Dich begeistern können mitzumachen.  

1000 Dank für Dein Engagement!!

Herzlichst
Livia, Ben, Angela & Paul
story_txt:
POPCAP
POPCAP is the international prize for contemporary African photography that is awarded annually to photographers whose work is either created on the African continent or deals with a diaspora of an African country.
RECAP POPCAP - The Anniversary Book
To celebrate POPCAP’s fifth anniversary we will be collating the 25 winning photographic series of the last five years in the book RECAP POPCAP, and personalities from the African photography scene will discuss the present situation in their field. The content of the book will be translated into five languages.
Each copy of RECAP POPCAP will be handcrafted, the exhibition banners of years past incorporated into the covers of the books. This way each book will become a unique specimen that will carry with it the soul of the images and exhibition sites of the past five years.
YOUR SUPPORT
We need your help now in order to be able to complete these unique, hand-bound pieces! Our crowdfunding campaign will go until 31st May. With your help we can reach this goal. We require not just your financial support, but also your engagement as an ambassador for RECAP POPCAP.
Let’s work together to promote a contemporary image of Africa.
TOWARD A MORE CONTEMPORARY VIEW OF AFRICA!
--------------------------------------------
Would you like to know more?
What we do
In 2012 Benjamin Füglister brought the POPCAP prize to life in order to offer a platform for contemporary African photography. Since then POPCAP winners have been selected annually by an international panel of judges. What began with 160 submissions has grown in a mere five years into a project with 900 applications from 94 different countries and around ten exhibitions annually.
Every year the POPCAP team organises a series of exhibitions that take place in public spaces all over the world. This means that the presented photographs and stories reach a lot more people, and visitors are able to build their own image of the many and varied faces of Africa.
Further information about POPCAP can be found on our website www.popcap.cc.
Why another book?
For POPCAP’s fifth anniversary we will be publishing a book that shows a cross-section of the most recent developments in the pulsing, international world of African photography. Together with you we wish to recap the events of the last five years and make them available to future generations. The book will be translated into five languages (English, French, Portuguese, Arabic and German) and will contain works from the following artists:
Julia Runge, Nicolas Henry, Jason Larkin, Sabelo Mlangeni, Thom Pierce, Filipe Branquinho, Zed Nelson, Tahir Carl Karmali, Zied Ben Romdhane, Romaric Tisserand, Joana Choumali, Anoek Steketee, Eefje Blankevoort, Patrick Willocq, Léonard Pongo, Ilan Godfrey, Graeme Williams, Cristina de Middel, Alexia Webster, David Rengel, Álvaro Laiz, Dillon Marsh, Namsa Leuba, Adolphus Opara, Guillaume Bonn, Nabil Boutros, Paolo Patrizi
How much do we need and what will we use it for?
In order to publish the book as planned we require a total of $46,000. We will use this money to cover the following costs:



--------------------------------------------
What you will receive as thanks for your support
We have thought up some unique and lasting perks to say thank you for your support:
\\\\\ As a RECAP POPCAP supporter donating $9 you will receive a digital duck face of a POPCAP artist. We were able to acquire some of the award-winning POPCAP photographers in order to create a duck face series which we are only on offer during this crowdfunding campaign.
\\\\\ As thanks for a donation over $70 you will receive an original signed duckface polaroid from one of the award-winning artists.
\\\\\ You also have the opportunity the get a bag or deckchair produced using original POPCAP exhibition banners.
The winning works of the POPCAP competition are exhibited every year on large-format banners in public spaces in places such as Nigeria, Cape Verde Islands, and Switzerland. After their round-the-world trip these banners are then processed into bags and deckchairs.




\\\\\ We are maintaining the principle of down-cycling for the RECAP POPCAP book. Every copy of the book will be hand-bound and will incorporate the works of the last five years into the cover. Immerse yourself in the recent happenings within the world of contemporary African photography. We want to review the works of the last few years and complement these works with texts from notable authors. In this way we will recap and acknowledge the recent artistic achievements that have occurred on and with the African continent.

Whether you walk through the world with one of our bags or prefer to relax on one of our comfortable deckchairs - perhaps while reading the RECAP POPCAP book - every piece is chic, useful, durable and above all unique!
Each of these perks is a unique item and carries with it the soul of exhibitions past. By purchasing one of these unique items you will become a part of our project and help to make RECAP POPCAP a reality!
\\\\\ There is an exhibition catalogue for every year of POPCAP that presents the winning works of that year and introduces the artists. For $48 you will receive the exhibition catalogues from the years 2013 to 2016.


\\\\\ POPCAP '16 prize winner Julia Runge offers 3 copies of her photobook "Basterland" about the Baster people in Namibia. Get your own special copy signed by the artist with a personal dedication. More information about Julia's work www.juliarunge.com.



\\\\\ Every year a series of limited-edition, signed prints are compiled from the POPCAP winning works for EDITION POPCAP. For $490 we will send you the signed print of your choice.  
You can choose your print from our selection here.


\\\\\ Would you like to meet one of the POPCAP winners in person and get in front of their camera? Here you have the chance to partake in an exclusive photoshoot and have your portrait taken by an outstanding photographer. Treat yourself to this unforgettable experience and gift yourself or someone close to you a special picture of you.
Portrait shoots are possible in the following cities: Cape Town, Brussels, Abidjan, Maputo, Johannesburg and Lagos.


\\\\\ During a three-day stay in Basel you can take a look behind the scenes of POPCAP and the Image Afrique exhibition. We would love to have you there with us at the release of RECAP POPCAP and to be able to give you the opportunity to meet the outstanding photographers in person. You would be living centrally located so that you would be within walking distance of all of the sights, museums, exciting bars and restaurants, as well as shopping districts and of course the beautiful banks of the Rhine river.


\\\\\ If you are feeling particularly curious, then perhaps a one-week trip to the LagosPhoto Festival in Nigeria is for you. During one week you will have the opportunity to discover young artists, new photography and the city of Lagos. This prize includes seven nights in a double bedroom in a luxury hotel in Lagos. What a unique experience to attend one of the most important photographic festivals on the African continent!


\\\\\ For $9.000 you will become an exclusive RECAP POPCAP PATRON! The first page of the book will be dedicated to you and you will also receive a signed copy of RECAP POPCAP as well as a signed POPCAP EDITION print. You will also receive an invitation to the book preview in Basel where you will have the opportunity to meet this year’s POPCAP winners.


--------------------------------------------
Your support arrives
In autumn 2016 we will introduce RECAP POPCAP to the public. In order to commence production of the book, we need your involvement now. Our crowdfunding campaign goes until 31st May!
In this way we can...



begin production of RECAP POPCAP just before the crowdfunding campaign ends.


develop the book more extensively and exclusively depending on the support we receive.


gradually pay the wages of all those involved in the project (tailors, bookbinders, designers etc). All those involved are passionate about their work and their involvement should be acknowledged accordingly.


Should we exceed our target amount, the surplus funds will be put back into POPCAP to go toward the promotion of African photography.



--------------------------------------------
Share your enthusiasm
On the one hand we require financial support, but beyond that we wish to network the photographers and ourselves with as many interesting people as possible, so that we can further pursue longterm goals. It’s important that contemporary African photography receives the attention it deserves and that we can offer the artists and their artwork a long-lasting platform.
So please like, share and link our appeal. Talk to your coworkers, parents, grandparents, cousins, siblings, aunties and uncles about supporting this unique and beautiful book. RECAP POPCAP is unique international! 
Follow us and support us on:Facebook ,Twitter ,Instagram ,Pinterest ,Youtube and Vimeo !

--------------------------------------------
Good reasons to get involved
Get involved! Help us make the RECAP POPCAP a reality and attract more attention to contemporary African photography!



Because photography is a means of expression that is understood worldwide


Because we need to challenge the stereotypical image of Africa


Because photography is the ideal medium for building bridges


POPCAP became the recognised photographic prize it is today through personal involvement. It is this lifeblood and this conviction that makes the realisation of RECAP POPCAP possible.
We hope we can inspire you to get involved.
Thank you so much for your involvement!!
With warmest greetings,Livia, Ben, Angela & Paul


POPCAP
POPCAP ist der internationale Preis für zeitgenössische afrikanische Fotografie und wird jährlich an Fotografinnen und Fotografen verliehen, deren Arbeit auf dem afrikanischen Kontinent entstand oder sich mit der Diaspora Afrikas beschäftigt.
RECAP POPCAP - Das Buch zum Jubiläum
Zum fünfjährigen Jubiläum werden wir im Buch RECAP POPCAP
die 25 seit 2012 ausgezeichneten Fotostrecken publizieren und so das vielfältige Schaffen nicht nur
für die Künstler und uns, sondern auch für euch und die Nachwelt zugänglich
machen. Außerdem werden Persönlichkeiten der afrikanischen Fotografie zur aktuellen Situation in ihrem Umfeld berichten. Der gesamte Inhalt wird in fünf Sprachen übersetzt.
Das Buch RECAP POPCAP wird einzeln
handgebunden und mit Ausstellungsbannern der vergangenen Jahre eingefasst. Jedes
Buch wird so zum Unikat und trägt die Seele der Bilder und der Ausstellungsorte
in sich.

DEINE
UNTERSTÜTZUNG

Um diese
handgebundenen Einzelstücke zu fertigen, benötigen wir jetzt Dein Engagement! Unsere Crowdfunding-Kampagne läuft bis zum
31. Mai. Mit Deiner Unterstützung werden wir dieses Ziel zu erreichen. Wir brauchen dafür
finanzielle Hilfe,
aber auch Dein Engagement als Botschafter
für RECAP POPCAP.
Lass uns
gemeinsam daran arbeiten, ein zeitgemäßeres Bild Afrikas zu vermitteln. 

TOWARD
A MORE CONTEMPORARY VIEW OF AFRICA!----------------------------------------------------




Willst Du mehr wissen?

Was wir machen

2012 hat Benjamin Füglister den POPCAP-Preis ins Leben gerufen, um zeitgenössischer afrikanischer Fotografie eine Plattform zu bieten. Seitdem kürt jährlich eine
internationale Jury fünf Gewinnerinnen und Gewinner mit dem POPCAP-Preis. Was mit 160 Einsendungen begann, ist in nur fünf Jahren zu einem Projekt mit
900 Bewerbungen aus 94 Ländern und mit rund zehn Ausstellungen weltweit herangewachsen.
Jedes Jahr wird von einem kleinen Team eine Reihe von Ausstellungen rund um den Globus organisiert,
die im öffentlichen Raum stattfinden. So kommt eine möglichst große
Öffentlichkeit mit den prämierten Fotografien und den Geschichten in Berührung und jede und
jeder kann sich sein eigenes Bild über die vielseitigen Gesichter Afrikas machen.
Weitere Informationen zu POPCAP findest du auf unserer Webseite www.popcap.cc.
Warum ein Buch
Zum
fünfjährigen Jubiläum werden wir mit RECAP POPCAP ein Buch veröffentlichen, das
einen Querschnitt durch die jüngsten Entwicklungen des pulsierenden
internationalen Schaffens in der afrikanischen Fotografie zeigt. Zusammen mit Dir werden wir im Buch das Geschehen seit 2012 rekapitulieren und für
die Nachwelt zugänglich machen. Das Buch wird fünfsprachig (Englisch, Französisch, Portugiesisch, Arabisch und Deutsch) verfasst und beinhaltet Arbeiten folgender Künstlerinnen und Künstler:

Julia Runge, Nicolas Henry, Jason Larkin, Sabelo Mlangeni, Thom Pierce, Filipe Branquinho, Zed Nelson, Tahir Carl Karmali, Zied Ben Romdhane, Romaric Tisserand, Joana Choumali, Anoek Steketee, Eefje Blankevoort, Patrick Willocq, Léonard Pongo, Ilan Godfrey, Graeme Williams, Cristina de Middel, Alexia Webster, David Rengel, Álvaro Laiz, Dillon Marsh, Namsa Leuba, Adolphus Opara, Guillaume Bonn, Nabil Boutros, Paolo Patrizi
Wieviel
wir brauchen und wozu

Um das Buch im geplanten Umfang zu veröffentlichen, benötigen wir 46'000 Dollar. Mit dieser Summe werden folgende Kosten gedeckt:








------------------------------------------------------------------------

Was Du als Dankeschön für Deine Unterstützung bekommst

Wir haben uns einzigartige und nachhaltige Perks als Dankeschön für Deine Unterstützung ausgedacht:


\\\\\ Als Unterstützer von RECAP POPCAP bekommst Du für 9 Dollar ein digitales Duckface eines POPCAP Künstlers zugesandt. Wir konnten einige der prämierten POPCAP-Fotografinnen und Fotografen dafür gewinnen, eine Reihe Duckfaces von sich zu produzieren, die wir euch speziell und nur während dieser Crowdfunding-Aktion anbieten dürfen. 
\\\\\  Ein original signiertes Duckface-Polaroid erhältst Du von einem der prämierten Fotografinnen und Fotografen als individuelles Dankeschön für Deine Unterstützung über 70 Dollar.
\\\\\  Du hast die Möglichkeit eine Tasche oder einen Liegestuhl, die aus original POPCAP-Ausstellungsbannern fabriziert werden, zu bekommen.
Die Gewinnerarbeiten des POPCAP-Wettbewerbs werden jedes Jahr auf großformatigen Bannern und im öffentlichen Raum einem breiten Publikum
beispielsweise in Nigeria, auf den Kapverden oder in der Schweiz gezeigt. Diese Banner werden nach ihrer Weltreise zu Taschen und Liegestühlen verarbeitet. 







\\\\\ Das Prinzip des Down-Cycling behalten wir auch für das RECAP POPCAP-Buch bei. Jedes Buch wird handgebunden und mit Ausstellungsbannern der letzten fünf Jahre eingefasst. Tauche ein in das Geschehen der jüngsten zeitgenössischen afrikanischen Fotografieszene. Das Buch rekapituliert die Arbeit der letzten fünf Jahre und beinhaltet Texte namhafter Autoren. Auf diesem Weg wird das künstlerische Schaffen auf und mit dem afrikanischen Kontinent gewürdigt.






Ob Du mit einer unserer Taschen durch die Welt spazierst oder lieber im bequemen Liegestuhl entspannst und dabei vielleicht im RECAP POPCAP-Buch liest – jedes Teil ist schick, nützlich, robust und vor allem: ein Unikat! 


Jeder Perk ist ein Einzelstück und trägt die Seele der Ausstellungen mit sich. Mit dem Erwerb eines solchen Unikats wirst Du Teil unseres Projekts und hilfst dabei RECAP POPCAP zu verwirklichen! 
\\\\\ Für jedes Jahr POPCAP gibt es einen Ausstellungskatalog, der die Gewinnerarbeiten aus dem jeweiligen Jahr präsentiert und die Künstler vorstellt. Für 48 Dollar bekommst Du die Ausstellungskataloge aus den Jahren 2013 – 2016.





\\\\\ POPCAP '16 Preis-Gewinnerin Julia Runge offeriert drei Exemplare ihres Fotobuchs "Basterland" über das Baster-Volk in Namibia. Für 49 Dollar erhältst Du Deine eigene Ausgabe mit persönlicher Widmung der Künstlerin. Mehr Informationen zu Julias Arbeit unter  www.juliarunge.com.




\\\\\ Aus den POPCAP-Gewinnerarbeiten wird jedes Jahr eine Reihe limitierter und signierter Prints für die EDITION POPCAP zusammengestellt. Für 490 Dollar senden wir Dir den gewünschten und signierten Editionsprint und wünschen Dir viel Freude damit.

Nachdem Deine Spende eingegangen ist, kannst Du Dir unter diesem Link einen Editionsprint aussuchen. 



\\\\\ Möchtest Du einen der prämierten POPCAP-Gewinner persönlich treffen und vor seiner Kamera stehen? Hier hast Du die Chance in einem exklusiven Fotoshoot ein Porträt von Dir von einem international ausgezeichneten Fotografen anfertigen zu lassen. Gönne Dir dieses unvergessliche Erlebnis und schenke Dir oder einem Menschen, der Dir nahe steht, ein besonderes Bild von Dir.  
Porträtshootings sind zur Zeit in folgenden Städten möglich: Kapstadt, Brüssel, Abidjan, Maputo, Johannesburg und Lagos 



\\\\\ Bei einem dreitägigen Aufenthalt in Basel kannst Du einen Blick hinter die Kulissen von  POPCAP und der Ausstellung Image Afrique werfen. Wir freuen uns außerdem, Dich bei der Veröffentlichung von RECAP POPCAP dabei zu haben und Dir die Möglichkeit zu bieten die ausgezeichneten Fotografinnen und Fotografen persönlich kennenzulernen. Du wohnst zentral in der Innenstadt, sodass alle Sehenswürdigkeiten, Museen, spannenden Bars und Restaurants sowie Einkaufmöglichkeiten und natürlich das wunderschöne Rheinufer fußläufig erreichbar sind.






\\\\\ Wenn Du besonders neugierig bist, winkt Dir eine einwöchige Reise ans LagosPhoto Festival in Nigeria. Während einer Woche hast Du die Möglichkeit junge Künstler, neue Fotografie und die Stadt Lagos zu entdecken. Im Preis enthalten sind sieben Nächte im Doppelzimmer in einem Luxushotel in Lagos. Das Abenteuer bei einem der wichtigsten Fotofestivals auf dem afrikanischen Kontinent dabei zu sein, ist ganz klar ein einmaliges Erlebnis!




\\\\\ Für 9'000 Dollar bist Du exklusiver RECAP POPCAP PATRON! Die erste Seite im Buch wird Dir gewidmet und Du bekommst selbstverständlich ein signiertes RECAP POPCAP-Exemplar sowie einen Editionsprint. Dazu gehört auch eine Einladung zur Buch-Vernissage in Basel ein, wo Du die Möglichkeit haben wirst, die diesjährigen POPCAP-Gewinner zu treffen. 

----------------------------------------------------
Deine Unterstützung kommt an  

Im Herbst 2016 werden wir RECAP POPCAP der Öffentlichkeit vorstellen. Um die Produktion in Auftrag geben zu können, benötigen wir jetzt Dein Engagement. Unsere Crowdfunding-Kampagne läuft bis zum 31. Mai! 
Auf diesem Weg können wir...



die Produktion von RECAP POPCAP bereits vor Abschluss der Crowdfunding-Aktion beginnen.


je nach Unterstützung, das Buch umfangreicher und exklusiver ausgestalten.


die Löhne der am Projekt Beteiligten (Schneiderin, Buchbinder, Designer, etc.) sukzessive ausbezahlen. Alle sind hier mit Herzblut bei der Sache und das Engagement soll auch entsprechend honoriert werden.


Bei mehr als 100 % Finanzierung werden die überschüssigen Mittel im Rahmen von POPCAP zur Förderung afrikanischer Fotografie eingesetzt.









----------------------------------------------------

Teile Deine Begeisterung



Zum einen benötigen wir finanzielle Unterstützung und zum anderen wollen wir die Fotografinnen und Fotografen mit möglichst vielen interessierten Menschen vernetzen. So können wir gemeinsam weiter langfristige Ziele verfolgen. Es geht darum, dass zeitgenössische afrikanische Fotografie die Aufmerksamkeit erfährt, die sie verdient und wir weiterhin den Künstlerinnen und Künstlern eine nachhaltige Plattform bieten können. 
Wir bitten Dich also: Gib uns Dein Like, teile und verlinke unseren Aufruf in Deinem Freundeskreis. Sprich mit Deinen Arbeitskolleginnen und -kollegen, mit Deinen Eltern, Großeltern, Cousins, Geschwistern, Tanten und Onkeln aus Nah und Fern über RECAP POPCAP. RECAP POPCAP ist einzigartig und international!

Folge und unterstütze uns auf: Facebook , Twitter , Instagram , Pinterest , Youtube und Vimeo!


----------------------------------------------------


Gute Gründe zum Mitmachen



Sei dabei, das Buch RECAP POPCAP Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen und so zeitgenössischer afrikanischer Fotografie zu mehr Aufmerksamkeit zu verhelfen!







Weil Fotografie als Ausdrucksmittel international verstanden wird


Weil das stereotype Bild Afrikas aufgebrochen werden muss


Weil Fotografie das ideale Medium ist, um Brücken zu bauen 


POPCAP ist durch persönliches Engagement zum international anerkannten Preis geworden, der er heute ist. Es sind das Herzblut und diese Überzeugung, die auch die Verwirklichung von RECAP POPCAP vorantreiben.

1000 Dank für Dein Engagement!!



Herzlichst
Livia, Ben, Angela & Paul

story:
Disappear Here

Is an arts project that aims to produce up to 27 poetry films from 9 writers and 9 film-makers based around Coventry ringroad and the city centre itself.

The project will have an open submission process for 9 writers and 9 film-makers, local and national, to pitch portfolios / ideas / concepts /storyboards - selected by a panel of fellow artists - it's a great opportunity for emerging artists and seasoned pros - and the scope for collaboration and experimentation within that is really important. 

We are looking to involve national and local artists to tell different stories about Coventry, from the Modernist and Brutalist architecture of the city centre; to the historic cathedral and its ruins.


I think the two mediums - combined - can make people think differently about Coventry and will be accessible but also challenge audiences (as the best art must).

What We Need:

-To raise £1000 match-funding which will enable us to access larger funding of £10,000 from Arts Council England (ACE). This will help us to make the project happen.
-Support of local people and Coventrians living elsewhere; poets, film-makers and other artists who might want to get involved.
-Volunteers, extras and patrons for the city of Coventry who wish to help us tell its story.

Why Coventry?

Coventry is a city with a unique history and vivid, challenging examples of mediveval, modernist and 21st century architecture which shape the way the city is experienced. Disappear Here is an attempt to record, amplify and reflect these experiences from people who are born and bred in the city and visitors who come from all over the world. Now is also a good time to be looking forward and back with the city's momentous #Coventry2021 bid to become the UK City of Culture!

What You're Funding:

-To help Disappear Here access wider national and local arts funding.

-To make sure that the artists are paid to produce the best work possible.

-Running costs, such as website design, marketing, printing of poetry-film maps, film editing, meeting space costs and project management.  

-Encouraging the arts and creative skills sector in the city; from current artists to the next generation of talent.

-The creation of a unique and innovative arts project that all about Coventry ringroad.

Impact

-Disappear Here will make people see the city of Coventry in a different light; whether they are new or have lived here for years.
-The project will inspire others to write/read/experience poetry in its many forms; live and on the page, as well as sparking interest in the new and developing genre of poetry films.
-Audiences will be able to attend a premiere screening of the poetry films in Coventry; we would also like to tour them across the UK once the project has been completed. There will also be perks - little ways of saying thank you to everyone who chips-in a little bit of money here and there!

Who?


Disappear Here is a project created  by Adam Steiner, an artist who co-founded the Coventry-based not-for-profit publisher, Silhouette Press and Here Comes Everyone magazine, as well as holding various literary events across Coventry, including the Fire & Dust poetry open-mics at The Big Comfy Bookshop (Fargo).
Adam was also involved in delivering a Big Lottery - Awards For All project - to improve access to creative writing and publishing skills with hard-to-reach citizens in Coventry.
Adam will manage Disappear Here and be responsible for working alongside the artists and citizens involved to make the project happen.

Disappear Here is an attempt to record, amplify and reflect these experiences from people who are born and bred in the city and visitors who come from all over the world. Now is also a good time to be looking forward and back with the city's momentous #Coventry2021 bid to become the UK City of Culture!
What You're Funding:
-To help Disappear Here access wider national and local arts funding.
-To make sure that the artists are paid to produce the best work possible.
-Running costs, such as website design, marketing, printing of poetry-film maps, film editing, meeting space costs and project management.  
-Encouraging the arts and creative skills sector in the city; from current artists to the next generation of talent.
-The creation of a unique and innovative arts project that all about Coventry ringroad.
Impact

-Disappear Here will make people see the city of Coventry in a different light; whether they are new or have lived here for years.
-The project will inspire others to write/read/experience poetry in its many forms; live and on the page, as well as sparking interest in the new and developing genre of poetry films.
-Audiences will be able to attend a premiere screening of the poetry films in Coventry; we would also like to tour them across the UK once the project has been completed. There will also be perks - little ways of saying thank you to everyone who chips-in a little bit of money here and there!

Who?

Disappear Here is a project created  by Adam Steiner, an artist who co-founded the Coventry-based not-for-profit publisher, Silhouette Press and Here Comes Everyone magazine, as well as holding various literary events across Coventry, including the Fire & Dust poetry open-mics at The Big Comfy Bookshop (Fargo).
Adam was also involved in delivering a Big Lottery - Awards For All project - to improve access to creative writing and publishing skills with hard-to-reach citizens in Coventry.
Adam will manage Disappear Here and be responsible for working alongside the artists and citizens involved to make the project happen.

story:
As a Savannah College of Art and Design Masters of Arts Administration degree candidate, I chose to create an event (as my final project) to showcase the exemplary artistic talent that exists in East Tennessee. This segment of the population is often forgotten or lost to the rest of the world. That, however, hasn’t hindered the folks in rural Appalachia from finding their voice through the creation of art. Many have chosen to express their hardships and rich culture through painting, sculpture, photography, and jewelry construction. Often though, they haven’t been provided an outlet to display, discuss, or sell their works.  That is why this exhibition is so significant. This event will give these artists a chance to shine in their own community as many of them, for the first time, will see their works displayed throughout the venue.

Schedule and Location: The event is being held at 506 Buchannan Street in Erwin, Tennessee on February 25th and 26th. Doors will open at 7pm on February 25th and again on February 26th at 11:00am. Please visit the event’s Facebook page for more information. It can be found at https://www.facebook.com/appalachianartsevent.

Need:  The estimated cost of holding this event is $1,665. This includes the cost of the venue and installation materials. I am asking for your support in the amount of $800.00 to ensure the initial costs of the exhibition are met. My hope is that additional funds will be raised through sponsorships and art sales (via 80/20 commission agreement) to offset further expenditures.

 I have included a list of anticipated event expenditures below.

Additional Chair Rental For Venue

$150.00

Additional Table Rental For Venue

$150.00

Food

$250.00

Drinks

$150.00

Decorations

$100.00

$125.00

$75.00

Signage

$50.00

Postage

$50.00

Art Installation Materials  

$50.00

Newspaper Advertisement

$25.00

Facebook Advertisements

$50.00

Name Tags

$15.00

Lighting

$100.00

Cleaning Supplies for Venue Clean-Up

$25.00

Total:

$1,665

Other ways you can help: If you are unable to give monetarily, it would be very much appreciated if you would "like" and share the event’s Facebook page, as well as sharing this Indiegogo page with your friends. https://www.facebook.com/appalachianartsevent

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
A Chance for Van Gogh

Van Gogh was a missionary. 

Paul Gauguin was a stockbroker. 

Vassily Kandinsky was law teacher.

Now they are known as famous artists. 

There are a lot of talented people who are willing to go the same way, challenging their lives and quitting their current jobs in order to dedicate themselves to art. However, the first step is hard. At least they must be sure they can show their works to public. The project will give this opportunity to them.

The project is to launch an ART GALLERY to expose paintings of artists who took the brush in their adulthood and dared to change their lives. And maybe our lives too.

Those Who Dare ART GALLERY will be open to painters from any country of the world.  The space will allow to exhibit few painters at the same time, giving 2-4 weeks to each painter. They will also be able to sell their works at the gallery to make sure this occupation can be paying for living.

Those Who Dare ART GALLERY will be located in the saint UNESCO protected city of Assisi where San Francisco comes from. The old walls of a medieval city in the heart of Italy are perfect match to atmosphere of art and new life.

I changed my life too, however, not to the art. And I know the first step is extremely difficult. I have met people in my life who would do more to the world culture, but they didn't. I understand perfectly my project cannot help every talented person and is focused on painting art only, at least, at that stage, but I still want to give support at least to some of Those Who Dare.

Who knows, maybe together we will help a world-heritage artist with his first difficult step. 

Those Who Dare

The painters finding themselves relevant to the project, are welcome to apply for the exhibition in free form to this email address: roman.goronok@me.com You will get Preliminary Confirmation and timing proposal. Final Confirmation will be given in case of success of this fundraising project.

Why 64 000

The target is to collect 64 000 USD to run this project during one year. The project will be extended in time in case more fund is raised.

  • 20 000 USD will be allocated for one year rent of the ART GALLERY
  • 18 000 USD will be allocated for basic manpower
  • 4 000 USD will be allocated on initial marketing expenses
  • 12 000 USD will be allocated to promote Those Who Dare ARTISTS, including making Artists's Cards, invitations etc.
  • 10 000 USD will go to the support pool to cover basic needs expenses of artists who are not capable to pay for travel and lodging
Hopefully, after one year Those Who Dare ART GALLERY will become important to people's culture.

Perks will not eat the fund raised

It is important that perks are good but do not reduce the fund. Hopefully, you'll find them motivating!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please, make some noise about this campaign using Indiegogo share tools or any other way you can do it!


Thank you and let's help another big name come!
