story:
The story: If nothing else, please learn from mine.

On 3/6/2013 I left work later than usual... worked a little overtime becuase I was feeling really excited about some of my projects and wanted to get a head start. I missed my commuter bus because I left work too late... forcing me to take the 38L line which takes a bit longer (I didn't think anything of this because it's normal for me to take that line home). That night, I was attacked on the bus. I was sitting down in the back of the bus during regular commute hours.
 
I always keep my phone in my pocket when on the bus because I've known several people to get their wallets, phones, iPads stolen. Some attacks are violent, some aren't. Mine was.
 
I had my purse in my lap as I pulled my phone outta my pocket to change the song I was listening to when someone hit me and grabbed my things (purse & phone). They weren't alone. There were 5 people total who were part of this. They protected the attacker as they jetted off the bus. Instinctually, I ran after them. There was a struggle for my purse, which I got back. One of the group ran off with my phone as I grabbed one of them & yelled at him (that's the only real weapon I had, my words). In that moment, I chose to let him go - I chose not to let it go any further. I didn't want to get into more of a situation than I was already in. I had the most important piece of all of this still with me - myself. I also had my purse which I got back in the struggle.
 
I called 911 from a nearby store. They let me use their land line for as long as I needed, I even used one of their iPhones to remotely lock and wipe my phone clean of all of my personal information. I used the Find iPhone app - which is automatically on all 4s and 5 phones. When the police came...he said that he takes reports of this type of violence at least twice a day. And what can they do: nothing. NOTHING.
 
I did get hurt in all of this - which is part of why I am so tramatized. I also am not a violent person AT ALL - I hate that, seemingly, the only way to protect yourself during a situation like that is to become more violent. And if you're wondering if anyone helped me...during the attack, no one helped me.
 
So, I've decided...I WANT TO TAKE MY TRANSPORTATION INTO MY OWN HANDS:
 
and also: 
  • I want to give back to places that work toward making the world less violent. (see how I will below)
  • I'm terrifyied by being on the bus now. Currently, 'm suffering from some PTSD & nightmares from this.
  • I want to start protecting myself.
  • I know this fear will fade, but I want to empower myself in a different way.
  • The violence on the bus is getting worse and the MTA isn't doing anything about it. The police can't help either.
  • I don't want to drive my car in the city - I'd like to get a scooter that gets me around quickly to my responsibilities and meetings - and safely.
  • You will help me continue to do the work that I do for others - I volunteer over 20 hours a week to the San Francisco Etsy community. I need the flexiblity that quick transportation - but I don't want to take the bus any longer.

Don't know who I am?

If you don't already know me - learn about me at http://www.katyatchison.com/v2/about/

Where will this money go?

Once I've reached $3K goal - this is where they money will go:

  • First, flowers sent to the store in Union Square that helped me when I felt like I was all alone.
  • One scooter - likely a 50cc becuase I don't need anything powerful or need/want to be on the freeway on my scooter. But I will get a license if needed. I WILL NOT BE BUYING A NEW ONE - I will be buying a used scooter.
  • Helmet for extra brain safety
  • Protective Jacket & gear.
  • Weather-proof cover for my scooter
  • pepper spray for future safety
  • Lessons how how to properly ride my new wheels
  • registration for my new vehicle
  • Shipping for all of the items sold through this campaign.
  • ALL of the rest of the money will be donated to the V-Day charity which protects women in over 81 other countries.
  • if I don't reach my entire goal...I will be putting whatever I make into a safe place so that I can save for the rest of it on my own. You will still receive your artwork. I will be grateful for even just a $5 donation.
  • PLUS, you will know that I'm riding around with a HUGE smile on my face with the wind in my hair + you can take rides on the back, too!

What do you get?

You get what you pay for - artwork by me + shipping is included!! All of these things are things I normally would sell...but I'm trying to raise money QUICK so that i can get on my own scooter wheels around SF quickly (before my 33rd birthday on May 2nd)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute and that's OK! I know you all care so much about me and my safety. Here's other ways you can help:

  • Please, get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • PLEASE TELL PEOPLE WAYS TO PROTECT THEMSELVES

Lastly - IMPORTANT

I'm not one to get scared or think that i need to change my own lifestyle in order to protect myself - I'm pretty tough. But in this case...I want to get on the road to a better, safer life for myself quickly (Like ASAP). And the only way to do that is with help from those around me. I work hard as an artist - and I will work TRIPLE time to get all your artwork to those who support me.

Side note: THANK YOU for taking the time to even read this. It is taking everything inside me to even ask for any help at all. I just can't raise this money on my own as quickly as I can do it with your help. I'm being brave in this moment - I'm reaching out to the community that I know loves me so much and wants to see me safe and sound.

story:
Here is my story. I was born in Montreal, Canada. From the age of 12 I knew that wanted to be actor. That I wanted to play.

Life brought me elsewhere, from paperboy to buss-boy, from packer in a grocery store to flight attendant, then graphic designer.

At 30 I realized that I was unhappy. That I had to change my life. That I had to do what I had always dreamed of: acting.

So I left my job as a graphic designer to start a new life. I used all my savings to pay for my training in the private sector. I followed more than 1500 hours of acting-on-camera workshops.

I quickly began to work. In advertising, television and then in cinema.

I have thus been able to earn my life humbly for the last 10 years. I got several parts, I won the best actor award in 2011 at the International Fantasia Festival. I realized my dream to a certain extent.

However, the industry is difficult in Quebec. Productions are becoming rarer, auditions are less frequent. I have seen many of my colleagues drop out of the trade to do something else.

I do not want to give up. I want to continue doing the most amazing job in the world and the next step is the United States.

I want to raise funds to hire a lawyer to help me get my O-1B visa.

We have a lot of talent in Quebec. I think of the directors Jean-Marc Vallée, Denis Villeneuve and Xavier Dolan who make our cinema radiate all over the world. I want to be part of it. I dream big. I want to make it happen.

story:
Hello from Golden, CO! I'm a local artist and Photographer. For the last three years I've been pursuing my passions full time. It hasn't been easy, but I'm making waves. Tiny waves, but they still count, right? I have three, almost four, solid bodies of work. My "Babies" if you will. I have been offered a chance to have my first solo exhibit at an actual gallery, in which I honestly never thought would happen. Now that it has happened, the reality of actually getting this off the ground is sinking in, and I need some help! 


Here is exactly what I need to make this dream a reality: 

Gallery wall rental space: $400 

I have approximately forty photos to show, with prints, matting and framing, I've calculated the cost to be around $400-$500 

Then I need marketing materials, mostly flyers, order forms, and name cards for each piece. I've calculated the cost to be around $100-$200

I am however, offering perks! Perks from prints, framed originals, drawings, paintings and photo sessions.

story:
To Travel. 

To Wander. 

To have this type of experience with friends and colleagues is a critical component of contemporary design education. In 2012, David Grey, the Chair of the Graphic Design Department at Santa Fe University of Art and Design, organized and lead a 23 day contemplative travel adventure and mindfulness retreat through the Mexican landscapes of Chiapas and the Yucatan Peninsula. With him were six of his strongest graphic design students. Known as Hexagano, these students came from Mexico to study in the US and for two years they warmly embraced the principles of contemplative design. As a result, they were now given the opportunity go back to Mexico with their professor and their expanded perspective and travel through indigenous regions where they've never been. Their intention was to explore a foreign space with the eyes of a contemplative graphic designer and allow this wakefulness and curiosity to fuel a series of graphic design and contemplative art exercises. As a tribe of nomadic designers, they would explore and watch and participate and appreciate. Afterward, they would return to the University and design a contemplative, expressive, design-based, image-making book, called The Importance Of... as a visual response to the entire experience and in essence create a vehicle to share the perspective and fruition of a contemplative graphic designer. 

 

 
the following are example spreads from the book. we hope you enjoy them.
 

The Importance Of… is a 200 page hard bound book (18cm x 26cm, slip cover over embossed fabric cover) designed and experienced by Hexagono: Rebecca Alvarez, Pablo Byrne, Suzelle Camou, Marco Lukini, & Ana Villa. The project was conceived and produced by David Grey. The book will be co-published and distributed by Radius Books and Santa Fe University of Art and Design. Although the first portion of this project (the educational travel adventure) was graciously funded by the University, we are now ready to raise the funds needed to print this beautiful artist book in Verona Italy in an edition of 1500. We need to raise $25,000 to fully complete this project. If we exceed our funding goal, we will certainly consider printing 2000 copies.

 

 
“A simple trip…on an airplane gives us a vision of the world that our imagination could not have revealed otherwise....

 

By supporting the production of this book, you are doing much more than you might imagine. Yes, you are helping a group of young designers produce their very first “visual album”. And, yes, you are making it possible to share 300 copies of this book, for free, to various libraries around the country (this is part of Radius Books generous non-profit model). But most importantly, you are supporting the fruition of a design education based on mindfulness; an education that explores graphic design as a tool to help develop purer perception and wakefulness. So please help us by purchasing a copy of this book in advance or by offering any amount of money you deem beneficial. 

All we need is your support. The book’s design is complete and our intention is to print the beautiful object during March, placing the books in our hands by the end of April and hopefully in yours by the end of May. 

 

 
...Once we return to our modest existence as pedestrians, we will remember the splendor of the sun...

 

Now, you may be wondering, what am I actually supporting?

What is “Graphic Design as Contemplative Art”? 

Below is an excerpt from the book’s introduction essay, written by David Grey. For those interested, we hope this will offer a bit of insight. After the excerpt, you will find a link to a wonderfully uplifted extended version of the travel video sharing a few scenes from the many days that provided inspiration for this project. After the link, you will find a few images of both the postcards and posters that we have produced as gifts for those who donate in various increased amounts. We hope you will appreciate these additional offerings.

 

...as well as a perception of unlimited space in which for a moment we felt ourselves to be free.” - Henri Matisse
 

And now, here’s a bit from the book’s introduction essay explaining what it means to approach Graphic Design as Contemplative Art….

“...The sensibility of a mystic is nurtured by exploring graphic design as contemplative art. This practice expands space and provides support for designers to genuinely see the external phenomenal world and its interconnectedness to our thoughts and agendas, our hopes and fears. We break down boundaries of language and culture by connecting one’s primordial wisdom to the essence of design elements and principles, and by doing so, we are able to recognize that the manifestation of one’s creative path is the direct reflection of the mind’s view. Graphic design becomes much more than just an application of visual communication. It becomes a way of seeing. It becomes a way of appreciating. It becomes a way of being. Because of this, we can use the practice of graphic design as a method to develop purer perception. It can help wake us up. Design students observe this unfolding experience while visually and conceptually connecting and separating everything from distilled ideas to extended narratives. By regularly revisiting the question, “What is the criteria for critique?” my students are asked to look closely at how their internal storylines interweave with those of our ever-changing society. These storylines grow in richness and clarity when appreciating the prism of our environment, the wisdom of localized culture, and the energy of a connected community. By taking the time to look inward before projecting outward, students are able to develop a sense of awareness that transforms the conceptual design process into an exploration of freedom. 

This is nothing new. It could be considered by some as a return to the spirituality of the Bauhaus or the wakefulness of Black Mountain…. As pedagogical support, students are introduced to breathing meditation. By following one’s breath and observing one’s thoughts, a person begins to settle the mind and synchronize body. Through this practice of mindfulness, one is able to profoundly connect with the spaciousness of intuition and the pointedness of intellect. Discerning awareness and skillful means work in harmony, bringing about a sense of joy while cultivating a sense of taste. When exploring this in the studio, students begin to feel the effects of a settled group creative consciousness. Contemplation, gestation, and creation occur with a greater sense of ease. Community begins to magnetize….” 

 

Please take some time and enjoy the extended adventure video by clicking the link below:

The Importance Of... Extended Travel Video

 

For those of you who can support by offering more than the cost of a single book, we also have postcards and posters available for you. To the right, you will be able to review the various opportunities to receive some of these items. Below are images, to wet your appetite, of the postcards and limited edition posters.

 

 
postcard 1
 
 
postcard 2
 
 
postcard 3
 
 
 
postcard 4
 
 
postcard 5
 
 
 
limited edition archival inkjet poster 1
 
 
limited edition archival inkjet poster 2
 
 
limited edition archival inkjet poster 3
 
 
limited edition archival inkjet poster 4
 
 
limited edition archival inkjet poster 5
 
 

Thank you very much for your consideration and support. 

 

We look forward to sharing the book with you soon.

 

 
Hexagono
story_txt:
To Travel. 
To Wander. 
To have this type of experience with friends and colleagues is a critical component of contemporary design education. In 2012, David Grey, the Chair of the Graphic Design Department at Santa Fe University of Art and Design, organized and lead a 23 day contemplative travel adventure and mindfulness retreat through the Mexican landscapes of Chiapas and the Yucatan Peninsula. With him were six of his strongest graphic design students. Known as Hexagano, these students came from Mexico to study in the US and for two years they warmly embraced the principles of contemplative design. As a result, they were now given the opportunity go back to Mexico with their professor and their expanded perspective and travel through indigenous regions where they've never been. Their intention was to explore a foreign space with the eyes of a contemplative graphic designer and allow this wakefulness and curiosity to fuel a series of graphic design and contemplative art exercises. As a tribe of nomadic designers, they would explore and watch and participate and appreciate. Afterward, they would return to the University and design a contemplative, expressive, design-based, image-making book, called The Importance Of... as a visual response to the entire experience and in essence create a vehicle to share the perspective and fruition of a contemplative graphic designer. 
 

 
the following are example spreads from the book. we hope you enjoy them.
 
The Importance Of… is a 200 page hard bound book (18cm x 26cm, slip cover over embossed fabric cover) designed and experienced by Hexagono: Rebecca Alvarez, Pablo Byrne, Suzelle Camou, Marco Lukini, & Ana Villa. The project was conceived and produced by David Grey. The book will be co-published and distributed by Radius Books and Santa Fe University of Art and Design. Although the first portion of this project (the educational travel adventure) was graciously funded by the University, we are now ready to raise the funds needed to print this beautiful artist book in Verona Italy in an edition of 1500. We need to raise $25,000 to fully complete this project. If we exceed our funding goal, we will certainly consider printing 2000 copies.
 

 
“A simple trip…on an airplane gives us a vision of the world that our imagination could not have revealed otherwise....

story:
Our Story

Miami Design Preservation League (MDPL) is a non-profit organization devoted to preserving, protecting, and promoting the cultural, social, economic, environmental and architectural integrity of the Miami Beach Architectural Historic District. MDPL provides cultural and educational programs to Dade County residents, surrounding counties, citizens of Florida and to national and international visitors and tourists. Our programs are developed for the general public and have special appeal to those interested in art, design, architecture, history, preservation, urban and community planning and development.

Our largest program is the Art Deco Weekend (ADW) Festival. This year is our 38th Anniversary. ADW was started to bring attention to the beautiful Art Deco architecture along Ocean Drive. MDPL provides educational lectures, tours, films, and other programming during ADW to educate people about the Art Deco Historic District, History of Miami Beach, Culture of Miami Beach, and more. With over 300,000 people in attendance and over 85 events, ADW is the largest and longest running festival in Miami Beach, FL.

The Impact

This campaign will help us provide free events to the community during Art Deco Weekend as we have done for 38 years. For the 38th Anniversary, we want to make this festival better than ever and we need your help!

Along with government and community advocacy, MDPL has made Miami Beach synonymous with education, art and culture. The annual Art Deco Weekend (ADW) draws 300,000 to South Florida every January. MDPL exhibits, lecture and film series, historic tours and education have become regular daily, weekly and seasonal events all year long, mainstays of the global draw Miami Beach boasts. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $20,000. This money will help pay for the educational components of Art Deco Weekend festival, our ongoing advocacy efforts, our annual programming and assist with upcoming exhibits for our new Art Deco Museum.

All donors will be recognized in our Art Deco Weekend Program Guide, which is distributed to 10,000 people over Art Deco Weekend. 


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Volunteer at Art Deco Weekend or ask others to give. Please share the link to this fundraiser on your social media! Thank you!

story:
On January 2014,  I relocated to South Africa to pursue a career as an arts administrator in contemporary arts.   In April I was offered a position as a Gallery and Public Programs Manager at a renowned arts organization.  I am scheduled to begin work on November 1.  I've initiated this fund raising campaign with the hope that you will support my professional aspirations.  Your generosity will help cover my air fare and first month's expenses as I await my wages.

Why do I need to raise money?

Its simple.  First, I underestimated how long it would take to get a visa.  I thought I would be in the States for 6 weeks.  Instead it has taken 3 months and I've had to tap into my saving.  In addition, in South Africa pay day is once a month at the end of the month.  I will begin working at the beginning of November but wont be compensated for weeks.  Funds raised will allow me to set up a basic living space and generally care for myself until I get paid.

And you can read about how and why I found myself in South Africa:  http://travellingwomanists.wordpress.com/2013/12/26/south-africa-or-bust.

Thanks for all of your assistance.

story:
Our Aim

Do you love The Colbert Report? Were you devastated when you found out that it was ending soon? Yeah...us too!

We are a group of fans who want to give The Colbert Report staff and crew an amazing send off. If you watch the show regularly you know that the Colbert Nation has always been an active part of the show. So we want to say a huge 'thank you' to Stephen Colbert and everyone involved in the writing and production of the show by creating and gifting 100 custom medals to The Colbert Report in time for the last episode of the show in mid December. The Colbert Report has just under 100 staff and crew.

What We Need & What You Get

So far we have sourced several quotes from medal-makers around the USA for 100 antique gold-colored medals (2.5" in diameter) with red, white and blue ribbons. The production, shipping and tax costs for 100 custom medals will be approximately $550.

If you donate $100 or more to this project, you will receive your own custom medal as a souvenir! If you donate $50 you will receive a 'Thank You' postcard featuring the final medal design, and will be entered into a lottery to receive any unclaimed medals from the higher perk level.

Extra money raised by this project (up to a total budget of $1000) will go into purchasing larger, better quality medals for the staff and crew, as well as an engraved crystal trophy for Stephen Colbert. If we raise $700 we will upgrade the medals to 3" versions. If we raise $1000, we will add the crystal trophy to the order.

The crystal trophy will be similar to the one previously gifted to the show by the Colbert Nation for its 5th Anniversary:

http://thecolbertreport.cc.com/videos/r3cpem/who-s-honoring-me-now----colbert-nation-five-years-of-excellence-award

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please pass this campaign on to other fans and let them know the Colbert Nation needs their help!

    If you have professional design skills and can help designing the medals, please also get in touch. (We have a concept in mind but the final design still needs to be created.) The designer of the medal will receive a medal shipped to their door in thanks.

    The Colbert Nation Medal Campaign requires a minimum of $550 and will end when it reaches $1000, so get in quickly to be one of the lucky contributors to Colbert Report history!

    Update: We're over 70% of the way there with less than 24 hours to go! Dig deep Colbert Nation, we can do this!

story:
“I go to seek a great perhaps.”

The great poet Francois Rabelais said it best; one must search for purpose, for life. One must not simply wait for opportunities to present themselves; they must be fought for. I’ve taken my life and my education into my own hands, pursuing a creative career derived from a long-time passion. As an artist, I am constantly reminded of the challenges, competition, and critique that await my work. However, I have persevered into this unknown wholeheartedly.

I am currently attending the Savannah College of Art and Design in Atlanta, Georgia as an undergraduate student seeking a bachelor’s degree in Interior Design. The program that I am involved in is #1 in the nation, for several years in a row now, and is justly rigorous. Despite many demanding projects and sleepless nights, I have managed to stay on the Dean’s list all five quarters that I have been enrolled at SCAD, and I currently and proudly boast a 3.91 GPA.

As an international school, SCAD has a campus in Lacoste, France. Since the day I received my acceptance letter to SCAD, I have dreamed of studying abroad in Lacoste and I have worked hard in order to achieve that goal. Now that I have been accepted into the study abroad program (yay!), very little can stand in my way. For the duration of ten weeks, I will live in southern France on SCAD’s campus as a full time student and take the following courses: Art History: Treasures of Provence, Drawing: Travel Portfolio, and Photography: Photographic Foundations I. These classes will assist me in further developing and honing my artistic skills and create a more solid foundation for my future career as an Interior Designer. 

    The wise and beautiful words of Leonardo da Vinci have always inspired me, and I use them now as a motivational force to follow my dreams: “For once you have tasted flight you will walk the earth with your eyes turned skywards, for there you have been and there you will long to return.”

________________________________________


What I Need & What You Get

The tuition amount for a full time student at SCAD- Lacoste is $10,963. I do have scholarship money that will go towards this amount, and the remainder is to be covered with loans. 

The program fee for Lacoste is $6,150, plus an airline ticket averaging about $1,500, for a grand total of $7,650. And this is the bare minimum. (Feel free to visit scad.edu for more information.)

However, I do have some funds saved already, and I plan to work as much as possible until my departure date, so I'm not asking to raise the full amount needed. My goal is $3,000, and if by some miracle I am able to achieve more, I will be unexplainably thankful. 

Why help? Aside from assisting a young, passionate artist fulfill her dream of studying abroad, I am offering a few (if minor) perks. 

_______________________________________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word of my endeavors and share this page with your friends, family and co-workers!
_______________________________________________________________________

Also!! 
Check out my blog that I will continuously update while traveling at www.bridgetglean.blogspot.com
Or! My online portfolio at www.portfolios.scad.edu/BridgetGlean
or……http://bridget214.wix.com/bridgetglean

Happy Travels everyone!!

story:
From Arts to Crafts

Hi my name is Wicklesmack. You may know me as the artist who is known for my MLP:FIM artwork. But I also love to persue different art media other than digital art. Plushing has always been a huge interest in me so I'd love to try out a new challenge. I hope to be able to make MLP:FIM plushes, Pokemon, and League of Legend plushies. I also wish to release my patterns out to the public so everyone can try out something new and fun!

What I Need & What You Get

I need 500 dollars for a sewing machine and some beginning materials, so that I can start making plushies. 

In return I plan to release my plush patterns and I will also make a really cute poster featuring everyone who donates. I'll also send a thank you out to everyone who donates!

Here's something that I've been working on! 

The Impact

This project is very important to me because I I want to be able to create nice cute things for the community to see, and maybe emulate themselves! 

As an artist, I have some successful galleries, but I want to be able to bring more to the community.

Risks & Challenges

I may not be able to start making final projects right away, as I will be a full time college student, but I want to contribute to the community by making really awesome cute things :3!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, I'll be ecstatic if you help spread the word! It means you care!

Past Work

Here's some of my past artwork! I will put in the same effort into my plushies!

story:
Who?

My name is Larry Cook. I'm a visual artist living and working in Washington D.C. Many of you have seen my work exhibited in various galleries and Museums in Maryland and DC. www.larrywcook.com

What/Why?

  • I am raising funds to put towards the production cost of a Neon Light Sign similar to the image above. Here's a link to more examples. http://www.litebriteneon.com/custom/art/popup.asp?image=L1010499.jpg    
  • As you know, my work is about creating a dialogue about identity and race. The creation of this art piece allows me to continue this dialogue in a new medium as I step outside of photography and video into 3D work. 
  • Contributions made to this campaign will help me create a piece that I've dreamt of making. It's now that I have this unique opportunity to make this new groundbreaking work and I will sincerely appreciate your support.
  • With your help, I'll be able to complete the piece in time to be featured in the Converge Exhibition  curated by Klaus Ottman, Curator at the Phillips Collection. The exhibit will open at the Hamiltonian Gallery opening August 8th 2014.

What I Need/What You Get

  • I need to raise $2,700 to put toward the production,shipping and installation cost of the Neon Light Sign. I am working with the company Lite Brite Neon in Brooklyn, NY to create the piece.    
  •  Contributions of $25 or more -4x6 Post card from my last solo Show at Hamiltonian Gallery. $50 or more -Private Cocktail Showing of the Converge Exhibition at the Hamiltonian Gallery August 2014. $300 or more -8x10 in. print from selected images above. $1000 or more 20x30 in print or 20x24 in print from selected images above. 

A donation of any size - be it $10, $30, $100 or more - will makes a tremendous difference in helping me produce this artwork!

Thank you for your generous support!

story:
Short Summary

As part of Critical Animals Festival, Speak Easy is a participatory art and research project presented by the Socio Creative Trust, a collective of artists with the core members being Susie Anderson, Melissa DeLaney, Beck Pope 

and Gemma Robertson. 

Speak Easy incorporates art, wellness, sustainability and is a curated conversationdinnerperformance. Festival goers are invited to anonymously sign up to the dinner to take part in a curated discussion. The Socio Creative Trust will facilitate conversations around the festival's key theme of "Possible Futures".

This performance will be broadcast online and the audience encouraged to participate through social media. A publication documenting the conversation will be created post-event and distributed to both attendees and the virtual audience members.

What We Need & What You Get

This project is a partnership project with Critical Animals and Creative Partnerships Australia.  

Your kind support will help us:

  • get us to the Festival;
  • help contribute to paying local providers for their produce;
  • put a roof over our heads during the four days/nights of the Festival;
  • enable the event to be networked and documented, which will then become another layer of the live performance.

By supporting this project we can also offer you a range of perks outside of the event itself. This will allow Speak Easy to evolve and happen at other festivals and places to grow the conversations.

The Impact

People are interested in authentic exchange and dialogue, in slow food, of slow relationship building, in the art of conversation, in locally grown and sourced produce, in value of connection, of the importance of ideas, of finding solutions, of intimacy, of being heard, in participating.  This project provides a safe platform, and while providing a structure, has the potential to open up forms of dialogue and exchange – of discovery and exploration.

Thanks to Creative Partnerships Australia, every dollar you give will be matched $1 for $1 through their Match: Crowdfunding for the Independent Arts Sector initiative program.

Short Summary

I am Inky (In Kyung Lee), a video and dance artist from South Korea who is currently based in US. I’ve been a traveler my whole life. I was in the air flying from US to Korea in my mother’s womb, and grew up having countless memories of flying, moving, and travelling.

Being abroad and away from home, I used to associate airplanes with flying home. Flying somewhere has always been loaded with emotions and expectations. As the time of being abroad extended, I began to question the definition of home. I realized that home is not a static location, but rather more about people and memories. I could make anywhere my home if I decided to (or did I learn how not to make anywhere home for my convenience?). Slowly, my sense of “being home”, “going home”, or “missing home” blurred. From this place, I furthered my inquiry to true and false nature of my personal memories and history. Are all my memories truthful “fact” or do I make them up and mold them depending on necessities and wishes? What kind of memories makes a regular place special, and how do those memories form? Are they “real?”

Based on these thoughts and inquiries, I plan to produce a video art as I travel through Europe (Portugal – Lisbon & Tondela, Switzerland - Geneva, and Germany – Berlin & Stolzenhagen) to Canada (Vancouver & Montreal), back to the States (Phoenix, AZ). Each of these places has its distinct and strong association with my ideas and memories of home. Throughout the 4 months of summer traveling, I will observe and interact with the people, surroundings, nature, atmosphere, sounds, smells, etc. in each location. I will also focus on filming whenever I am in transit, such as in airports, trains, and buses. I will connect these observations with my realization and analysis of what makes a place “home”, how the memories link from a place to another, and how much of those are factual and/or fabricated in my mind.

In addition to travelling, I will immerse myself into environments that bring out most artistic potential in me. In Portugal, I am participating in an artist residency program. Korean Embassy in Portugal agreed to promote my artistic research while I produce work there, and I am communicating with Korean Embassies in my other destinations. In Germany, I am attending a month long movement workshop with world-renowned guest artists and a small group of international participants. In Canada, I will present my work in World Dance Alliance 2013 Conference, and meet various artists from around the world. These activities help me to stay active as an artist by constantly being in contact with various artists and having mentors throughout my project. Upon my return to the States, I will polish the final video with advice of my mentors here.  

As an artist and individual, I find this project crucial at this stage of my life. I see the potential of it clarifying my path and life so far, therefore guiding me to the next step. However, as an artist and an international student who cannot work (it is illegal) or take out loans, I would not be able to make this trip possible at all without your kind help. This is my big exciting dream at this point, and I humbly ask you to partake in the process.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order for this trip to happen, I will majorly need help with airfare, other transportation costs, housing, and food. For transportation, I see it being around $3000. Housing and food I am unsure, but I anticipate it to be at least $3300 (if I do not sleep on the streets, train stations, and airports like I did last time!). Therefore, I set my goal for the funding to $6300. If I do not meet my goal for the funding, I will still use whatever amount I receive to make this trip happen in a modified way.

To express my sincere gratitude for your generosity, I will have some gifts for you, such as handwritten postcard, hand drawn & written postcard, link to my final video, and “thank you” credit in my video. In the postcards, you can ask me specific questions if wanted. You can also ask questions that you want answers from a certain or random person/people I meet during the travel, and I will get answers for you.   

 

Other Ways You Can Help

            If you cannot help in financial way, there are still ways that you can help. I would appreciate any kindness and hospitality throughout my journey, such as providing housing, food, and information about the cities. In addition, I am in a desperate need for a new video camera, because my camera is the most basic model that does not render professional quality video, and it has a very small memory. If any one has a decent video camera to donate or sell at a good price, I would be extremely grateful. Lastly, one of the biggest help will be sharing this campaign with your families and friends. Please help me spread the word and spread my wings to fly!

 

“A plug socket, a bathroom tap, a jam jar or an airport sign may tell us more than its designer intended; it may speak of the nation that made it.”

~By Alain de Botton, in Art of Travel

 

 

 

프로젝트 요약:

저는 미디아 & 댄스 아티스트로 현재 미국에서 활동 중인 이인경입니다. 살아가면서 저는 언제나 “여행자” 였습니다. 엄마 뱃속에서부터 저는 미국에서 한국으로 날아갔고, 이렇게 자라면서 수도 없는 여행과 이사와 비행의 기억들을 가지게 됐습니다.

집을 떠나 외국 생활을 하면서, 저는 비행기를 볼 때마다 집으로 날아가는 상상을 하곤 했습니다. 어딘가 새로운 곳으로 가는 것은 언제나 저를 많은 감정들과 기대들로 가득 차게 했습니다. 외국 생활의 시간이 길어지면서 저는 집의 정의를 묻기 시작했고, 곧 집은 한정된 장소가 아니라 사람들과 기억들에 대한 것이라는 것을 깨달았습니다. 제가 원한다면 저는 어느 곳이든 저의 집으로 만들 수 있다는 것을 알게 됐습니다 (아니면 저의 편리함을 위해 그 어느 곳도 집으로 만들지 않는 방법을 배우게 된 걸 까요?). 점차, “집에 있는 것”, “집에 가는 것”, 또는 “집에 대한 그리움” 이란 감정들이 흐려지기 시작했습니다. 그러면서 개인적 추억들과 기억들의 진실성과 거짓성에 대한 질문들이 깊어져 갔습니다. 저의 모든 기억들이 진실된 “사실” 들일까요, 아니면 필요와 소망들에 의해서 만들어지고 바뀌어진 것들일까요? 어떠한 기억들이 평범한 장소를 특별하게 만들고, 어떻게 그러한 기억들이 만들어 지는 걸까요? 그 모든 기억들이 “진짜” 일까요?    

이 모든 생각들과 질문들을 기반으로, 저는 유럽과 캐나다를 거쳐 미국으로 돌아오는 과정을 통해 비디오 아트를 만들 계획 입니다 (일정: 포르투갈 – 리스본 &  톤델라, 스위스 – 제네바, 독일 – 베를린 & 스톨즌하겐, 캐나다 – 벤쿠버 & 몬트리올, 미국 – 아리조나). 이 모든 장소들은 집에 연관된 저의 생각과 기억들과 각각 특별한 연관성을 가지고 있습니다. 4 개월간의 여행을 거치며, 각각의 장소에서 사람들, 그 주변 환경, 자연, 분위기, 소리, 냄새, 등등을 관찰 할 것 입니다. 또한, 비행기, 기차, 버스 등 “중간 지점”에 있을 때에 촬영을 하는 것에도 초점을 둘 것입니다. 이 모든 관찰들을 무엇이 장소를 “집”으로 만드는가에 대한 깨달음과 분석에 연결 시키고, 어떻게 한 장소에서 다른 장소로 기억들이 이어지는지, 그리고 얼마나 그러한 기억들과 연결점들이 사실인지 나의 머릿속에서 만들어진 것들인지 자세히 연구 할 것 입니다.

여행을 하는 것에 더해서, 저는 저의 예술적 잠재력을 최대한 불러 일으 킬 수 있는 환경들에 저 자신을 포함 시킬 것 입니다. 포르투갈에서 여러 분야의 예술가들을 초대하여 창조와 협동의 장소를 마련 해 주는 아티스트 레지던시 프로그램에 참여 할 것입니다. 포르투갈에 있는 한국 대사관이 그곳에서 저의 연구를 홍보 해 주기로 했고, 다른 목적지들에 있는 한국 대사관들과도 연락을 하고 있는 과정에 있습니다. 독일에서는 세계적으로 유명한 예술가들을 초청해 전세계 각지에서 초대된 소그룹의 예술가들을 대상으로 진행되는 한달 동안의 워크샵에 참여 할 수 있게 되었습니다. 캐나다에서는 전세계의 다양한 예술가들이 모이는 월드 댄스 얼라이언스 (세계 무용 협회) 2013학회에서 저의 연구를 발표 합니다. 이 모든 활동들은 저를 예술가로서 깨어있을 뿐만 아니라 저의 프로젝트를 돕는 멘토들을 만나는데 큰 도움이 될 것 입니다. 여행을 마치고 미국에 돌아와서는 이곳에서 관계를 쌓아 온 멘토들의 도움을 통해 저의 최종 비디오를 끝마칠 계획 입니다.

예술가로써, 그리고 한 사람으로써, 저는 이 프로젝트가 현재 저의 삶에 매우 중요하다고 생각합니다. 지금까지 저의 삶을 돌아보고, 정리하고, 다음 단계로 이끌어 줄 수 있는 큰 잠재력이 있는 프로젝트 입니다. 하지만 타지에서 일을 해서 돈을 벌 수 도 빚도 낼 수 없는 국제학생과 예술인으로써, 여러분의 친절한 도움이 없이 저는 이 프로젝트를 성공적으로 해 낼 수 없습니다. 이 프로젝트는 현재 저의 가장 크고 기대되는 꿈 중 하나 이기에 여러분들께 이 과정에 함께 참여해 달라고 겸손히 여쭙니다.

 

 도움이 필요한 부분:

이 프로젝트를 성공적으로 마치기 위해서는 비행기, 다른 교통수단, 숙박, 그리고 식비에서 주로 도움이 필요 할 것입니다. 교통비는 적어도 $3000, 숙박비는 적어도 $3300 으로 예상합니다 (저번처럼 길거리와 기차역에서 밤에 떠돌지 않는 이상!). 이 금액은 여러가지 다른 필요한 것들을 제외한 기본 금액으로,저의 캠페인 목표를 $6300으로 잡았고, 전 금액이 모아지지 않는다고 해도 저는 5월 초에 첫 목적지로 떠나서 변형된 방법들과 한정된 제정으로 어떻게든 여행을 끝마칠 생각 입니다. (하지만 저는 여전히 저의 사랑하는 가족과 친구들의 도움과 사랑을 매우 믿음직 스러운 동반자로 생각합니다!)

도움을 주신 분들께 감사를 표현하기 위해서 여러가지 작은 선물들을 준비했습니다. 여행을 하며 보내 드릴 손수 작성한 엽서, 손수 만들고 작성한 엽서, 저의 최종 비디오 링크, 그리고 비디오 마지막에 “감사한 이들” 로 이름을 올려 드릴 겁니다. 원하신다면 엽서에 특별한 질문들을 하셔도 좋고, 제가 여행을 하면서 만나는 다른 이들에게 있는 질문을 주셔도 좋습니다.

 

도움을 주실 수 있는 다른 방법들:

제정적으로 도움을 주실 수 없는 분들은 다른 방법으로도 도움을 주실 수 있습니다! 저의 여행 기간 중의 크고 작은 모든 따듯한 친절함들은 저에게 큰 의미가 있을 것 입니다. 지낼 곳을 제공해 주시든, 음식을 주시든, 도시에 대해서 정보를 주시든, 따듯한 격려 한 마디를 해 주시든, 모든 도움들이 저에게 정말 크게 다가옵니다. 또한, 저는 현재 절박하게 새로운 비디오 카메라가 필요 합니다. 왜냐하면, 제가 가지고 있는 카메라는 가장 기본 모형의 캠코더라서 메모리도 매우 작지만 전문적인 화질을 창출 해 낼 수가 없습니다. 사용하지 않는 괜찮은 비디오 카메라를 기부하시거나 싼 값에 파시길 원하시는 분이 계시면 정말 감사할 것 입니다. 마지막으로, 이 캠페인을 가족과 친구들에게 퍼뜨리는 것을 도와주시는 게 가장 큰 도움 중 하나가 될 것입니다. 저의 날개를 펼칠 수 있도록 소식을 퍼뜨려 주세요!  

“콘센트, 화장실 수도꼭지, 쨈 통, 또는 공항의 표지판이 그 디자이너가 의도한 것보다 더 많은 것을 우리에게 말해 줄 수 있다; 그것들을 만든 나라들에 대해서 말해 줄 수 있다.”

-‘여행의 예술’ 의 작가, 알라인 드 보톤

In addition, I am in a desperate need for a new video camera, because my camera is the most basic model that does not render professional quality video, and it has a very small memory. If any one has a decent video camera to donate or sell at a good price, I would be extremely grateful. Lastly, one of the biggest help will be sharing this campaign with your families and friends. Please help me spread the word and spread my wings to fly!
 
“A plug socket, a bathroom tap, a jam jar or an airport sign may tell us more than its designer intended; it may speak of the nation that made it.”
~By Alain de Botton, in Art of Travel
 
 
 
프로젝트 요약:
저는 미디아 & 댄스 아티스트로 현재 미국에서 활동 중인 이인경입니다. 살아가면서 저는 언제나 “여행자” 였습니다. 엄마 뱃속에서부터 저는 미국에서 한국으로 날아갔고, 이렇게 자라면서 수도 없는 여행과 이사와 비행의 기억들을 가지게 됐습니다.
집을 떠나 외국 생활을 하면서, 저는 비행기를 볼 때마다 집으로 날아가는 상상을 하곤 했습니다. 어딘가 새로운 곳으로 가는 것은 언제나 저를 많은 감정들과 기대들로 가득 차게 했습니다. 외국 생활의 시간이 길어지면서 저는 집의 정의를 묻기 시작했고, 곧 집은 한정된 장소가 아니라 사람들과 기억들에 대한 것이라는 것을 깨달았습니다. 제가 원한다면 저는 어느 곳이든 저의 집으로 만들 수 있다는 것을 알게 됐습니다 (아니면 저의 편리함을 위해 그 어느 곳도 집으로 만들지 않는 방법을 배우게 된 걸 까요?). 점차, “집에 있는 것”, “집에 가는 것”, 또는 “집에 대한 그리움” 이란 감정들이 흐려지기 시작했습니다. 그러면서 개인적 추억들과 기억들의 진실성과 거짓성에 대한 질문들이 깊어져 갔습니다. 저의 모든 기억들이 진실된 “사실” 들일까요, 아니면 필요와 소망들에 의해서 만들어지고 바뀌어진 것들일까요? 어떠한 기억들이 평범한 장소를 특별하게 만들고, 어떻게 그러한 기억들이 만들어 지는 걸까요? 그 모든 기억들이 “진짜” 일까요?    
이 모든 생각들과 질문들을 기반으로, 저는 유럽과 캐나다를 거쳐 미국으로 돌아오는 과정을 통해 비디오 아트를 만들 계획 입니다 (일정: 포르투갈 – 리스본 &  톤델라, 스위스 – 제네바, 독일 – 베를린 & 스톨즌하겐, 캐나다 – 벤쿠버 & 몬트리올, 미국 – 아리조나). 이 모든 장소들은 집에 연관된 저의 생각과 기억들과 각각 특별한 연관성을 가지고 있습니다. 4 개월간의 여행을 거치며, 각각의 장소에서 사람들, 그 주변 환경, 자연, 분위기, 소리, 냄새, 등등을 관찰 할 것 입니다. 또한, 비행기, 기차, 버스 등 “중간 지점”에 있을 때에 촬영을 하는 것에도 초점을 둘 것입니다. 이 모든 관찰들을 무엇이 장소를 “집”으로 만드는가에 대한 깨달음과 분석에 연결 시키고, 어떻게 한 장소에서 다른 장소로 기억들이 이어지는지, 그리고 얼마나 그러한 기억들과 연결점들이 사실인지 나의 머릿속에서 만들어진 것들인지 자세히 연구 할 것 입니다.
여행을 하는 것에 더해서, 저는 저의 예술적 잠재력을 최대한 불러 일으 킬 수 있는 환경들에 저 자신을 포함 시킬 것 입니다. 포르투갈에서 여러 분야의 예술가들을 초대하여 창조와 협동의 장소를 마련 해 주는 아티스트 레지던시 프로그램에 참여 할 것입니다. 포르투갈에 있는 한국 대사관이 그곳에서 저의 연구를 홍보 해 주기로 했고, 다른 목적지들에 있는 한국 대사관들과도 연락을 하고 있는 과정에 있습니다. 독일에서는 세계적으로 유명한 예술가들을 초청해 전세계 각지에서 초대된 소그룹의 예술가들을 대상으로 진행되는 한달 동안의 워크샵에 참여 할 수 있게 되었습니다. 캐나다에서는 전세계의 다양한 예술가들이 모이는 월드 댄스 얼라이언스 (세계 무용 협회) 2013학회에서 저의 연구를 발표 합니다. 이 모든 활동들은 저를 예술가로서 깨어있을 뿐만 아니라 저의 프로젝트를 돕는 멘토들을 만나는데 큰 도움이 될 것 입니다. 여행을 마치고 미국에 돌아와서는 이곳에서 관계를 쌓아 온 멘토들의 도움을 통해 저의 최종 비디오를 끝마칠 계획 입니다.
예술가로써, 그리고 한 사람으로써, 저는 이 프로젝트가 현재 저의 삶에 매우 중요하다고 생각합니다. 지금까지 저의 삶을 돌아보고, 정리하고, 다음 단계로 이끌어 줄 수 있는 큰 잠재력이 있는 프로젝트 입니다. 하지만 타지에서 일을 해서 돈을 벌 수 도 빚도 낼 수 없는 국제학생과 예술인으로써, 여러분의 친절한 도움이 없이 저는 이 프로젝트를 성공적으로 해 낼 수 없습니다. 이 프로젝트는 현재 저의 가장 크고 기대되는 꿈 중 하나 이기에 여러분들께 이 과정에 함께 참여해 달라고 겸손히 여쭙니다.
 
 도움이 필요한 부분:
이 프로젝트를 성공적으로 마치기 위해서는 비행기, 다른 교통수단, 숙박, 그리고 식비에서 주로 도움이 필요 할 것입니다. 교통비는 적어도 $3000, 숙박비는 적어도 $3300 으로 예상합니다 (저번처럼 길거리와 기차역에서 밤에 떠돌지 않는 이상!). 이 금액은 여러가지 다른 필요한 것들을 제외한 기본 금액으로,저의 캠페인 목표를 $6300으로 잡았고, 전 금액이 모아지지 않는다고 해도 저는 5월 초에 첫 목적지로 떠나서 변형된 방법들과 한정된 제정으로 어떻게든 여행을 끝마칠 생각 입니다. (하지만 저는 여전히 저의 사랑하는 가족과 친구들의 도움과 사랑을 매우 믿음직 스러운 동반자로 생각합니다!)
도움을 주신 분들께 감사를 표현하기 위해서 여러가지 작은 선물들을 준비했습니다. 여행을 하며 보내 드릴 손수 작성한 엽서, 손수 만들고 작성한 엽서, 저의 최종 비디오 링크, 그리고 비디오 마지막에 “감사한 이들” 로 이름을 올려 드릴 겁니다. 원하신다면 엽서에 특별한 질문들을 하셔도 좋고, 제가 여행을 하면서 만나는 다른 이들에게 있는 질문을 주셔도 좋습니다.
 
도움을 주실 수 있는 다른 방법들:
제정적으로 도움을 주실 수 없는 분들은 다른 방법으로도 도움을 주실 수 있습니다! 저의 여행 기간 중의 크고 작은 모든 따듯한 친절함들은 저에게 큰 의미가 있을 것 입니다. 지낼 곳을 제공해 주시든, 음식을 주시든, 도시에 대해서 정보를 주시든, 따듯한 격려 한 마디를 해 주시든, 모든 도움들이 저에게 정말 크게 다가옵니다. 또한, 저는 현재 절박하게 새로운 비디오 카메라가 필요 합니다. 왜냐하면, 제가 가지고 있는 카메라는 가장 기본 모형의 캠코더라서 메모리도 매우 작지만 전문적인 화질을 창출 해 낼 수가 없습니다. 사용하지 않는 괜찮은 비디오 카메라를 기부하시거나 싼 값에 파시길 원하시는 분이 계시면 정말 감사할 것 입니다. 마지막으로, 이 캠페인을 가족과 친구들에게 퍼뜨리는 것을 도와주시는 게 가장 큰 도움 중 하나가 될 것입니다. 저의 날개를 펼칠 수 있도록 소식을 퍼뜨려 주세요!  
“콘센트, 화장실 수도꼭지, 쨈 통, 또는 공항의 표지판이 그 디자이너가 의도한 것보다 더 많은 것을 우리에게 말해 줄 수 있다; 그것들을 만든 나라들에 대해서 말해 줄 수 있다.”
-‘여행의 예술’ 의 작가, 알라인 드 보톤

story:
Triple Usage™ : le papier cadeau le plus réactionnaire au monde


Vous n’en avez jamais assez des textes de Mathieu Bock-Côté, Richard Martineau et Christian Rioux? Sylvain Bouchard et Jeff Fillion ne sont pas suffisamment en ondes à votre goût? Éric Duhaime devrait publier plus souvent des statuts Facebook rigolos?

En partenariat avec HYPRACTIF et Navet Média, Edouard et Théophile unissent leurs biceps d’hommes blancs hétérosexuels catho-laïc pour vous proposer un papier cadeau qui saura combler vos pulsions réactionnaires.


LA BELLE VIE

Imprimé sur du papier kraft recyclé à 100% et ne contenant aucune trace de noix, d’arachides ou d’Amir Khadir, ce papier cadeau emballe vos bébelles dans l'imbécillité et la mauvaise foi caractéristique des professionnels du «gros bon sens», du «c’était mieux avant» et du «j’suis pas homophobe, j’ai un ami gai».

Puisque le papier d’emballage classique manque de citations incendiaires sur les femmes, les immigrants et les BS, voici le papier cadeau Triple Usage™ . Oui oui, Triple Usage™ :

1- Rigolez en emballant vos cadeaux.

2- Rigolez en déballant vos cadeaux.

3- Faites-vous du bien en déchirant violemment ce tapis de citations toxiques.

Avec de l'imagination, vous trouverez probablement d’autres usages imprévus, comme «faire des boulettes», «partir un osti de gros feu» ou «se torcher avec».


DONC, T’ES POUR LES GAZ DE SCHISTE?

Non, mais on s’occupe de la préparation, de la production, de l’emballage, de l’expédition et, bien sûr, du design*.

En échange de la rondelette somme de 20$ (pour les 100 premiers acheteurs) et 23$ (pour les suivants), vous recevrez par la poste, au moins 10 jours avant Noël, 10 pieds de Triple Usage™, votre nouveau papier cadeau préféré. Nous pouvons en faire aussi de 20 pieds de longueur.

10 pieds, c’est l’équivalent d’un Michael Jordan et demi. C’est aussi l’équivalent de deux fois cinq pieds, ou cinq fois deux pieds, soit une longueur suffisante pour :

  • Emballer une dizaine de cadeaux de taille variable

  • Emballer une quinzaine de cadeaux de taille variable, mais un peu plus petits

  • Emballer un arbre

  • Emballer deux arbres

  • Pas emballer une planche à voile

L’offre est réservée aux résidants du Québec ayant de l’humour. Des frais de livraison supplémentaires seront demandés si vous ne résidez pas au Québec, ou si vous n’avez pas d’humour (prenez l'offre "canada").

*piles non incluses


SÉRIEUSEMENT.

Un imprimeur accepte notre commande si nous sommes capables de réunir un groupe de personnes assez irrévérencieuses pour emballer leurs cadeaux de rhétorique réactionnaire.

On fait ça parce qu’on trouve ça drôle et original. Le ridicule et l’humour sont les meilleures armes contre la rhétorique populiste volontairement simpliste et polarisante qui pollue notre atmosphère sociale. Si t’aimes l’idée, achète un rouleau et/ou partage ça sur les internets. Si t’aimes pas l’idée, achètes-en pas. Voilà.

Partenaires de production:

HYPRACTIF - Agence Digitale

NAVET MÉDIA - Satirique mais poli


Le papier cadeau est fait dans la matière ci-dessous. 100% recyclé. Sur laquelle nous imprimerons les citations en noir, dans un style très similaire à ce que vous voyez au dessus.

story:
Summary

 

This is a project of the heart out of pure love for Leo & Mo, our two seahorses. We are seeking funding for their care and preservation.

Why Leo & Mo? Leo stands for Leopold and Mo for Mozart. These names were given to them by a guest during one of the marvelous weddings held at Schloss Leopoldskron. The names simply stuck.

Ok, now some fun facts:

  • Leo & Mo were created by their father, theater impresario Max Reinhardt. For those who don't know him, he was an incredible actor and director - perhaps the most famous of the Roaring 1920s. Max not only brought Schloss Leopoldskron back to life with lavish renovations and outstanding artwork, but also made the Schloss a center of inspiring celebrations, enchanting theater performances, and legendary parties (you should have seen Marlene Dietrich sing in the Great Hall!).
  • Max created Leo & Mo by collaborating with a local craftsman from Salzburg. 
  • The seahorses are almost 100 years old.
  • Leo & Mo have been guarding the lakeside entrance of the Schloss ever since Max’s tenure. They have observed more happy couples getting married than any other seahorses in the world.

  • Remember the scene when Maria and the children fall out of the boat and into the lake? If you haven't already watched the video above, you should probably do it right now (no worries, we'll wait...). 


Why do we need you?

 

It's pretty simple: with a great Schloss comes great responsibility and maintaining a masterpiece isn’t cheap. We'd like your help with one of the property's most beautiful details, Leo & Mo.

With the generosity of donors funding the renovation of our discus throwers, we are seeking to give Leo & Mo the same attention. From their iconic presence in The Sound of Music to their quiet grandeur today, a gift from you would ensure their legacy, indeed even their survival.

You can help to end their state of deterioration today and make them fit for the next 100 years by donating $10, $50, $100 or more - every Dollar, Euro, Yen or Pound helps!

 

 

    How is it done?

     

    A team of specialists will repair and restore the seahorses to their original splendor.

    Sand blasting provides the most effective method of cleaning their delicate surfaces without the use of chemicals or risk of damage. Years of atmospheric carbon and grime build-up will be "blasted" away.
     

    Why the Seahorses?

    So why the heck are we collecting money for two geriatric seahorses, rather than the really important stuff, like fixing the roof of the Schloss or renovating paintings? Well, there are two simple and honest reasons:

    1. We want to learn how crowdfunding is done well and thought that Leo & Mo are cute enough to convince you to donate a few bucks.
    2. We want to shamelessly exploit the opportunity to do something good on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of The Sound of Music (who wouldn't?).
       
       

      Other ways to help Leo & Mo

       

      If you cannot make a donation, you can still help us by sharing this campaign with your friends - especially all those die-hard Sound of Music fans! 

      As Baroness Schräder famously said in the film, "There's nothing more irresistible to a man than a woman who's in love with him". But in fact there's nothing more irresistible to a true fan than the unconditional gratitude and love of two seahorses after renovation.

      In the meantime, we say so long, farewell, auf Wiedersehen, good bye!

Max created Leo & Mo by collaborating with a local craftsman from Salzburg.

It's pretty simple: with a great Schloss comes great responsibility and maintaining a masterpiece isn’t cheap. We'd like your help with one of the property's most beautiful details, Leo & Mo.
With the generosity of donors funding the renovation of our discus throwers, we are seeking to give Leo & Mo the same attention. From their iconic presence in The Sound of Music to their quiet grandeur today, a gift from you would ensure their legacy, indeed even their survival.
You can help to end their state of deterioration today and make them fit for the next 100 years by donating $10, $50, $100 or more - every Dollar, Euro, Yen or Pound helps!
 
 


How is it done?
 
A team of specialists will repair and restore the seahorses to their original splendor.
Sand blasting provides the most effective method of cleaning their delicate surfaces without the use of chemicals or risk of damage. Years of atmospheric carbon and grime build-up will be "blasted" away. 

Why the Seahorses?
So why the heck are we collecting money for two geriatric seahorses, rather than the really important stuff, like fixing the roof of the Schloss or renovating paintings? Well, there are two simple and honest reasons:

We want to learn how crowdfunding is done well and thought that Leo & Mo are cute enough to convince you to donate a few bucks.
We want to shamelessly exploit the opportunity to do something good on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of The Sound of Music (who wouldn't?). 


 

Other ways to help Leo & Mo
 
If you cannot make a donation, you can still help us by sharing this campaign with your friends - especially all those die-hard Sound of Music fans! 
As Baroness Schräder famously said in the film, "There's nothing more irresistible to a man than a woman who's in love with him". But in fact there's nothing more irresistible to a true fan than the unconditional gratitude and love of two seahorses after renovation.
In the meantime, we say so long, farewell, auf Wiedersehen, good bye!

story:
"Jillian, it's time.  You're not getting any younger." - My loving mom :-)

My mom made this comment after one of my usual self-sabotaging moments. I have always dreamed of sharing my poetry and was about to chicken out (once again) from a great opportunity...until that kick in the pants comment.  Now, I'm going after and checking off some pretty cool items on my buck list: 

  1. Perform poetry in front of actual people
  2. Compete for and win a spot on Detroit's poetry slam team (bonus: become Detroit's 2015 Grand Slam Champion)
  3. Compete in the 2015 National Poetry Slam in Oakland, California
  4. Compete in the 2016 Women of the World Poetry Slam
  5. Compete in the 2016 Individual World Poetry Slam

WHAT'S SLAM POETRY (and why do I need to raise money)?  

Slam poetry is competitive performance poetry that allows individuals and/or teams to share their writing in a creative, yet  powerful way.

National competitions have several costs associated with them, especially if a person competes individually and with a team...which I will be doing both:  As a team member of Detroit's 2015 Poetry Slam Team, I am responsible for raising money toward our $5,000 fundraising goal to participate in the 2015 National Poetry Slam.  As an individual, I'm fundraising to ensure my participation in two national competitions next year, the 2016 Women of the World Poetry Slam and 2016 Individual World Poetry Slam.

I've set my fundraising goal at $2,500.00.  Take a gander at my costs for just this year's national slam competition:

Hotel

$150 per night @6 nights

$750

Flight

DTW to OAK

$557

Registration

$575 per team

$115

Subtotal

$1422


WHAT AM I POLITELY ASKING FOR?

A donation of any amount.  Any donation(s) you provide will be greatly appreciated and go directly toward costs associated with my participation in the 2015 National Poetry Slam (NPS), the 2016 Women of the World Poetry Slam, and the 2016 Individual World Poetry Slam.

A couple questions that may be on your mind:
  1. How will I divide funds among the competitions?  1/3 of monies raised will go toward covering costs for the National Poetry Slam (NPS) competition.  The rest of the money will go toward  the 2016 Women of the World and Individual World Poetry Slams.
  2. if I exceed my goal of $2,500?  Yippee!  First, I'll do a happy dance at turbo speed!  Then, I'll donate those additional funds to the annual Kids-TALK Poetry Slam.  The slam provides a safe space and outlet for youth to speak out for those affected by trauma.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't contribute financially, I understand.  A kind message, sharing this campaign with others, or sending spirit fingers from afar, is needed just as much.  Thank you in advance for sharing what you can!
